'''Marko Arnautović''' ({{IPA-de|ˈmaʁkoː aʁˈnaʊtovɪtʃ}}; {{lang-sr-cyr|Марко Арнаутовић}}, {{IPA-sh|mâːrko arnǎutoʋitɕ|pron}}; born 19 April 1989) is an Austrian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[Austria national football team|Austrian national team]].
Arnautović began his career in his native Austria playing in the youth teams for a number of clubs in the [[Vienna]] area before he signed a contract with Dutch club [[FC Twente|Twente]] in 2006. He impressed at [[De Grolsch Veste]] and after a fine [[2008–09 Eredivisie|2008–09]] season he joined Italian giants [[Inter Milan]] on loan, where he made only three appearances due to injury. He joined German side [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in June 2010 and became a regular member of the first team. In September 2013, Arnautović joined English side [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]]. He spent four seasons in Stoke scoring 26 goals in 145 appearances. He joined [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in July 2017 for a fee of £20 million.
A full international for [[Austria national football team|Austria]] since 2008, he helped the nation to qualify for [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Background== Arnautović was born in [[Floridsdorf]], a district in the northern part of [[Vienna]] to a Serbian father and an Austrian mother.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.austriantimes.at/index.php?id=13493 |title=Ivanschitz left off squad for Serbia clash |accessdate=8 August 2009 |work=[[Austrian Times]] |date=26 May 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.austriantimes.at/index.php?id=13493 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
==Club career== ===Early career=== Arnautović began his career with his brother Danijel at [[FAC Team für Wien|Floridsdorfer AC]]. In 1998, he joined [[FK Austria Wien]] but behaviour issues saw him change club regularly as in the next six years he played for [[First Vienna FC|First Vienna FC 1894]], a second spell at FK Austria Wien, [[SK Rapid Wien]] before he returned to Floridsdorfer AC.<ref>{{cite web|title=Austria's wayward son|url=http://espnfc.com/columns/story/_/id/897635/andy-brassell-on-austria-starlet-marko-arnautovic?cc=5739|publisher=[[ESPN]] | date = 23 March 2011 | accessdate = 4 May 2014 | first = Andy | last = Brassell}}</ref> Despite this he was scouted by Dutch club [[FC Twente]] who signed him in 2006.<ref>{{cite web|title=Werder verstärkt sich mit Arnautovic|trans-title=Werder reinforced with Arnautovic|language=de|date=4 June 2010|accessdate=4 June 2010|publisher=[[Deutsche Fußball Liga|DFL]]|url= http://www.bundesliga.de/de/liga/news/2009/werder-verstaerkt-sich-mit-arnautovic_0000154935.php}}</ref>
===Twente=== Arnautović scored 22 goals in 24 matches for the Under-19 FC Twente in the 2007–08 season, helping them win the youth championship. He then played for [[Jong FC Twente]] between 2006 and 2008, appearing in 32 matches and scoring 27 goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://derstandard.at/1246543874097/Portraet-In-drei-Jahren-vom-Kaefig-nach-San-Siro|title=In drei Jahren vom "Käfig" nach San Siro|language= de |publisher=[[Der Standard]]|date=5 August 2009 | accessdate = 4 May 2014}}</ref> Arnautović made his professional debut for [[FC Twente]] in the 2006–07 season as a substitute for [[Kennedy Bakircioglu]] against [[PSV Eindhoven]] in April 2007. In July 2008, he extended his contract with Twente despite interest from Dutch giants [[Feyenoord]].<ref>{{cite news|newspaper=[[De Telegraaf]] |language=nl |url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/telesport/voetbal/1488443/__Arnautovic_blijft_bij_Twente__.html |title=Arnautovic blijft bij Twente |trans-title=Arnautovic stays with Twente |accessdate=14 June 2010 |date=14 July 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.telegraaf.nl/telesport/voetbal/1488443/__Arnautovic_blijft_bij_Twente__.html?p=6%2C1 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
He made 16 appearances in [[2007–08 Eredivisie|2007–08]] as Twente finished in fourth position and qualified for the [[UEFA Champions League]]. In the [[2008–09 Eredivisie|2008–09]] season Arnautović scored 14 goals in 41 matches as Twente finished 2nd in the [[Eredivisie]] and reached the knock out phase of the [[UEFA Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|work=[[Offside (magazine)|The Offside]] |title=Name To Remember: Marko Arnautovic |url=http://www.theoffside.com/world-football/name-to-remember-marko-arnautovic.html |accessdate=3 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.theoffside.com/world-football/name-to-remember-marko-arnautovic.html |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In March 2009 after a league match against [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]], one of Twente opponents, [[Ibrahim Kargbo]], accused Arnautović of racially abusing him.<ref>{{cite web|title=Racism in Holland: "[Marko Arnautovic] called me a nigger" – Ibrahim Kargbo |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/140517-racism-in-holland-marko-arnautovic-called-me-a-nigger-ibrahim-kargbo |work=[[Bleacher Report]] |accessdate=3 September 2013 |author=Ronaldo Assis de Moreira |date=17 March 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://bleacherreport.com/articles/140517-racism-in-holland-marko-arnautovic-called-me-a-nigger-ibrahim-kargbo |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> After an investigation by the [[KNVB|Dutch Football Association]] they found no evidence against him and the case was dismissed.<ref>{{cite web|title=Arnautovic innocent of racism |url=http://austriantimes.at/?id=11996-newentry |work=Austrian Times |accessdate=3 September 2013 |date=24 March 2009 |first=Thomas |last=Hochwarter |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://austriantimes.at/?id=11996-newentry |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
====Inter Milan (loan)==== On 4 August 2009, it was said that Arnautović was on the verge of a move to Italian giants [[Inter Milan]]. The deal had been largely held up due to a stress fracture in Arnautović's right foot, leading to a re-negotiation of the deal between the clubs.<ref>{{cite web|date=6 August 2009 |accessdate=6 August 2009 |url=http://www.espnstar.com/football/serie-a/news/detail/item302920/Arnautovic-set-for-Inter-switch |title=Arnautovic set for inter switch |publisher=[[ESPN Star]] |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120729164353/http://www.espnstar.com/football/serie-a/news/detail/item302920/Arnautovic-set-for-Inter-switch |archivedate=29 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> On 6 August, it was announced by Twente that the details for the loan had been finalised, Arnautović would join Inter on loan for the season. The deal was said to become permanent if he was to play a set number of matches. If the deal did not become permanent the player would return to Twente on a pre-agreed contract of two years, with an option to extend the contract for a third year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fctwente.com/en/news/index.php?item=8787 |title=Arnautovic signs for Inter |publisher=[[FC Twente]] |accessdate=6 August 2009 |date=6 August 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.fctwente.com/en/news/index.php?item=8787 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He made his unofficial debut for Inter in a friendly match on 5 September 2009 against Swiss team, [[FC Lugano|Lugano]], the final score was 3–3.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://inter.theoffside.com/international-duty/inter-3-3-lugano.html |title=Inter 3–3 Lugano |publisher=The Offside |accessdate=25 September 2009 |date=5 September 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://inter.theoffside.com/international-duty/inter-3-3-lugano.html |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
He made his league debut in a 1–0 away victory against [[A.C. Chievo Verona|Chievo]] on 6 January 2010.<ref>{{cite web|title=Chievo-Inter: 0–1, Winter Champions |url=http://www.inter.it/it/news/46908 |language=Italian |work=Inter |date=6 January 2010 |accessdate=3 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.inter.it/it/news/46908 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He played in their next match against [[A.C. Siena|Siena]] coming on as a substitute at half time for the injured [[Dejan Stanković]] and helped Inter to win the match 4–3.<ref>{{cite web|title=L'evoluzione di Arnautovic: Mou oggi si fida di lui |trans-title=The evolution of Arnautovic: Mou now trusts him |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/inter/?action=read&idnet=ZmNpbnRlcm5ld3MuaXQtMTI1OTk |work=tuttomercatoweb.com |accessdate=3 September 2013 |date=10 January 2010 |language=Italian |first=Fabio |last=Costantino |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/inter/?action=read&idnet=ZmNpbnRlcm5ld3MuaXQtMTI1OTk |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He played one more match for Inter against [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] on 24 April 2010. At the end of the season Inter decided against turning his loan in a permanent move and [[José Mourinho]] stated that Arnautović "is a fantastic person but has the attitude of a child".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/de/news/843/serie-a/2010/01/05/1727328/mourinho-arnautovic-hat-die-einstellung-eines-kindes |title=Mourinho: "Arnautovic hat die Einstellung eines Kindes" |publisher=Goal.com |language=de |date=5 January 2010 |accessdate=11 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.goal.com/de/news/843/serie-a/2010/01/05/1727328/mourinho-arnautovic-hat-die-einstellung-eines-kindes |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Werder Bremen=== [[File:Marko Arnautovic 2010.jpg|thumb|upright|Arnautović training with [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in 2010]]
On 4 June 2010, German [[Bundesliga]] club [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] confirmed that they had signed Arnautović from Twente on a four-year deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.werder.de/de/profis/news/13902.php|title=Perfekt: Stürmer Arnautovic wird Werderaner|trans-title=Perfect: Forward Arnautovic comes to Werder|accessdate=14 June 2010|date=4 June 2010|language=de|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140504230230/http://www.werder.de/de/profis/news/13902.php|archivedate=4 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.fctwente.nl/blog/2010/06/arnautovic-naar-werder-bremen/|title=Arnautovic naar Werder Bremen|date=4 June 2010|accessdate=4 May 2014|work=FC Twente|language=Dutch|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140505003058/http://www.fctwente.nl/blog/2010/06/arnautovic-naar-werder-bremen/|archive-date=5 May 2014|dead-url=yes}}</ref> Before he had played a match for Bremen he irked their captain [[Torsten Frings]] who branded him as "arrogant".<ref>{{cite web|title=Bundesliga – Frings attacks 'arrogant' Arnautovic |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/05082010/58/bundesliga-frings-attacks-arrogant-arnautovic.html |work=[[Eurosport]] |accessdate=6 September 2013 |date=5 August 2010 |language=de |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/05082010/58/bundesliga-frings-attacks-arrogant-arnautovic.html |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He made his Bundesliga debut on 21 August 2010 in a 4–1 defeat against [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Hoffenheim 4–1 Werder Bremen |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/21/germany/bundesliga/tsg-1899-hoffenheim-ev/sv-werder-bremen/958439/ |work=Soccerway |accessdate=6 September 2013 |date=21 August 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100821191632/http://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/21/germany/bundesliga/tsg-1899-hoffenheim-ev/sv-werder-bremen/958439/ |archivedate=21 August 2010 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Arnautović scored twice against [[1. FC Köln]] on 28 August 2010, his first goals for Bremen.<ref>{{cite web|title=Werder Bremen 4–2 Koln |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/28/germany/bundesliga/sv-werder-bremen/1-fc-koln/958448/ |work=Soccerway |date=28 August 2010 |accessdate=6 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/28/germany/bundesliga/sv-werder-bremen/1-fc-koln/958448/ |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He ended the [[2010–11 Bundesliga|2010–11]] season at the [[Weserstadion]] with five goals in 34 appearances as Bremen finished in 13th position and he also played in the [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} In [[2011–12 SV Werder Bremen season|2011–12]] he scored six goals in 20 appearances as Bremen finished in ninth position in the Bundesliga.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} In March 2012, he was ruled out for two months with a knee ligament injury he suffered whilst playing with his dog.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bundesliga – Arnautovic tears ligament in game with dog |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/08032012/58/bundesliga-arnautovic-tears-ligament-game-dog.html |work=Eurosport |date=8 March 2013 |accessdate=4 May 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/08032012/58/bundesliga-arnautovic-tears-ligament-game-dog.html |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
In [[2012–13 Bundesliga|2012–13]], Arnautović played in 27 matches and scored five goals which included a hat-trick on 2 December 2012 away at [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]], including an impressive free kick, as Bremen won 4–1.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://espnfc.com/us/en/report/346277/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901|title=TSG Hoffenheim 1–4 Werder Bremen|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|date=2 December 2012 | accessdate = 4 May 2014}}</ref> In April 2013, Arnautović and his Bremen teammate [[Eljero Elia]] were caught speeding and were both suspended by the club.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bundesliga: Marko Arnautovic keen to put a 'big mistake' behind him |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11888/8813229/bundesliga-marko-arnautovic-keen-to-put-a-big-mistake-behind-him |work=Sky Sports |accessdate=3 September 2013 |date=8 July 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11888/8813229/bundesliga-marko-arnautovic-keen-to-put-a-big-mistake-behind-him |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Stoke City=== On 2 September 2013, Arnautović joined [[Premier League]] side [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on a four-year contract for a fee of £2 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Marko Arnautovic: Stoke City sign Austria winger on four-year deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23925792 |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=2 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23925792 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Welcoming Marko |url=http://www.stokecityfc.com/news/article/welcoming-marko-1029278.aspx |work=Stoke City F.C |date=2 September 2013 |accessdate=2 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.stokecityfc.com/news/article/welcoming-marko-1029278.aspx |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He was assigned the number 10 shirt by manager [[Mark Hughes]] who also described his signing as a coup—"People will very quickly see what an outstanding talent he is. In terms of his power and his pace, which is something I think we need in the squad, he ticks all the boxes. Technically he's excellent and I'm really looking forward to working with him. I think it's quite a coup to get him here. It made sense to us and made sense to him that this is the right club for him. He's got a real desire to make an impression."<ref>{{cite web|title=New signings receive squad numbers |url=http://www.stoke.vitalfootball.co.uk/article.asp?a=331452 |work=Vital Stoke |accessdate=6 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.stoke.vitalfootball.co.uk/article.asp?a=331452 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Marko Arnautovic on a mission to make an impact |url=http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/story-19761208-detail/story.html|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=6 September 2013 |accessdate=6 September 2013 |df= }}{{dead link|date=January 2018|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> Arnautović made his Stoke debut twelve days later in a 0–0 draw against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at the [[Bet365 Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 0–0 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23999231 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2013 |first=Owen |last=Phillips |accessdate=14 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23999231 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> After spending a month at the club, manager Hughes stated that Arnautović had adapted well to English football after being give a free-role in the side.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mark Hughes: Marko Arnautovic has been great at Stoke City |url=http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/Mark-Hughes-Marko-Arnautovic-great-Stoke-City/story-19885257-detail/story.html |work=The Sentinel |accessdate=14 October 2013 |date=4 October 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/Mark-Hughes-Marko-Arnautovic-great-Stoke-City/story-19885257-detail/story.html |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke City: Why Marko Arnautovic loves his 'Freigeists' role |work=The Sentinel |accessdate=14 October 2013 |url=http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/Stoke-City-Marko-Arnautovic-loves-Freigeists-role/story-19908326-detail/story.html |first=Martin |last=Spinks |date=9 October 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140319023532/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Marko-Arnautovic-loves-Freigeists-role/story-19908326-detail/story.html |archivedate=19 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> On 26 October, he scored his first goal for Stoke, a 25-yard free-kick in a 3–2 defeat against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Man United 3–2 Stoke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24591160 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 October 2013 |accessdate=26 October 2013 |first=Chris |last=Bevan |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131026194204/http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24591160 |archivedate=26 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Arnautović ended his first season in England with five goals in 35 appearances, and the team finished in ninth position in the Premier League.<ref name="2013/14"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Get used to clubs sniffing round Marko Arnautovic and Co|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-used-clubs-sniffing-round-Marko/story-21105560-detail/story.html?|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=17 May 2014|accessdate=17 May 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140517121817/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-used-clubs-sniffing-round-Marko/story-21105560-detail/story.html|archivedate=17 May 2014}}</ref>
After making little impact in the first few matches of the [[2014–15 Stoke City F.C. season|2014–15]] season, Arnautović lost his place in the side.<ref>{{cite web | title = Marko Arnautovic reveals talks with Mark Hughes about playing time | url = http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Marko-Arnautovic-reveals-talks-Mark/story-24529154-detail/story.html| website = Stoke Sentinel | date = 14 November 2014 | accessdate = 8 November 2015 | first = Pete | last = Smith | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150930005806/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Marko-Arnautovic-reveals-talks-Mark/story-24529154-detail/story.html | archivedate = 30 September 2015 | df = dmy-all }}</ref> He regained his form towards the end of the campaign and returned to a regular place.<ref>{{cite web | title = Marko Arnautovic insists his future lies at the Britannia Stadium | url = http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Marko-Arnautovic-insists-future-lies/story-26371707-detail/story.html | website = Stoke Sentinel | date = 22 April 2015 | accessdate = 8 November 2015 | first = Rich | last = Sharpe | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150721110105/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Marko-Arnautovic-insists-future-lies/story-26371707-detail/story.html | archivedate = 21 July 2015 | df = dmy-all }}</ref> He scored once in 29 league appearances over the campaign: a 95th-minute equaliser against West Ham United on 11 April 2015, having earlier in the match had two goals disallowed for offside.<ref>{{cite web|title=West Ham 1–1 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32179965|publisher=BBC Sport | date = 11 April 2015 | accessdate = 8 November 2015 | first = Tim | last = Oscroft}}</ref> He played 35 times in 2014–15 season as Stoke finished in ninth position.<ref name="2014/15"/>
Arnautović's first appearance of the [[2015–16 Stoke City F.C. season|2015–16 season]] came in a 2–2 draw with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]] on 15 August, scoring the team's first goal as they came back from 2–0 down.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33832169|title=Tottenham 2–2 Stoke|date=15 August 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 8 November 2015 | first = Timothy | last = Abraham}}</ref> He scored the only goal of Stoke's victory over champions [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 7 November,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34686371|title=Stoke 1–0 Chelsea|date=7 November 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 8 November 2015 | first = Phil | last = McNulty}}</ref> and both goals against Manchester City on 5 December in a 2–0 home victory.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34951742|title=Stoke 2–0 Man City|date=5 December 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 5 December 2015 | first = Chris | last = Osborne}}</ref> On 28 December, Arnautović won a last-minute [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]] against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]] when he was fouled by [[John Stones]], and sent it past goalkeeper [[Tim Howard]] to win the match 4–3.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Reddy|first1=Luke|title=Everton 3–4 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35148469|accessdate=29 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 December 2015}}</ref> He scored the only goal of the League Cup semi-final second leg against Liverpool on 26 January 2016, forcing a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] which his team eventually lost.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ogden|first1=Marc|title=Liverpool vs Stoke match report: Simon Mignolet sends Reds to Wembley after Marc Muniesa misses in sudden death|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/fa-league-cups/liverpool-vs-stoke-match-report-simon-mignolet-sends-reds-to-wembley-after-marc-muniesa-misses-in-a6835741.html|accessdate=27 January 2016|work=The Independent|date=26 January 2016}}</ref> Arnautović went on to play 40 times for Stoke in 2015–16, finishing as the top scorer with 12 goals as the Potters again finished in ninth position.<ref name="2015/16"/>
Arnautović signed a new four-year contract with Stoke in July 2016, keeping him contracted with the Potters until the summer of 2020.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Charles|first1=Andy|title=Stoke City's Marko Arnautovic signs new four-year contract|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11701/10514311/stoke-citys-marko-arnautovic-signs-new-four-year-contract?|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=27 July 2016}}</ref> Arnautović made 35 appearances in [[2016–17 Stoke City F.C. season|2016–17]], as Stoke finished in 13th position.<ref name="2016/17"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 2016/17 Premier League season review|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11701/10887143/stoke-201617-premier-league-season-review|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=22 May 2017}}</ref> He scored seven goals including braces against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] and [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland 1–3 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38539374|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 2–0 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39086670|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 May 2017}}</ref>
Arnautović's future at Stoke was cast in doubt prior to the start of the [[2017–18 Stoke City F.C. season|2017–18]] season after he submitted a transfer request.<ref>{{cite news |title=Marko Arnautovic: Stoke reject bid from West Ham for Austria forward |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40588584 |publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 July 2017 |accessdate=23 July 2017}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== [[File:Marko Arnautović West Ham.jpg|thumb|upright|Arnautović training with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2018]]
On 22 July 2017, Arnautović signed for fellow Premier League team [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on a five-year contract for a club record £20 million fee, which could rise to £25 million with add-ons.<ref>{{cite news |title=Marko Arnautovic: West Ham sign Stoke City and Austria forward for £20m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40648924 |publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 July 2017 |accessdate=23 July 2017}}</ref>
He made his debut on 13 August, playing the full 90 minutes of a 4–0 loss to Manchester United at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Burt|first1=Jason|title=Manchester United 4 West Ham 0: Romelu Lukaku scores two as Jose Mourinho's team start the season in style|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/08/13/manchester-united-vs-west-ham-premier-league-watch-live-score/|accessdate=9 December 2017|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=13 August 2017}}</ref> In his next game six days later, he was sent off after 33 minutes for elbowing Southampton's [[Jack Stephens (footballer)|Jack Stephens]] in a 3–2 away loss.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Warrington|first1=Declan|title=Slaven Bilic hails 'spirit' of 10-man West Ham as Marko Arnautovic apologises to fans for Southampton red card|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/southampton-west-ham-slaven-bilic-hails-spirit-marko-arnautovic-apology-fans-red-card-a3615666.html|accessdate=9 December 2017|work=London Evening Standard|date=20 August 2017}}</ref>
In November, new manager [[David Moyes]] said that Arnautović had to work harder and be more of a team player or be dropped.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Steinberg|first1=Jacob|title=David Moyes urges Marko Arnautovic to up his game for West Ham|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/nov/17/david-moyes-marko-arnautovic-west-ham|accessdate=9 December 2017|work=The Guardian|date=17 November 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 9 December, the only one of a win over reigning champions Chelsea at the [[London Stadium]], in what was Moyes' first victory as West Ham manager.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ames|first1=Nick|title=West Ham's Marko Arnautovic sinks Chelsea to delight of David Moyes|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/dec/09/west-ham-united-chelsea-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=9 December 2017|work=The Observer|date=9 December 2017}}</ref> He followed this with a goal in his first return to the [[bet365 Stadium]] in a 0–3 win against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 16 December.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Stoke 0–3 West Ham | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 16 December 2017 | accessdate = 16 December 2017 | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42290587}}</ref> Following his conversion from a winger to a centre-forward at West Ham,<ref>{{cite news |title=Marko Arnautovic: How David Moyes helped one of the Premier League’s great enigmas turn his latest corner|last1=Liew|first1=Jonathan|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/marko-arnautovic-profile-west-ham-stoke-preview-team-news-david-moyes-latest-jonathan-liew-a8305716.html|publisher=Independent|date=16 April 2018|accessdate=15 August 2018}}</ref> Arnautović scored 11 Premier League goals in his first season at the club; his goal against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on the final day of the campaign making him the first West Ham player to reach that figure since [[Bobby Zamora]] in [[2006–07 West Ham United F.C. season|2006–07]].<ref>{{Cite web | title = West Ham United 3–1 Everton | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 13 May 2018 | accessdate = 15 May 2018 | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44020200}}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet|user=OptaJoe |number=995686425663279104 |date=13 May 2018 |title=11 – Marko Arnautovic has scored 11 Premier League goals this season, the most by a West Ham player in a single top-flight campaign since Bobby Zamora in 2006–07 (also 11). Legs. }}</ref> In April 2018, he was named as [[West Ham United F.C.#Hammer of the Year|Hammer of the Year]] for the [[2017–18 West Ham United F.C. season|2017–18 season]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/april/25-april/arnautovic-crowned-betway-hammer-year | title = Arnautovic crowned Betway Hammer of the Year | publisher = West Ham United F.C. | date = 25 April 2018 | access-date = 26 April 2018}}</ref> In January 2019, he was the subject of a £35m transfer offer from a Chinese club, believed to be [[Shanghai SIPG F.C.|Shanghai SIPG]], which his agent and brother, Danijel, said Arnautović wanted West Ham to accept.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46830073 | title = Marko Arnautovic: West Ham forward 'wants club to accept £35m Chinese bid' | website = BBC Sport | date = 10 January 2019 | access-date = 11 January 2019}}</ref> Despite this, on 26 January, Arnautović committed himself to West Ham by signing a contract extension of unspecified length.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47018041 | title = Marko Arnautovic: West Ham striker signs contract extension with Premier League club | website = BBC Sport | date = 26 January 2019 | access-date = 27 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:20130814 AT-GR Marko Arnautovic 2497.jpg|thumb|upright|Arnautović playing for [[Austria national football team|Austria]] in 2013]]
Arnautović played with the Austrian under-19 side in the [[2007 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] where he was sent-off in their second match and failed to make it out of the group stage. After scoring three goals in five matches for the [[Austria national under-21 football team|Austria U21s]], Arnautović earned praise from manager [[Andreas Herzog]] who described him the best Austrian footballer of 30 years.<ref>{{cite web|title=Herzog über Arnautovic: "Bester Spieler der letzten 30 Jahre" |trans-title=Herzog about Arnautovic: "Best player of the past 30 years" |url=http://derstandard.at/1267132294666/Herzog-ueber-Arnautovic-Bester-Spieler-der-letzten-30-Jahre |work=Der Standard |language=de |date=4 March 2010 |accessdate=5 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://derstandard.at/1267132294666/Herzog-ueber-Arnautovic-Bester-Spieler-der-letzten-30-Jahre |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Arnautović played his first match for the [[Austria national football team|Austria]] national senior team on 11 October 2008 against the [[Faroe Islands national football team|Faroe Islands]]. He scored his first goals for Austria in a 3–0 win over [[Azerbaijan national football team|Azerbaijan]] on 8 October 2010.<ref>{{cite web|title=Austria 3–0 Azerbaijan |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/299356/report.html?soccernet=true |publisher=[[ESPN]] |accessdate=5 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://espnfc.com/en/report/299356/report.html?soccernet=true |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Arnautović started in all ten of Austria's matches during their successful [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]] campaign, scoring in a win over [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]] and both fixtures against neighbours [[Liechtenstein national football team|Liechtenstein]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Austria-boss-tells-Marko-Arnautovic/story-27985950-detail/story.html|title=Stoke City: Austria boss tells Marko Arnautovic 'Stoke is not your last stop'|date=14 October 2015|work=The Sentinel|accessdate=8 November 2015|first=Pete|last=Smith|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151117011749/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-Austria-boss-tells-Marko-Arnautovic/story-27985950-detail/story.html|archivedate=17 November 2015}}</ref>
Arnautović started all but one of Austria's [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group D|qualification matches]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], only missing the game against the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] through suspension.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Republic of Ireland v Austria Match Report, 11/06/2017, WC Qualification Europe | first = Patric | last = Ridge | work = Goal.com | date = 11 June 2017 | accessdate = 4 July 2018 | url = http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/republic-of-ireland-v-austria/7t31kmcv9nz066th7snrc66zt}}</ref> He scored four goals in the 10 games, but Austria's fourth-place finish would not be enough for qualification.<ref>{{Cite web | title = 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ – Qualifiers – Europe | publisher = FIFA | accessdate = 4 July 2018 | url = https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/europe/group=276493/index.html}}</ref><ref name=NFT/>
==Personal life== Arnautović is an [[Serbian Orthodox Church|Orthodox Christian]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Marko Arnautović sa tri prsta na grudima tokom intoniranja "Bože pravde"!|date=10 October 2016|publisher=[[Radio Television of Serbia]]|url=http://www.rts.rs/page/sport/sr/story/36/fudbal/2483174/marko-arnautovic-sa-tri-prsta-na-grudima-tokom-intoniranja-boze-pravde.html}}</ref> He is married to Sarah (née Lizakowski), and together they have two daughters, Emilia and Alicia.<ref>{{cite news|last=Balczuweit |first=Markus |title=So lief seine Traumhochzeit |trans-title=This was his dream wedding |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/marko-arnautovic/so-lief-seine-traumhochzeit-24560526.bild.html |work=[[Bild]] |date=8 June 2012 |language=de |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/marko-arnautovic/so-lief-seine-traumhochzeit-24560526.bild.html|archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Fußballer Marko Arnautovic zeigt erstmals sein Baby |trans-title=Football player Marko Arnautovic shows his baby for the first time |date=8 September 2012 |url=http://www.krone.at/Stars-Society/Fussballer_Marko_Arnautovic_zeigt_erstmals_sein_Baby-Liebevoller_Vater-Story-333324 |publisher=Krone.at|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.krone.at/Stars-Society/Fussballer_Marko_Arnautovic_zeigt_erstmals_sein_Baby-Liebevoller_Vater-Story-333324 |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> During his time spent in Italy and Germany, Arnautović developed a bad reputation with the media and is viewed by them as "the bad boy of Austrian football". Speaking on the matter in October 2013, he admitted he is "not an angel" but insists the birth of his daughter has made him "grow up."<ref>{{cite news|last=Percy |first=John |title=Stoke City's Marko Arnautovic, friend of Mario Balotelli, admits he is 'not an angel' but insists he has grown up |work=[[Telegraph Media Group|The Telegraph]] |date=17 October 2013 |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/stoke-city/10387084/Stoke-Citys-Marko-Arnautovic-friend-of-Mario-Balotelli-admits-he-is-not-an-angel-but-insists-he-has-grown-up.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201194141/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/stoke-city/10387084/Stoke-Citys-Marko-Arnautovic-friend-of-Mario-Balotelli-admits-he-is-not-an-angel-but-insists-he-has-grown-up.html |archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>

Lazio|Lazio]] | caps2 = 137 | goals2 = 25 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps3 = 31 | goals3 = 8 | nationalyears1 = 2010 | nationalteam1 = [[Brazil national under-17 football team|Brazil U17]] | nationalcaps1 = | nationalgoals1 = | nationalyears2 = 2011–2013 | nationalteam2 = [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2014 | nationalteam3 = [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil U23]] | nationalcaps3 = 2 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2015– | nationalteam4 = [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] | nationalcaps4 = 1 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 17:28, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 15 June 2015 | medaltemplates = {{MedalCompetition|[[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]]}} {{MedalGold|[[2016 Summer Olympics|2016 Rio de Janeiro]]|[[Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|Team]]}} }} '''Felipe Anderson Pereira Gomes''' (born 15 April 1993), known as '''Felipe Anderson''', is a Brazilian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for English {{English football updater|WestHamU}} club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[Brazil national football team|Brazil national team]].
==Early and personal life== Felipe Anderson was the youngest of five children in a poor family.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47240426|title=Felipe Anderson: West Ham midfielder on family, humble origins and his friend Neymar|date=21 February 2019|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Early career=== Felipe Anderson began his career in Associação 14 Companhia de Polícia Militar Independente (CPMIND), in his hometown of [[Santa Maria, Federal District|Santa Maria]], [[Federal District (Brazil)|Distrito Federal]] at 6 years old. In 2006, he was moved to Federal FC, and later to Sport Clube Recreativo Gaminha FC. After some impressive performances on the club, he was moved to [[Paraná (state)|Paraná]] to play for Astral EC, finishing the year. In 2007, he was moved to [[Coritiba FC|Coritiba]] youth side, and then in 2007 summer he was moved to [[Santos FC|Santos]].<ref>[http://www.felipeanderson.com.br/ Felipe Anderson's official website]; FelipeAnderson.com.br {{pt icon}}</ref>
===Santos=== Felipe Anderson then played for Santos' youth categories, and was promoted to the senior squad following a rash of injuries in October 2010.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=Yahoo! Brasil Notícias|title=Felipe Anderson sobre o clássico: Estava doido para entrar|url=http://br.noticias.yahoo.com/s/03102010/85/esportes-felipe-anderson-classico-doido-entrar.html|language=Portuguese|date=3 October 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120709143657/http://br.noticias.yahoo.com/s/03102010/85/esportes-felipe-anderson-classico-doido-entrar.html|archivedate=9 July 2012|df=}}</ref> He began training with the senior side and signed a professional contract until July 2013.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=Globo Esporte|title='Tenho o estilo do Ganso', diz Felipe Anderson, nova promessa da Vila|author=Tiago Leme|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/times/santos/noticia/2010/10/tenho-o-estilo-do-ganso-diz-felipe-anderson-nova-promessa-da-vila.html|language=Portuguese|date=6 October 2010}}</ref> He made his debut for [[Santos FC|Santos]] on 6 October 2010 as a 90th-minute substitute in a 3–0 win against [[Fluminense Football Club|Fluminense]].<ref>[http://globoesporte.globo.com/jogo/brasileirao2010/2010-10-06/fluminense-santos.html Nem Fred nem Neymar: Zé Love brilha, faz três, e Santos bate o Flu (Neither Fred nor Neymar: Zé Love shines, scores three and Santos beats Flu)]; Globoesporte.com, 6 October 2010 {{pt icon}}</ref>
His first goal of his footballing career came on 11 February 2011, when Felipe came off the bench at half time to replace [[Keirrison]] against [[Esporte Clube Noroeste|Noroeste]], scoring from a long range shot in the 70th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/02/12/brazil/paulista-a1/santos-futebol-clube-sao-paulo/esporte-clube-noroeste/1046381/|title=Santos 2–0 Noroeste|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=6 February 2017}}</ref> On 7 September, he scored his first league goal, against [[Avaí Futebol Clube|Avaí]].<ref>[http://globoesporte.globo.com/jogo/brasileirao2011/07-09-2011/avai-santos.html FELIPE ANDERSON SAI DO BANCO E AJUDA O SANTOS A VIRAR JOGO SOBRE O AVAÍ (FELIPE ANDERSON LEAVES THE BENCH AND HELP SANTOS TO COMEBACK OVER AVAÍ)]; Globoesporte.com, 7 November 2011 {{pt icon}}</ref> In November, he signed a new contract with Santos, running until 2016.<ref>[http://placar.abril.com.br/brasileiro/santos/felipe-anderson/noticias/novo-menino-da-vila-felipe-anderson-chega-a-acordo-e-renova-com-o-santos.html Novo “Menino da Vila”, Felipe Anderson chega a acordo e renova com o Santos (New "Menino da Vila", Felipe Anderson reaches an agreement and renews with Santos)]; Placar, 5 November 2011 {{pt icon}}</ref>
In his following season, Felipe Anderson had more chances in first team alongside [[Neymar]], due to [[Paulo Henrique Ganso|Ganso]]'s injuries and [[Elano]]'s poor form (both players left Santos in the middle of the season). On 9 February 2012, he scored his first goal of the season, against [[Botafogo Futebol Clube (SP)|Botafogo-SP]].<ref>[http://www.lancenet.com.br/santos/Neymar-Santos-vence-Botafogo_0_643135909.html Neymar faz três e comanda a goleada do Santos sobre Botafogo-SP (Neymar scores thrice and lead Santos'thrashing victory over Botafogo-SP)]; Lance!Net, 9 February 2012 {{pt icon}}</ref>
On the 31 January 2013, the agreed transfer to the Italian club [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]] for €7.5 million failed due to late arrival of a necessary international fax from Brazil to close the deal.<ref>[http://forzaitalianfootball.com/2013/01/felipe-anderson-andrea-poli-deals-fall-through/ Felipe Anderson & Andrea Poli Deals Fall Through]; forzaitalianfootball.com, 31 January 2013</ref>
===Lazio=== On 25 June 2013, Lazio agreed a [[Euro|€]]7.8 million fee with Santos,<ref>[http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/times/santos/noticia/2013/06/santos-acerta-transferencia-de-felipe-anderson-para-lazio-por-r-xx.html Santos acerta transferência de Felipe Anderson para o Lazio por € 7,8 mi (Santos closes transfer of Felipe Anderson to Lazio for € 7.8m)]; Globo Esporte, 25 June 2013 {{pt icon}}</ref> and Felipe Anderson signed a five-year deal worth €800,000 a year. Santos received 50% of the transfer sum and the third part owner [[Doyen Sports]] would get the rest.<ref>[http://forzaitalianfootball.com/2013/06/agreement-finally-reached-for-felipe-anderson/ Lazio Reach Deal For Felipe Anderson]; Forza Italia Football, 26 June 2013</ref> Lazio's sporting director Igli Tare criticized the third part owner Doyen Sports for numerous times delaying the transfer, “It will remain in history as the most paradoxical and shocking negotiations I have ever been a part of,” said Tare. “These third party owners changed their minds continually. When we had everything decided, they would start from scratch two hours later. It all happened for a full week, so it felt like being in the Twilight Zone."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.fantamaster.it/news/lazio-pace-fatta-inzaghi-felipe-anderson-si-rivedra-al-fantacalcio/|title=Lazio, pace fatta tra Inzaghi-Felipe Anderson! Si rivedrà al fantacalcio • Ultime Notizie|last=Giannini|first=Amleto|date=2018-02-12|website=FantaMaster News|language=it-IT|access-date=2019-03-16}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== In his [[2014–15 S.S. Lazio season|second season at the club]], Felipe Anderson achieved 10 goals and nine assists in 27 games across all competitions by April 2015.<ref name=samba>{{cite news|last1=Persico|first1=Luca|title=Brazil Head Coach Dunga doesn't want Lazio's Felipe Anderson compared to Cristiano Ronaldo and Neymar|url=http://www.sambafoot.com/en/news/71053_brazil_head_coach_dunga_doesn_t_want_lazio_s_felipe_anderson_compared_to_cristiano_ronaldo_and_neymar.html|accessdate=29 May 2015|work=Sambafoot|date=12 April 2015}}</ref> This included the concluding goal as Lazio defeated [[A.S. Varese 1910|Varese]] 3–0 in the fourth round of [[2014–15 Coppa Italia|the season's]] [[Coppa Italia]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Coppa: Lazio crush Varese|url=http://www.football-italia.net/59461/coppa-lazio-crush-varese|accessdate=29 May 2015|work=Football Italia|date=2 December 2014}}</ref> and an assist in both legs of the tournament's semi-final against holders [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]], the one in the second leg providing the winning goal by [[Senad Lulić]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lazio 1–1 Napoli: Gabbiadini nets precious away goal for Partenopei|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/lazio-vs-napoli/1998270?ICID=RE|accessdate=29 May 2015|work=Goal.com|date=4 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Arrowsmith|first1=Richard|title=Napoli 0–1 Lazio (agg 1–2): Substitute Senad Lulic stuns holders with late winner to set up Coppa Italia final with Juventus|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3030945/Napoli-0-1-Lazio-agg-1-2-Substitute-Senad-Lulic-stuns-holders-late-winner-set-Coppa-Italia-final-Juventus.html|accessdate=29 May 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=8 April 2015}}</ref> In March 2015, Felipe Anderson signed a contract extension at Lazio, renewing his contract until June 2020.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lazio renew Felipe Anderson deal|url=https://www.football-italia.net/64149/lazio-renew-felipe-anderson-deal|accessdate=15 July 2018|work=Football Italia|date=21 March 2015}}</ref> He played the full 120 minutes of [[2015 Coppa Italia Final|the Coppa Italia final]] on 20 May 2015, a 1–2 loss to [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/20-05-2015/juve-infinita-vince-10-coppa-italia-matri-piega-lazio-supplementari-110907305821.shtml|title=Juve infinita, vince la 10ª Coppa Italia: Matri piega la Lazio ai supplementari|trans-title=An infinite Juve wins its 10th Coppa Italia: Matri sinks Lazio in extra-time|publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian|author1=Jacopo Gerna|date=20 May 2015|accessdate=21 May 2015}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== In July, it was announced that Felipe Anderson would not be wearing the number 7 shirt that he had worn in his previous season with Lazio, but that he would instead be awarded the [[Squad number (association football)|number 10 shirt]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.calciomercato.com/news/lazio-felipe-anderson-saluta-la-maglia-numero-7-496977|title=Lazio: Felipe Anderson saluta la maglia numero 7|publisher=CalcioMercato.com|date=23 July 2015|accessdate=6 February 2017}}</ref> On 8 August, Felipe Anderson appeared in Lazio's 2–0 defeat to Juventus in the [[2015 Supercoppa Italiana]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/sport/calcio/serie-a/2015/08/08/news/supercoppa_lazio_juventus-120631891/|title=Juventus-Lazio 2–0, Mandzukic e Dybala decidono la Supercoppa|publisher=La Repubblica|language=Italian|date=8 August 2015|accessdate=6 February 2017}}</ref> On 23 September 2015, Felipe Anderson scored his first goal of [[2015–16 Serie A|the season]] in a 2–0 victory against [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lazio vs. Genoa 2–0|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/23/italy/serie-a/ss-lazio-roma/genoa-cfc/2120422/|accessdate=15 July 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref> After scoring the second goal in a 3–1 [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] win against [[Rosenborg BK|Rosenborg]] on 22 October 2015,<ref>{{cite news|title=Lazio vs. Rosenborg 3–1|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2015/10/22/europe/uefa-cup/ss-lazio-roma/rosenborg-ballklubb/2147216/|accessdate=15 July 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref> Felipe Anderson scored twice in a 3–0 win against [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] three days later.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lazio vs. Torino 3–0|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2015/10/25/italy/serie-a/ss-lazio-roma/torino-fc/2120461/|accessdate=15 July 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref> In February 2016, Lazio publicly denied rumours that [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] had agreed a transfer for Felipe Anderson.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/feb/22/lazio-deny-felipe-anderson-manchester-united|title=Lazio deny Felipe Anderson has agreed to join Manchester United in summer|publisher=The Guardian|date=22 February 2016|accessdate=15 July 2018}}</ref> Felipe Anderson finished [[2015–16 S.S. Lazio season|Lazio's season]] with nine goals in all competitions, coming runner-up to [[Antonio Candreva]] in Lazio's scoring charts for the season.
====2016–17 season==== After being the subject of reported interest from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] during the summer,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/blog/transfer-talk/79/post/2911040/antonio-conte-chelsea-emerge-as-favourites-for-lazio-felipe-anderson|title=Chelsea first for Felipe Anderson, Prem clubs eye William Carvalho|publisher=ESPN|date=11 June 2016|accessdate=15 July 2018}}</ref> Felipe Anderson remained with Lazio. On 26 October 2016, Felipe Anderson scored his first goal of the season, in a 4–1 win against [[Cagliari Calcio|Cagliari]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lazio vs. Cagliari 4–1|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2016/10/26/italy/serie-a/ss-lazio-roma/cagliari-calcio/2305847/|accessdate=15 July 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref> On 7 May 2017, Felipe Anderson scored a penalty in a 7–3 win against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Lazio 7–3 Sampdoria|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39838822|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 May 2017|accessdate=15 July 2018}}</ref> Lazio secured qualification for the Europa League at the end of the season, with Felipe Anderson scoring five goals in all competitions.
====2017–18 season==== During the [[2017–18 S.S. Lazio season|2017–18]] season Felipe Anderson's form suffered numerous setbacks. A falling out with manager [[Simone Inzaghi]] after a 2–1 defeat to Genoa in February 2018 coupled with a knee injury that kept him out from August to December 2017 restricted Felipe Anderson to just nine [[Serie A]] starts for the season.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Felipe Anderson back on form at Lazio, but how long will it last?|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/italian-serie-a/12/blog/post/3400524/felipe-anderson-back-on-form-at-lazio-but-how-long-will-it-last|publisher=ESPN|date=28 February 2018|accessdate=15 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Felipe Anderson injury concerns|url=https://www.football-italia.net/108811/felipe-anderson-injury-concerns|publisher=Football Italia|date=26 August 2018|accessdate=15 July 2018}}</ref> On 20 May 2018, Felipe Anderson scored in his final game for Lazio in a 3–2 defeat to [[Inter Milan]] in a game that saw the victors qualify for the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] over Lazio.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lazio vs. Internazionale 2–3|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2018/05/20/italy/serie-a/ss-lazio-roma/fc-internazionale-milano/2539153/|accessdate=15 July 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== On 15 July 2018, Felipe Anderson signed for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] for a reported transfer fee of £36 million. The fee surpassed the previous record paid by the club, set with the £22 million signing of [[Issa Diop (footballer)|Issa Diop]] earlier in the [[List of English football transfers summer 2018|same transfer window]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Felipe Anderson: West Ham sign Lazio midfielder for club record fee|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44810938|first=Simon|last=Stone|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 July 2018|accessdate=16 July 2018}}</ref> Felipe Anderson made his first appearance for West Ham in a 3–1 pre-season friendly victory against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 25 July 2018, in which he combined with [[Arthur Masuaku]] to set up West Ham's second goal of the match, scored by [[Marko Arnautović]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/july/25-july/antonio-and-arnautovic-net-hammers-claim-aston-villa-win|title=Antonio and Arnautovic net as Hammers claim Aston Villa win – West Ham United|website=www.whufc.com|accessdate=30 September 2018}}</ref> He made his full debut on 12 August 2018 in a 4–0 defeat against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45073328|title=Salah, Mane & Sturridge on target as Liverpool beat West Ham 4–0|date=12 August 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=13 August 2018|}}</ref> On 29 September 2018, Felipe Anderson scored his first [[Premier League]] goal for West Ham with a back heeled finish in a 3–1 home win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45610325|title=West Ham United 3–1 Manchester United: Mourinho's side record worst start since 1989–90|date=29 September 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 September 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Felipe Anderson was one of seven stand-by players named by coach [[Dunga]] for [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]]'s squad at the [[2015 Copa América]] in Chile.<ref>{{cite news|title=Kaka among 7 alternates in Brazil's Copa America squad|url=http://www.espnfc.com/brazil/story/2445760/kaka-among-7-alternates-in-brazils-copa-america-squad|accessdate=29 May 2015|agency=Associated Press|publisher=ESPN|date=12 May 2015}}</ref> He made his debut in a warm-up match against [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] on 7 June of that year, playing the final seven minutes in place of [[Frederico Rodrigues Santos|Fred]] in a 2–0 victory at [[Allianz Parque]] in [[São Paulo]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Brazil 2–0 Mexico: Coutinho and Tardelli seal friendly victory|url=http://www.goal.com/brasilglobaltour/en/match/brazil-vs-mexico/2020807/report|accessdate=8 June 2015|work=Goal.com|date=7 June 2015}}</ref>
In June 2016, Felipe Anderson was included in [[Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men's team squads#Brazil|Brazil's squad for the 2016 Summer Olympics]] on home soil by the Olympic side's manager [[Rogério Micale]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/brazil/story/2904522/neymar-and-douglas-costa-named-in-brazil-olympics-squad|title=Neymar, Douglas Costa named in Brazil Olympics squad|publisher=ESPN FC|date=29 June 2016|accessdate=8 August 2016}}</ref> On 20 August, he appeared in the final of the tournament against [[Germany Olympic football team|Germany]] at the [[Maracanã Stadium|Maracanã]] in Rio; Brazil won the match 5–4 on penalties following a 1–1 draw to capture its first Olympic gold medal in men's football.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-olympics-rio-soccer-m-idUSKCN10V0VE|title=Soccer: Neymar hands Brazil football gold medal|publisher=Reuters|author=Andrew Downie|date=20 August 2016}}</ref> Anderson was recalled to the Brazil squad in February 2019, for the first time since 2015, for two friendly matches.<ref>[https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2019/february/28-february/west-ham-winger-felipe-anderson-called-brazil]</ref>
==Style of play== A quick, well-rounded, and technically gifted [[midfielder]], with a slender and diminutive but long-limbed physique, Felipe Anderson is considered a promising and talented young player. He is predominantly known for his pace, and is regarded as one of the fastest players in the modern game; although not imposing physically or in the air, he also possesses good ball control, quick feet, and excellent [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] skills, which allow him to beat opponents in one on one situations. A tactically versatile player, he is capable of playing in several different positions due to his wide range of skills, high work-rate, and ability to both create and score goals: he has been used as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] or as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfield]] [[playmaker]], but has most frequently been deployed as either a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] or an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]], due to his offensive movement and tendency to operate between the lines; he is capable of playing on either flank or through the centre of the pitch, due to his ability to cut into the middle and strike on goal, or move out to the wing to provide accurate [[Cross (football)|crosses]] to teammates in the area. In addition to his speed, stamina, creativity and technical ability, he is known for his eye for goal, and is gifted with a powerful and accurate shot from distance with either foot, despite being naturally right-footed; he is also an accurate [[Direct free kick|set-piece]] and [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]] taker. He can also serve as an [[Assist (football)|assist]]-man due to his creative ability, vision, dead-ball delivery, and eye for the final pass.<ref name="da Anderson a Yakovenko">{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Magic_Cup/05-09-2013/magic-campionato-serie-a-tutti-nuovi-stranieri-serie-a-anderson-yakovenko-201102296407.shtml|title=Tutti i nuovi stranieri della serie A: da Anderson a Yakovenko|publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian|author1=Massimo Tanzillo|date=17 January 2014|accessdate=6 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=ita/news/newsid=2227457.html|title=UEFA.com's weekly wonderkid: Felipe Anderson|publisher=UEFA|author1=Paolo Menicucci|date=28 March 2015|accessdate=22 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.calcioweb.eu/2013/07/i-nuovi-stranieri-della-serie-a-felipe-anderson/64556/|title=I nuovi stranieri della Serie A: Felipe Anderson|publisher=CalcioWeb.eu|language=Italian|author1=Vincenzo Currò|date=29 July 2013|accessdate=5 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/blog/scouting-and-prospects/78/post/2233109/scouts-notebook-felipe-anderson|title=Scout's Notebook: Lazio's speedster Felipe Anderson has lit up Serie A|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Nick Dorrington|date=9 January 2015|accessdate=5 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://sport.ilmessaggero.it/sslazio/lazio_felipe_anderson_profilo/295304.shtml|title=Lazio, ecco web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/23/lazio-felipe-anderson-serie-a|title=Lazio’s Felipe Anderson lights up surreal Sunday with his ‘dance rock’ style|publisher=The Guardian|author1=Paolo Bandini|date=23 March 2015|accessdate=5 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/sport/calcio/serie-a/lazio/2016/11/11/news/anderson_dubbi_malumori_hoedt_cataldi-151818772/|title=Lazio, i dubbi di Anderson: "Qui per sempre?
