revision.text:
{{For|other people of the same name|Andrew Carroll (disambiguation)}} {{Use British English|date=April 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Andy Carroll | image = AndyCarrollSeptember2015.JPG | image_size = 200 | caption = Carroll training with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2015 | fullname = Andrew Thomas Carroll<ref name=Hugman1011>{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page=78}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|1|6|df=y}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/andrew-carroll/5310/ |title=A. Carroll: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=18 May 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Gateshead]], England | height = {{convert|1.93|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/3175/Andy-Carroll/overview |title=Andy Carroll: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | clubnumber = 9 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2006 | youthclubs1 = [[Newcastle United F.C. Reserves and Academy|Newcastle United]] | years1 = 2006–2011 | clubs1 = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | caps1 = 80 | goals1 = 31 | years2 = 2007–2008 | clubs2 = → [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) | caps2 = 11 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2011–2013 | clubs3 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps3 = 44 | goals3 = 6 | years4 = 2012–2013 | clubs4 = → [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] (loan) | caps4 = 24 | goals4 = 7 | years5 = 2013– | clubs5 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps5 = 102 | goals5 = 26 | nationalyears1 = 2007–2008 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 8 | nationalgoals1 = 4 | nationalyears2 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalyears3 = 2010– | nationalteam3 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps3 = 9 | nationalgoals3 = 2 | club-update = 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 12 October 2012 (UTC) }} '''Andrew Thomas Carroll''' (born 6 January 1989) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for {{English football updater|WestHamU}} club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Carroll started his professional career with [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in 2006, before spending a brief period on loan with [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]], during which time he scored his first league goal. He established himself as a regular in the Newcastle first team by 2008, and following Newcastle's relegation from the Premier League to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] in 2009, scored 17 goals in 39 appearances to help Newcastle finish first in the league, earning immediate promotion back to the Premier League in the process. He continued to play for Newcastle in the Premier League, scoring 11 goals in 19 appearances.
Carroll signed for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on the last day of the [[transfer window]] on 31 January 2011 for a fee of £35 million, at the time the highest amount paid for a British footballer. Carroll was bought to replace [[Fernando Torres]], who moved from Liverpool to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on the same day for a fee of £50 million. An injury sustained in December delayed his Liverpool debut until March 2011, and he scored his first two goals for his new club in April 2011 in a 3–0 victory over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. In August 2012, Liverpool agreed a £2 million loan deal that would see Carroll spend a season-long loan at West Ham. This move was made permanent in June 2013 for a fee of £15 million.
Between 2010 and 2012, Carroll played nine matches for England, scoring twice, including one goal at [[UEFA Euro 2012]].
==Club career== ===Newcastle United=== ====2006–07==== [[File:Andy Carroll - April 2010.jpg|thumb|upright|Carroll playing for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in 2010]]
Carroll, an occasional scorer in [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]'s [[Newcastle United F.C. Reserves and Academy|reserve team]],<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11096/6715526/carroll-factfile | title=Carroll factfile | publisher=Sky Sports | accessdate=15 April 2016}}</ref> signed his first professional contract with the club in July 2006.<ref name=Hugman1011/> He made his first-team debut on 2 November 2006 at the age of 17 years and 300 days in a 1–0 [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] win over [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]], coming on as a late [[substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Nolberto Solano]]. In doing so, he became the youngest ever player to represent Newcastle in Europe.<ref>{{cite web|title=Palermo (a) UEFA Cup Group stage Game 2|publisher=NUFC.com |url=http://www.nufc.com/html/2006-07html/2006-11-02palermo-a.html|accessdate=2 November 2006|date=2 November 2006}}</ref>
He made his [[FA Cup]] debut on 17 January 2007, appearing as substitute for the last ten minutes in the 5–1 home defeat by [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]].<ref>{{Cite news|title=Newcastle 1–5 Birmingham |publisher=BBC Sport |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/6258857.stm |accessdate=17 January 2007|date=17 January 2007 |first=Chris |last=Bevan| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20070119212551/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/6258857.stm| archivedate= 19 January 2007 | deadurl= no}}</ref> On 25 February 2007, Carroll made his [[Premier League]] debut for Newcastle, coming on as a substitute in the 87th minute in the 1–0 defeat by [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], almost scoring in the process; only a good save from Wigan [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] [[John Filan]] prevented him from scoring his first Newcastle goal.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Wigan 1–0 Newcastle |publisher=BBC Sport |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6371353.stm |accessdate=25 February 2007|date=25 February 2007 |first=John |last=Sinnott| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20070224134019/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6371353.stm| archivedate= 24 February 2007 | deadurl= no}}</ref>
In 2007, he was the recipient of the Wor Jackie Milburn Trophy, awarded every year to the rising star of [[North East England|North-East]] football, chosen from among Newcastle players.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Is Andy Carroll a future England international? |publisher=Sport.co.uk |url=http://www.sport.co.uk/features/Football/986/Is_Andy_Carroll_a_future_England_international.aspx|accessdate=17 October 2010|date=26 April 2010}}</ref>
====2007–08==== On 29 July 2007, Carroll scored his first senior goal with a left foot shot in a 2–0 win over [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in a friendly match. After the match, Carroll received praise from Italian goalkeeper [[Gianluigi Buffon]], who tipped Carroll to have a big future.<ref name=Buffon>{{cite news|title=Buffon hails Magpies starlet |publisher=Sky Sports |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11678_2632503,00.html |date=30 July 2007|accessdate=31 July 2007}}</ref>
On 14 August 2007, Carroll began a six-month [[loan (sports)|loan]] with [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pnefc.net/page/NewsDetail/0,,10362~1091450,00.html |title=The wait is over |publisher=Preston North End F.C. |date=14 August 2007 |accessdate=17 October 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724013301/http://www.pnefc.net/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10362~1091450%2C00.html |archivedate=24 July 2011 }}</ref> and made his debut for them in the League Cup against [[Morecambe F.C.|Morecambe]] on the same day.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pnefc.net/page/NewsDetail/0,,10362~1091847,00.html |title=PNE v Morecambe: Minute by minute |publisher=Preston North End F.C. |date=14 August 2007 |accessdate=17 October 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724013327/http://www.pnefc.net/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10362~1091847%2C00.html |archivedate=24 July 2011 }}</ref> Carroll was sent off playing for Preston against [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]] on 18 September.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pnefc.net/page/MatchReport/0,,10362~37541,00.html |title=Scunthorpe vs Preston |publisher=Preston North End F.C. |date=18 September 2007 |accessdate=17 October 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110809190015/http://www.pnefc.net/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10362~37541%2C00.html |archivedate=9 August 2011 }}</ref> He scored his first Championship goal, and his first English league goal, against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on 6 November.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/7076422.stm |title=Preston 1–1 Leicester |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 November 2007 |accessdate=17 September 2009}}</ref>
[[File:Andy Carroll 2.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Carroll playing for Newcastle United in 2010]]
====2008–09==== Carroll made his first appearance for Newcastle in the 2008–09 season on 20 October, coming on as a substitute for [[Shola Ameobi]] at home to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Ten-Man Toon denied deserved win |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~1426931,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101205105515/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0%2C%2C10278~1426931%2C00.html |dead-url=yes |archivedate=5 December 2010 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=20 October 2008 |accessdate=17 October 2010 }}</ref> Carroll scored his first competitive goal for Newcastle on his first ever home start with a header against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in a 2–2 draw on 10 January 2009.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Carroll claims point for United |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~1515413,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101205105958/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0%2C%2C10278~1515413%2C00.html |dead-url=yes |archivedate=5 December 2010 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=10 January 2009 |accessdate=17 October 2010 }}</ref> He signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract on 12 March 2009, in theory keeping him at Newcastle until 2012.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Geordie starlet pens Toon deal|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20090312/geordie-starlet-pens-toon-deal_2281670_1587575|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120927234021/http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20090312/geordie-starlet-pens-toon-deal_2281670_1587575|dead-url=yes|archivedate=27 September 2012|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|date=12 March 2009|accessdate=17 October 2010}}</ref>
====2009–10==== Following Newcastle's relegation, and the departures of first-team strikers, [[Michael Owen]], [[Mark Viduka]] and [[Obafemi Martins]],<ref>{{Cite news|title=Shearer still wants Newcastle job|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/newcastle_united/8191320.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 August 2009|accessdate=17 October 2010}}</ref> Carroll was paired with Shola Ameobi in attack for Newcastle at the start of the new season.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Toon ace Tim is Hawthorns hero |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~1747726,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101205025259/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0%2C%2C10278~1747726%2C00.html |dead-url=yes |archivedate=5 December 2010 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=8 August 2009 |accessdate=17 October 2010 }}</ref> His first league goal in the Championship came on 16 September 2009 against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] with a header.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Blackpool rock United |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~1799223,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101205123235/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0%2C%2C10278~1799223%2C00.html |dead-url=yes |archivedate=5 December 2010 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=16 September 2009 |accessdate=17 October 2010 }}</ref> By 2010, Carroll was playing almost every match, in a new strike partnership with [[Peter Løvenkrands]]. This partnership accounted for more than half of the club's goals in 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/teams/team.sd?&team_id=1823&teamTabs=stats&season_id=139 |title=Newcastle: Squad stats: 2009/10 |website=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=14 April 2016}}</ref> Carroll finished the season as Newcastle's top scorer, with 19 goals in all competitions, 17 in the league.<ref name=sb0910/>
====2010–11==== Carroll was given squad number 9 for the 2010–11 season, a number with great significance for Newcastle United supporters, as it has been worn in the past for Newcastle by the likes of [[Jackie Milburn]], [[Malcolm Macdonald]] and [[Alan Shearer]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Carroll gets the number Nine|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20100720/carroll-gets-the-number-nine_2281670_2096603|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|date=20 July 2010|accessdate=20 July 2010}}</ref> Carroll scored his first career [[hat-trick]] against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in their 6–0 win in the Premier League on 22 August 2010.<ref>{{Cite web|title=NUFC 6 – Aston Villa 0 |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~2130943,00.html |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=22 August 2010 |accessdate=17 October 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100915150836/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0%2C%2C10278~2130943%2C00.html |archivedate=15 September 2010 |deadurl=yes }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8926011.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|title=Newcastle 6–0 Aston Villa|date=22 August 2010}}</ref> Carroll captained Newcastle for the first time on 3 October 2010 when he came on as a substitute for [[Kevin Nolan]] against Manchester City.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Manchester City 2–1 Newcastle |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/TV/LiveMatches/0,,10278~51507,00.html |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=3 October 2010 |accessdate=18 November 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101205075411/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/TV/LiveMatches/0%2C%2C10278~51507%2C00.html |archivedate=5 December 2010 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> In October 2010, Carroll signed a new five-year contract, on paper keeping him at the club until 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/newcastle_united/9076100.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|title=Andy Carroll signs five-year Newcastle United deal|date=8 October 2010}}</ref> Carroll scored Newcastle's third in a 3–1 victory over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[St James' Park]] on 11 December 2010, with a low 25-yard drive.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9268294.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|title=Newcastle 3–1 Liverpool|date=11 December 2010|accessdate=11 December 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101211045507/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9268294.stm| archivedate= 11 December 2010 | deadurl= no}}</ref>
===Liverpool===
====2010–11==== [[File:Andy Carroll 20111205.jpg|thumb|upright|Carroll warming up for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2011]]
On 31 January 2011, Liverpool put in a bid of £30 million for Carroll, which was rejected.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/newcastle-united/8292835/Newcastle-turn-down-Liverpools-30m-bid-for-Andy-Carroll.html|title=Newcastle turn down Liverpool's £30m bid for Andy Carroll|date=31 January 2011|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|accessdate=31 March 2011|location=London}}</ref> Newcastle then accepted a bid of £35 million and, following the agreement of personal terms and a medical, the transfer was completed shortly before the 11:00 pm deadline.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/l/liverpool/9382215.stm|title=Liverpool sign Andy Carroll from Newcastle |date=31 January 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 February 2011|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110201210910/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/l/liverpool/9382215.stm| archivedate= 1 February 2011 | deadurl= no}}</ref>
Carroll insisted he was forced out of Newcastle, but United claimed he had handed in a transfer request after they turned down Liverpool's £30 million bid.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1352347/Andy-Carrolls-35m-Liverpool-I-forced-Newcastle.html|title=Carroll completes £35m Liverpool move and then claims: I was forced out of Newcastle|date=1 February 2011|newspaper=Daily Mail|accessdate=8 August 2012|location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Liverpool confirmed that Carroll would wear the number 9 jersey previously worn by [[Fernando Torres]], who left [[Anfield]] for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on the same evening for £50 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/9380389.stm |title=Torres makes record move from Liverpool to Chelsea |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> The transfer made Carroll the [[List of most expensive footballers|eighth overall most expensive footballer]] at the time, and also the most expensive British footballer of all time. He also became the second most expensive footballer playing for a British club, after Torres.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/l/liverpool/9386314.stm|title=Reds star Andy Carroll plays down Fernando Torres talk |date=3 February 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 February 2011| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110204051316/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/l/liverpool/9386314.stm| archivedate= 4 February 2011 | deadurl= no}}</ref> Due to an injury that was sustained while with Newcastle, however, it was announced that Carroll would have to wait some time before his Liverpool debut.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
[[File:Andy Carroll 2011.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Carroll playing for Liverpool in 2011]]
Carroll finally made his Liverpool debut as a substitute in the 3–1 win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 6 March 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/292981?cc=5739 |title=Kuyt derails bid for 19th title |date=6 March 2011 |website=ESPN Soccernet |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110309055208/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/292981?cc=5739 |archivedate=9 March 2011 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> On 10 March, he appeared in his first European match for Liverpool in a 1–0 loss at [[S.C. Braga|Braga]] in the [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]], appearing as a substitute after half-time.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/9419560.stm|title=Braga 1–0 Liverpool|date=10 March 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 March 2011| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110311052523/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/9419560.stm| archivedate= 11 March 2011 | deadurl= no}}</ref> In the return leg a week later, he made his first Liverpool start, although the match finished 0–0, leading to Liverpool going out of the competition losing 1–0 on aggregate.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/9424223.stm|title=Liverpool 0–0 Braga (agg 0–1)|date=17 March 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 March 2011| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110415085108/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/9424223.stm| archivedate= 15 April 2011 | deadurl= no}}</ref> On 20 March, he made his first Premier League start for Liverpool at the [[Stadium of Light]] in a 2–0 victory against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9425608.stm|title=Sunderland 0–2 Liverpool|date=20 March 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 March 2011}}</ref> On 11 April, Carroll scored his first goals for Liverpool in a 3–0 victory against Manchester City at Anfield, scoring his first with a long-range strike and his second with a header.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9449111.stm |title=Liverpool 3–0 Man City |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 April 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> He played several more times that season, but did not score any more goals.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
====2011–12==== On 24 August 2011, he scored his first goal of the new season with a 20-yard drive against [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] to make the score 3–0 in the second round of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14569491.stm|title=Exeter 1–3 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> On 1 October 2011, he scored his first league goal of the [[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12 season]] during a 2–0 victory over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15045708.stm | publisher=BBC Sport | title=Everton 0–2 Liverpool | date=1 October 2011}}</ref> His third goal of the season came in a 2–0 win away at [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15413663.stm|title=West Brom 0–2 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal of 2012 in a 5–1 third-round FA Cup victory against [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16361616.stm|title=Liverpool 5–1 Oldham|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> He would go on to create the [[Dirk Kuyt]] goal that would secure victory in the 88th minute over Manchester United in the fourth round of the FA Cup on 28 January, before marking the first anniversary of his signing with Liverpool with his fifth goal of the season in a 3–0 victory away at [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on 31 January.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16695917.stm | publisher=BBC Sport | title=Wolves 0–3 Liverpool}}</ref> He later scored, and set up teammate [[Luis Suárez]], during Liverpool's 6–1 thrashing of [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] in the fifth round of the FA Cup.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17001835 |title=Liverpool 6–1 Brighton & Hove Albion |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 February 2012 |accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref>
On 26 February, he won his first trophy with Liverpool as they won the [[2011–12 Football League Cup|League Cup]], beating [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in the [[2012 Football League Cup Final|final]].<ref name=2012LC>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17093419 |title=Cardiff 2–2 Liverpool |first=Chris |last=Bevan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 February 2012 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> On 10 April, he headed an injury-time winner against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] to end Liverpool's run of four matches without a win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17594143 |title=Blackburn 2–3 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 April 2012 |accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> Four days later, he headed in another late winner, this time in a 2–1 victory against Everton in the [[2011–12 FA Cup|FA Cup semi-final]] at [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley]], to take Liverpool through to the [[2012 FA Cup Final|final]] on his 50th appearance for Liverpool.<ref name="bbc.co.uk">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17643172 |title=Liverpool 2–1 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 April 2012 |accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> Carroll described his match-winning goal as "the best feeling ever", with teammate [[Jamie Carragher]] saying the goal was "worth £35 million in itself" and that Carroll would "be remembered forever".<ref name="bbc.co.uk"/> He also scored in the final, which Liverpool lost 2–1 to Chelsea.<ref name=2012FAC>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17878435 |title=Chelsea 2–1 Liverpool |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 May 2012 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
====2012–13==== On 30 August 2012, it was agreed that Carroll would spend the [[2012–13 Premier League|2012–13 season]] on loan to fellow [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], who were newly promoted to the division at the time.<ref name="West Ham Loan Spell Initial"/>
===West Ham United=== ====2012–13==== [[File:AndyCarrollWHU.jpg|thumb|upright|Carroll playing for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2012]]
On 30 August 2012, Carroll signed with West Ham on a season-long loan.<ref name="West Ham Loan Spell Initial">{{cite news|first=Ben|last=Smith|title=Andy Carroll: Liverpool striker joins West Ham on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19422144|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 August 2012|accessdate=31 August 2012}}</ref> Liverpool initially wanted a £17 million option for a permanent transfer written into the loan deal, but dropped the demand to facilitate the deal, and West Ham ultimately paid a £2 million loan arrangement fee and also all of Carroll's £80,000-a-week Liverpool wages.<ref name="Guardian 2013">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/may/21/andy-carroll-liverpool-west-ham|title=West Ham agree a fee of £15m for Liverpool striker Andy Carroll|newspaper=The Guardian|location=London|first=Andy|last=Hunter|date=21 May 2013}}</ref>
Carroll made his debut on 1 September, setting-up two goals in a 3–0 home win against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite news |title=West Ham 3–0 Fulham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19377834|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=1 September 2012}}</ref> He scored his first goal on 25 November 2012 in a 3–1 away defeat against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/premier-league-match-facts-tottenham-hotspur-v-west-024452039.html |title=Premier League – Defoe brace disposes of West Ham |date=25 November 2012 |publisher=Yahoo Eurosport UK |accessdate=12 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102222516/http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/premier-league-match-facts-tottenham-hotspur-v-west-024452039.html |archivedate=2 November 2013 |df=dmy }}</ref> After making his first start since November due to injury, Carroll scored the only goal in a home win against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 2 February 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21209165|title=West Ham 1–0 Swansea|author=Saj Chowdhury|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> Carroll ended the loan spell with seven goals in 24 appearances.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22618340|title=Andy Carroll: Liverpool and West Ham agree £15m transfer fee|date=21 May 2013|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Ben|last=Smith}}</ref>
====2013–14==== On 21 May 2013, West Ham and Liverpool agreed a fee of around £15 million to make the loan move permanent, pending Carroll agreeing to the move, and then to personal terms.<ref name="Guardian 2013"/> Carroll signed a six-year contract with West Ham on 19 June 2013 for a then club record transfer fee of £15 million.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22974376 | title=Andy Carroll: West Ham sign Liverpool striker for £15m | publisher=BBC Sport | date=19 June 2013 | accessdate=20 June 2013}}</ref>
Carroll started the [[2013–14 West Ham United F.C. season|2013–14 season]] injured with a heel problem picked up in the final match of the previous season.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24076406 | title=Andy Carroll: West Ham to seek specialist help on injury | publisher=BBC Sport | date=13 September 2013 | accessdate=15 April 2016}}</ref> He made his first appearance of the season on 12 January 2014, as a substitute in the 72nd minute of a 2–0 victory over Cardiff, assisting [[Mark Noble]] for West Ham's second goal.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24076406|title=Andy Carroll: West Ham to seek specialist help on injury|date=13 September 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 31 March, he was named [[man of the match]] by [[Sky Sports]] for his performance in a 2–1 win against Sunderland at the Stadium of Light in which he scored one and assisted the other of the Hammers' goals.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287603/report|title=Premier League: Sunderland's relegation fears intensify with home defeat to West Ham|date=31 March 2014|accessdate=8 April 2014|publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> Carroll ended the [[2013–14 Premier League]] season with two goals from 18 appearances.<ref name=sb1314/>
====2014–15==== [[File:AndyCrarolldec2014.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Carroll playing for West Ham United in 2014]]
During a pre-[[2014–15 West Ham United F.C. season|season]] tour of New Zealand, Carroll sustained an [[ankle ligament injury]] which prevented him from appearing during West Ham's first eleven [[2014–15 Premier League|Premier League]] matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28471772 |title=Andy Carroll: West Ham striker faces long lay-off with ankle injury |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 July 2014 |accessdate=30 August 2017 }}</ref> Carroll returned to the team on 8 November 2014, coming on as a substitute for Mark Noble in a 0–0 home draw with Aston Villa.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/west-ham-0-aston-villa-0-andy-carroll-almost-makes-glorious-return-as-hammers-are-held-in-frustrating-stalemate-9848961.html | title=West Ham 0 Aston Villa 0: Andy Carroll almost makes glorious return as Hammers are held in frustrating stalemate | newspaper=London Evening Standard | date=8 November 2014 | accessdate=9 November 2014}}</ref>
On 7 December 2014, he scored his first two goals of the season against Swansea in a 3–1 home win; these were also his first goals scored at Upton Park since March 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/15130/9596959/west-ham-3-1-swansea-andy-carroll-stars-as-hammers-move-up-to-third-in-premier-league|title=West Ham 3–1 Swansea: Andy Carroll stars as Hammers move up to third in Premier League|accessdate=7 November 2014}}</ref> On 20 December, Carroll scored the 50th league goal of his career in West Ham's 2–0 defeat of Leicester.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/west-ham-2-0-leicester-city-whens-last-time-hammers-were-top-four-christmas|title=West Ham 2–0 Leicester: When's the last time the Hammers were in the top four at Christmas?|date=20 December 2014|accessdate=3 January 2015|magazine=FourFourTwo}}</ref> From December 2014 to January 2015, he went on a run of five goals in eight league appearances.<ref>{{cite news | title = Liverpool FC old boy Andy Carroll returns – but how much of a threat will he pose? | newspaper = Liverpool Echo | url = http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-fc-old-boy-andy-8538847 | accessdate = 13 February 2015 | first = Matthew | last = Judge | date = 29 January 2015}}</ref>
On 11 February 2015, Carroll was substituted in the second half of a 0–0 draw against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] with a tear in his medial ligament on the side of his knee.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31433187 | title=Andy Carroll: West Ham striker has knee surgery | publisher=BBC Sport | date=17 February 2015 | accessdate=15 April 2016}}</ref> Two days later, West Ham's website announced Carroll was set to have surgery the following week and expected to miss the remainder of the 2014–15 season.<ref>{{cite news | title = West Ham's Andy Carroll set to miss rest of season with knee injury |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London | url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/feb/13/west-ham-andy-carroll-miss-rest-of-season | accessdate = 13 February 2015 | date = 13 February 2015}}</ref> He did not play again after February and made only 14 league appearances in the 2014–15 season, scoring five goals; three against Swansea City and one each against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and Leicester.<ref name=sb1415/>
====2015–16==== Carroll returned to the first team on 14 September 2015, making his first appearance of [[2015–16 West Ham United F.C. season|the season]] as an 88th-minute substitute for [[Victor Moses]] in a 2–0 home win against his former club, Newcastle.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34171138 | title=West Ham United 2–0 Newcastle United | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=15 September 2015}}</ref>
On 24 October, Carroll scored his first goal in nine months, coming on as a substitute and heading in [[Aaron Cresswell]]'s cross to defeat champions Chelsea 2–1 in a [[2015–16 Premier League|Premier League]] fixture at [[Boleyn Ground|Upton Park]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/oct/24/west-ham-united-chelsea-premier-league-match-report|title=Andy Carroll scores West Ham's winner to heap pressure on Chelsea|date=24 October 2015|newspaper=The Guardian|location=London}}</ref> Following several goalless matches, Carroll suffered a groin injury while training for West Ham's 7 December match against Swansea, sidelining him for several weeks.<ref>{{cite news|title = Injury-plagued Andy Carroll out again with groin strain|url = https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/west-hams-andy-carroll-injured-7037833|newspaper=Daily Mirror|location=London|accessdate = 4 January 2016}}</ref> He returned to action as a half-time substitute in a 2–1 win against Southampton. Carroll scored the winning goal via header after a shot from [[Michail Antonio]] had rebounded off of the crossbar.<ref>{{cite news|title = West Ham 2–1 Southampton: Andy Carroll and Michail Antonio strike|url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3376679/West-Ham-2-1-Southampton-Andy-Carroll-Michail-Antonio-strike-Carl-Jenkinson-goal-Hammers-stop-rot.html|newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London|accessdate = 4 January 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> This marked Carroll's first goal since the match against Chelsea, and just his third of the year.<ref name=sb1415/><ref name=sb1516/>
On 2 January 2016, Carroll started for West Ham against his former club Liverpool, in a 2–0 victory with Carroll scoring again from a header following a cross from Mark Noble. This was the first time Carroll had scored in consecutive matches in nearly 12 months, and was his first goal against Liverpool since leaving the club in 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title = West Ham vs Liverpool, Premier League: Andy Carroll haunts his old club|url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/12077308/West-Ham-vs-Liverpool-Premier-League-live.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|accessdate = 4 January 2016}}</ref> On 9 April, Carroll scored his first hat-trick with West Ham, in a 3–3 draw against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news|title = West Ham 3–3 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35949243|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate = 9 April 2016}}</ref> On 20 April, Carroll scored in his third consecutive Premier League match for the first time in his career as West Ham beat [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] 3–1 at the Boleyn Ground.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35733431 | title=West Ham 3–1 Watford | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=21 April 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17==== Carroll played the full 90 minutes in West Ham's 2–1 defeat against Chelsea in the first match of the season, on 15 August.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37006707|title=Chelsea 2–1 West Ham United|date=15 August 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref> On 18 August, Carroll came on at the 63rd minute in a 1–1 draw against [[FC Astra Giurgiu|Astra Giurgiu]] in the first leg of the [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] playoffs, and sustained a knee injury. While initial estimates put his recovery time at six weeks,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/andy-carrolls-injury-nightmare-continues-8677065|title=West Ham dealt injury blow as Andy Carroll is ruled out for up to six weeks|last=Lewis|first=Darren|date=21 August 2016 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref> it saw him sidelined for over three months.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/west-hams-andy-carroll-has-new-return-date-following-knee-injury-1589368|title=West Ham's Andy Carroll has a new return date following a knee injury|last=Howson|first=Nick|date=2 November 2016 |newspaper=International Business Times UK|accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref>
On 3 December, he returned to action, scoring as a 73rd-minute substitute in a 1–5 home loss against Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38113792|title=West Ham United 1–5 Arsenal|date=3 December 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref> On 14 January 2017, Carroll scored what he admitted to be "The best goal he's ever scored" with a [[bicycle kick]] in a 3–0 win against Crystal Palace at [[London Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38539427|title=West Ham United 3–0 Crystal Palace|date=14 January 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref> The goal was named Goal of the Month for January by the Premier League on 10 February.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/327751|title=Carroll claims Carling Goal of the Month|date=10 February 2017|publisher=Premier League}}</ref>
On 1 April, Carroll scored the 50th Premier League goal of his career in a 2–1 loss at Hull City,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/786751/Hull-2-West-Ham-1-Andy-Carroll-Andy-Robertson-Andrea-Ranocchia-News|title=Hull 2 – West Ham 1: Andy Robertson and Andrea Ranocchia ruin Andy Carroll's landmark day|date=2 April 2017|newspaper=Daily Express}}</ref> [[Captain (association football)|captaining]] West Ham for the first time.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/04/02/west-ham-give-slaven-bilic-vote-confidence-co-chairmen-ask-fans/|title=West Ham give Slaven Bilic vote of confidence as co-chairmen ask for fans to unite behind manager|date=2 April 2017|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Riccardo Montolivo and Andy Carroll England-Italy Euro 2012.jpg|thumb|upright|Carroll (right) playing for [[England national football team|England]] at [[UEFA Euro 2012]]]]
===England youth teams=== On 11 September 2007, Carroll made his [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19]] debut against [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]], scoring in the 4–0 victory.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Andy marks England debut with a goal |publisher=Preston North End F.C. |url=http://www.pnefc.net/page/NewsDetail/0,,10362~1110529,00.html |date=12 September 2007 |accessdate=17 October 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711154305/http://www.pnefc.net/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10362~1110529%2C00.html |archivedate=11 July 2011 }}</ref> On 12 March 2009, Carroll was called up to the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20s]] for a match against [[Italy national under-20 football team|Italy]], but was withdrawn from the squad and replaced by [[Hal Robson-Kanu]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Squad named for QPR|url=http://thefa.com/England/mens-u20s/News/2009/Squad_named_for_QPR|archive-url=https://wayback.archive-it.org/all/20120502184937/http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-u20s/News/2009/Squad_named_for_QPR|dead-url=yes|archivedate=2 May 2012|publisher=The Football Association|date=12 March 2009|accessdate=17 October 2010|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Carroll received his first call up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21s]] on 5 August 2009.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Pearce overlooks Wilshere|publisher=Sky Sports|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12010_5475128,00.html|accessdate=5 August 2009|date=5 August 2009}}</ref> He made his debut on 11 August 2009 against the [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands]], coming on as a second-half substitute.<ref>{{Cite news|title=England kids held in Holland |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,19764,11065_3177343,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports |date=11 August 2010 |accessdate=17 October 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090917173832/http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0%2C19764%2C11065_3177343%2C00.html |archivedate=17 September 2009 }}</ref> On his second cap with the under-21 team, on 9 October 2009 against [[Macedonia national under-21 football team|Macedonia]], he scored two goals and [[Assist (football)|assisted]] another as England won 6–3.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Big Andy's double delight|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20091012/big-andys-double-delight_2281670_1823706|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|date=12 October 2009|accessdate=17 October 2010}}</ref>
===England senior team=== Carroll's performances for Newcastle United earned him a call up to the [[England national football team|England]] squad for the friendly against [[France national football team|France]] on 17 November 2010.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/nov/07/andy-carroll-england-selection-france | title=Andy Carroll of Newcastle United set for England call against France | newspaper=The Guardian | date=7 November 2010 | accessdate=15 April 2016 | author=Fifield, Dominic}}</ref> Carroll passed a late fitness test to start the match.<ref>{{Cite news|title=England 1–2 France|publisher=BBC Sport|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/9194622.stm|accessdate=17 November 2010|date=17 November 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101117110139/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/9194622.stm| archivedate= 17 November 2010 | deadurl= no}}</ref> Carroll scored his first senior goal, a low left foot drive into the bottom corner, for England on 29 March 2011 in a friendly against [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]] which ended 1–1.<ref name="England 1–1 Ghana">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 1–1 Ghana |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/9438254.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 March 2011 |accessdate=14 April 2016}}</ref> On 15 May 2012, Carroll was included in the squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18213079 |title=Euro 2012: England's Gareth Barry set for groin scan |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> He opened the scoring for England with a powerful header in their second group match against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]], which England went on to win 3–2.<ref name="Sweden 2–3 England">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Sweden 2–3 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/18181790 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 June 2012 |accessdate=14 April 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== Carroll has been compared to Newcastle's record goalscorer Alan Shearer, [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]] striker [[Didier Drogba]] and former Italy forward [[Christian Vieri]].<ref>{{Cite news|first=Simon|last=Williams|title=Andy Carroll shows shades of Alan Shearer for Newcastle United|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/sep/21/newcastle-united-plymouth-argyle-championship|newspaper=The Guardian|date=21 September 2009|accessdate=25 April 2010|location=London}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title=Local hero Carroll delighted to emulate Shearer |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/football/newcastle/news/4040060.Local_hero_Carroll_delighted_to_emulate_Shearer/ |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=12 January 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121001213547/http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/football/newcastle/news/4040060.Local_hero_Carroll_delighted_to_emulate_Shearer/ |archivedate=1 October 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title=Andy Carroll will be better than Didier Drogba, says Liverpool team-mate Joe Cole|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/8417976/Andy-Carroll-will-be-better-than-Didier-Drogba-says-Liverpool-team-mate-Joe-Cole.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|date=31 March 2011|accessdate=31 March 2011|location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2010/nov/08/five-things-premier-league-this-weekend|title=Five things we learned from the Premier League this weekend|date=8 November 2010|accessdate=8 April 2014|newspaper=The Guardian|location=London}}</ref> He has also been referred to as a classic [[centre forward]], owing to his strength, powerful shot and excellent heading ability.<ref>{{Cite web |first=Craig|last=Hope|title=Number eight for future number nine?|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20100206/number-eight-for-future-number-nine_2281670_1957140|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|date=6 February 2010|accessdate=6 February 2010}}</ref> Former Newcastle manager and Liverpool player [[Kevin Keegan]] stated "he is probably in the top three headers of a ball I have ever seen in football".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/828494/kevin-keegan-chris-hughton-flying-high-with-magpies |title=Hughton flying high with Magpies |first=Kevin |last=Keegan |website=ESPN FC |date=1 October 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150723174637/http://www.espnfc.com/story/828494/kevin-keegan-chris-hughton-flying-high-with-magpies |archivedate=23 July 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> After Newcastle's 2–0 victory at home to Blackpool in September 2010, in which Carroll scored the second goal and was instrumental in creating the first, Blackpool manager [[Ian Holloway]] described Carroll as "the best striker in the Premier League".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.talksport.co.uk/radio/matchday-live/blog/2010-09-11/holloway-carroll-best-striker-premier-league|title=Holloway: 'Carroll is the best striker in the Premier League'|publisher=talkSPORT|accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> A strong and very physical centre-forward, Carroll is distinguished by his powerful aerial abilities, with former West Ham manager [[Slaven Bilić]] claiming that he is "the best in the world at heading a football".<ref>{{cite news |title=West Ham 3–3 Arsenal: Andy Carroll best in the world at heading – Bilic |publisher=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36006770 |accessdate=9 April 2016|date=9 April 2016}}</ref>
==Personal life== Born in [[Gateshead]], Tyne and Wear, Carroll attended Brighton Avenue Primary School and [[Joseph Swan School]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Andy Carroll Player Profile |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Teams/PlayerProfile/0,,10278~37714,00.html |accessdate=17 October 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100911095504/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Teams/PlayerProfile/0%2C%2C10278~37714%2C00.html |archivedate=11 September 2010 |deadurl=yes}}</ref><ref name=standard1>{{cite news | url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/billi-mucklow-reveals-shes-expecting-her-first-child-with-fianc-andy-carroll-9945287.html | title=Billi Mucklow reveals she's expecting her first child with fiancé Andy Carroll | newspaper=London Evening Standard | accessdate=29 December 2014}}</ref> He is a model for retail clothing company [[H&M]] and has fronted a campaign led by fashion designer [[Alexander Wang (designer)|Alexander Wang]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Andy Carroll speaks about modelling debut after West Ham striker fronts campaign for Alexander Wang and H&M|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2800195/andy-carroll-speaks-modelling-debut-west-ham-striker-fronts-campaign-alexander-wang-h-m.html|accessdate=2 November 2014| archiveurl= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2800195/andy-carroll-speaks-modelling-debut-west-ham-striker-fronts-campaign-alexander-wang-h-m.html| archivedate= 2 November 2014 | deadurl= no}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> In November 2014, Carroll became engaged to reality TV star [[Billi Mucklow]].<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29948175 | title=Andy Carroll: Sam Allardyce welcomes striker's engagement | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=7 November 2014}}</ref> The couple live in [[Essex]].<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/andy-carroll-and-billi-mucklow-house-the-internet-has-not-reacted-kindly-to-carroll-castle-shared-by-west-ham-striker-and-towie-fiance-9954670.html | title=Andy Carroll and Billi Mucklow house: The internet has not reacted kindly to 'Carroll Castle' shared by West Ham striker and Towie fiancée | newspaper=The Independent |location=London | date=2 January 2015 | accessdate=3 January 2015}}</ref> Their son, Arlo, was born in June 2015.<ref name=standard1/> He has two children, Emilie Rose and Lucas, from a previous relationship.<ref>{{cite news | title = Andy Carroll and fiance Billi Mucklow share photo of first pregnancy scan on Instagram | newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London | url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2928000/Andy-Carroll-fiance-Billi-Mucklow-share-photo-pregnancy-scan-Instagram.html | accessdate = 13 February 2015 | first = Rohan | last = Banerjee | date = 27 January 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> In November 2017, Mucklow and Carroll had a second child, Wolf Nine.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/3272289/west-ham-striker-andy-carroll-names-baby-boy-wolf |title=Andy Carroll names baby 'Wolf' |first=Chris |last=Wright |publisher=ESPN |date=16 November 2017 |accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref>
In November 2016, Carroll was approached by two men on motorcycles while driving near his home in [[Brentwood, Essex]]. Armed with a hand gun, they attempted to steal his £22,000 watch but failed.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-41085258 |title=West Ham striker Andy Carroll relives gunpoint robbery attempt |publisher=BBC News |date=29 August 2017 |accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> Carroll was then chased in his car for about 20 minutes as he drove back to West Ham's training ground in [[Rush Green, London|Rush Green]] to get help from security staff.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.brentwoodlive.co.uk/news/14841814.West_Ham_striker_Andy_Carroll_held_at_gunpoint_after_stopping_at_junction_in_his_car/ | title=West Ham striker Andy Carroll held at gunpoint after stopping at junction in his car | website=Brentwood Live | accessdate=3 November 2016}}</ref> In September 2017, 22-year-old Jack O'Brien was found guilty of the attempted robbery.<ref>{{cite news|title=Man convicted for trying to steal footballer Andy Carroll's £22,000 watch|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/sep/01/andy-carroll-22000-watch-jack-obrien-convicted-west-ham|accessdate=1 September 2017|newspaper=The Guardian|agency=Press Association|date=1 September 2017}}</ref> He was sentenced to six years in prison for the offence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.guardian-series.co.uk/news/15509442.Man_jailed_after_drive_by_robbery_bid_on_West_Ham_striker/|title=Man jailed after drive-by robbery bid on West Ham striker|website=East London and West Essex Guardian Series|accessdate=16 November 2017}}</ref>
==Discipline== Carroll has been involved in many off-the-pitch incidents in his career. On 14 September 2008, he was arrested by police in Newcastle, and later accepted a police caution.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Footballer arrested over assault |url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/UK-News/Newcastle-United-Footballer-Andy-Carroll-Arrested-For-Assaulting-A-Woman/Article/200809315103943 |publisher=Sky News |date=21 September 2008 |accessdate=11 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110208200332/http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/UK-News/Newcastle-United-Footballer-Andy-Carroll-Arrested-For-Assaulting-A-Woman/Article/200809315103943 |archivedate=8 February 2011 }}</ref>
On 7 December 2009, he was arrested in the aftermath of a nightclub fight, again in Newcastle, accused of smashing glass in a man's face.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Carroll held after nightclub fight |publisher=Yahoo! Eurosport UK |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/07122009/58/championship-carroll-held-nightclub-fight.html |accessdate=23 March 2010 |date=7 December 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091213021117/http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/07122009/58/championship-carroll-held-nightclub-fight.html |archivedate=13 December 2009 }}</ref> He was charged with assault and in October 2010 he pleaded guilty to common assault and was fined £1,000. He was also ordered to pay £2,500 compensation.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Footballer Andy Carroll pleads guilty to assault|publisher=BBC News|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-tyne-11620004|accessdate=3 December 2010|date=25 October 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101110022101/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-tyne-11620004| archivedate= 10 November 2010 | deadurl= no}}</ref>
While on international duty with the England U-19s, Carroll and teammates [[Scott Sinclair]] and [[Ryan Bertrand]] were sent home from the squad after breaking a curfew on 14 October 2007 during preparation for a match against [[Romania national under-19 football team|Romania U-19s]].<ref>{{Cite news|title=England youngsters sent home |publisher=Sky Sports |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12010_2800655,00.html |accessdate=4 March 2009 |date=14 October 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090414061712/http://www.skysports.com/story/0%2C19528%2C12010_2800655%2C00.html |archivedate=14 April 2009 |deadurl=no }}</ref>
In March 2010, Carroll was allegedly involved in an altercation with teammate [[Steven Taylor (footballer)|Steven Taylor]] during training that left Taylor with a broken jaw.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Newcastle investigate sex-text brawl| publisher=Yahoo! Eurosport UK|url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/23032010/58/championship-sex-text-brawl-leaves-taylor-broken-jaw.html| accessdate=23 March 2010|date=23 March 2010}}{{dead link|date=August 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> Carroll reportedly suffered a broken hand in the incident, and shortly afterwards he was photographed at a pop concert with bandages to both hands.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Andy Carroll shows off bandaged hands at 50 Cent concert days after alleged bust-up with Newcastle team-mate Steven Taylor| newspaper=Daily Mail| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1261001/Newcastles-Andy-Carroll-shows-bandaged-hands-50-Cent-concert-bust-Steven-Taylor.html?ITO=1490| accessdate=26 March 2010|date=26 March 2010| location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Then Newcastle manager [[Chris Hughton]], club representatives and both players declined to comment any further on the incident and no charges were pressed.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Hughton's toughest test over Carroll and Taylor bust-up claim |url=http://icnewcastle.icnetwork.co.uk/newcastleunited/sundaysun/tm_headline=hughton-s-toughest-test-over-carroll-and-taylor-bust-up-claim%26method=full%26objectid=26091087%26siteid=72703-name_page.html |publisher=icNewcastle |date=23 March 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110920103940/http://icnewcastle.icnetwork.co.uk/newcastleunited/sundaysun/tm_headline%3Dhughton-s-toughest-test-over-carroll-and-taylor-bust-up-claim%26method%3Dfull%26objectid%3D26091087%26siteid%3D72703-name_page.html |archivedate=20 September 2011 }}</ref>
On 18 October 2010, Carroll was charged with assault in an incident with his ex-girlfriend. Claiming self-defence, and having given a local hotel as his address, Carroll was granted bail on the condition that he resided with then Newcastle captain Kevin Nolan until the case resumed in January. The charges were later dropped due to lack of evidence.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Newcastle striker Andy Carroll must live with captain|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-tyne-11563332|publisher=BBC News|date=18 October 2010}}</ref> Two days following his bail, Carroll's car was [[Arson|set on fire]] while parked on Nolan's driveway, with the club captain's garage door also being daubed with obscenities.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Andy Carroll's car torched at Kevin Nolan's home|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/north-east-news/breaking-news/2010/10/21/andy-carroll-s-car-torched-at-kevin-nolan-s-home-72703-27518147/|newspaper=Evening Chronicle|location=Newcastle upon Tyne|date=21 October 2010}}</ref>
Following England's 1–1 draw with Ghana on 29 March 2011, England manager [[Fabio Capello]] told Carroll to curtail his drinking habits. Liverpool manager [[Kenny Dalglish]] responded by saying, "Well he's never bought me a drink. I've been with him at [[Boyzone]] concerts and he's still never bought me a drink!"<ref>{{Cite news| url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11669_6845486,00.html | publisher=Sky Sports | title=Dalglish defends Carroll}}</ref>
In an interview in April 2012, Carroll admitted that he had gained a reputation for drinking and socialising during his time at Newcastle, but that since joining Liverpool in January 2011 he had "settled down" and changed his lifestyle.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/17/andy-carroll-liverpool-goals | newspaper=The Guardian |location=London | first=Andy | last=Hunter | title=Andy Carroll confident match-winning goals can settle him at Liverpool | date=17 April 2012}}</ref>
Carroll's time at West Ham United has been blighted by many injuries. His former manager, [[Sam Allardyce]] claimed this was partly caused by Carroll failing to look after himself and not doing the required rehabilitation work to keep himself fit.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://thisisfutbol.com/2018/10/blogs/premier-league/allardyce-questions-carrolls-lifestyle/|title='He could look after himself better' - Allardyce savages the lifestyle of West Ham party animal - thisisfutbol.com|date=26 October 2018|publisher=|accessdate=27 October 2018}}</ref>
