{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {{tense|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Manuel Lanzini | image = Manuel Lanzini in 2017.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Lanzini with [[West Ham United]] in 2017 | fullname = Manuel Lanzini<ref>{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|2|15|df=y}}<ref name="Premier League">{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.html/manuel-lanzini |title=Manuel Lanzini |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=6 July 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Ituzaingó, Buenos Aires|Ituzaingó]], Argentina | height = 1.67 m<ref name="Premier League"/> | position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | clubnumber = 10 | youthyears1 = 2002–2010 | youthclubs1 = [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] | years1 = 2010–2014 | clubs1 = [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] | caps1 = 93 | goals1 = 13 | years2 = 2011–2012 | clubs2 = → [[Fluminense Football Club|Fluminense]] (loan) | caps2 = 28 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2014–2016 | clubs3 = [[Al Jazira Club]] | caps3 = 24 | goals3 = 8 | years4 = 2015–2016 | clubs4 = → [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] (loan) | caps4 = 26 | goals4 = 6 | years5 = 2016– | clubs5 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps5 = 67 | goals5 = 13 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2017– | nationalteam2 = [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | pcupdate = 17:52, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 04:28, 30 May 2018 (UTC) }}
'''Manuel Lanzini''' ({{IPA-es|maˈnwel lanˈsini|am}}; born 15 February 1993) is an Argentine [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for English club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]]. He has previously played for [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] and [[Fluminense FC|Fluminense]]. He is described as possessing phenomenal [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] ability, as well as fantastic acceleration and vision and the ability to ghost past defenders.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gartner|first1=Daniel|title=All you need to know about West Ham target Manuel Lanzini [VIDEO]|url=http://outside90.com/all-you-need-to-know-about-west-ham-target-manuel-lanzini-037/|website=Outside90|accessdate=31 December 2015}}</ref> He is nicknamed "La Joya" ("the jewel").<ref name=uaesign/><ref name="Italy">{{cite web | url=http://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/asian-football/news/detail/item60524/Lanzini-set-to-join-West-Ham-on-loan | title=Lanzini set to join West Ham on loan | publisher=foxsportsasia.com | accessdate=7 July 2015 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924015031/http://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/asian-football/news/detail/item60524/Lanzini-set-to-join-West-Ham-on-loan | archivedate=24 September 2015 | df= }}</ref>
He currently holds the record of being the player that scored the earliest goal in the history of Argentina's derby, the [[Superclásico]], scoring only 43 seconds after the beginning of the match.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.clarin.com/deportes/lanzini-marco-rapido-historia-superclasico_0_BkYHmKdiwQg.html|title=Lanzini marcó el gol más rápido en la historia del Superclásico|publisher=Clarín|date=5 May 2013}}</ref>
==Career==
=== Early career and first steps at River Plate ===
He stood out in indoor soccer football divisions, demonstrating his capabilities in the class of 1993 of the Club Academia Kaly de Ituzaingó, a neighbourhood club. Ramón Maddoni, who discovered players like [[Juan Román Riquelme]], [[Carlos Tévez]] and [[Esteban Cambiasso]], wanted to take him to [[Club Atlético Boca Juniors|Boca Juniors]] for a test match but the young Lanzini firmly declined the call, stating that he only aimed to play for the club that he supported: [[Club Atlético River Plate]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clarin.com/deportes/futbol/Lanzini-busca-Aimar_0_320968047.html|title=Lanzini busca ser como Aimar|publisher=Clarín|date=31 August 2010}}</ref> He was finally taken to [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]], in 2002.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/Manuel-estilo_0_307769354.html|title=Manuel de estilo|publisher=Olé|date=11 August 2013}}</ref> He began playing as a playmaker in junior divisions. Lanzini began training in River and, after several tests, Pedro Vega, ex player and coach of inferior divisions from the club, ordered to hire him. In 2008 the 8th division team of which he was a part of won the trophy for that division, with a personal mark of 9 goals, only 2 less than Leonardo Salguero, who was his companion in attack and top scorer of the team with 11 goals. On 2 November 2008, River Plate won the junior division's [[Superclásico]] 3–0 to [[Club Atlético Boca Juniors|Boca Juniors]] with Lanzini scoring 2 goals and assisting the mentioned Salguero in other.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eldia.com.ar/edis/20081102/dep_popu45.htm|title=Los pibes de River, mareados de festejos|publisher=El Día|date=21 July 2010}}</ref>
=== Debut at River Plate (2010–11 season) ===
In 2010, the coach of River Plate's first team [[Ángel Cappa]], included him in the team for the winter preseason, disputing several matches in [[Salta Province]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.larazon.com.ar/deportes/Cappa-indulto-Canales-cito-promesa_0_143400058.html|title=Cappa indultó a Canales y citó a una promesa|work=La Razón|date=21 July 2010|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304194610/http://www.larazon.com.ar/deportes/Cappa-indulto-Canales-cito-promesa_0_143400058.html|archive-date=4 March 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He then made his informal debut in a friendly match against [[Central Norte]], a 3–0 victory, coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Ariel Ortega]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tycsports.com/notas/57197-caruso-debut-tres-goles-y-festej-river|title=Caruso debutó con tres goles y festejó River|publisher=TyC Sports|date=21 July 2010|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402171055/http://www.tycsports.com/notas/57197-caruso-debut-tres-goles-y-festej-river|archive-date=2 April 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He then played another friendly match against [[Juventud Antoniana]], in which his performance obtained a very good reception from the press and fans alike.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Amistosos/Nacionales/6859-manuel-lanzini-jugo-muy-bien-ante-juventud-antoniana.html|title=Lanzini cumplió un papel destacado|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=25 July 2010|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402125715/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Amistosos/Nacionales/6859-manuel-lanzini-jugo-muy-bien-ante-juventud-antoniana.html|archive-date=2 April 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clarin.com/deportes/futbol/Lanzini-brisa-aire-fresco_0_305369555.html|title=Lanzini: Una brisa de aire fresco|publisher=Clarín|date=26 July 2010}}</ref>
The mentioned performances in 2010 winter's preseason satisfied the coach. Finally he made his first appearance on 8 August 2010, against [[Club Atlético Tigre|Tigre]] for the first match of the Torneo Apertura 2010. River won 1–0 and Lanzini was replaced at half time by [[Facundo Affranchino]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/Falta-tiempo_0_313768643.html|title=Falta un tiempo|publisher=Olé|date=8 August 2010}}</ref>
This appearance made him one of the youngest players to make their debut in the First Division for River Plate, being only 17 years, 5 months and 24 days old, only after [[Daniel Villalva]], legend [[Adolfo Pedernera]] and the ex-Barcelona and Real Madrid player [[Javier Saviola]]. After his debut, coach Ángel Cappa did not include him in the match against [[Club Atlético Huracán|Huracán]]. Nevertheless, he played the next match against [[Club Atlético Independiente|Independiente]] in place of suspended [[Ariel Ortega]]. In that match he made an assist that allowed his teammate [[Rogelio Funes Mori]] to score the goal for the 3–2 victory, rounding out a strong performance.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.larazon.com.ar/deportes/River-aprovecho-Independiente-lider_0_160800012.html|title=River se aprovechó de Independiente y es uno de los líderes del Apertura|work=La Razón|date=22 August 2010|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304112437/http://www.larazon.com.ar/deportes/River-aprovecho-Independiente-lider_0_160800012.html|archive-date=4 March 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> 5 September, during the match River lost against [[Club Atlético Vélez Sarsfield|Vélez Sársfield]], he suffered from an injury after a strong tackle from [[Leandro Somoza]], which ruled him out for three weeks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/desgarron-Manu_0_330566963.html|title=El desgarrón de Manu|publisher=Olé|date=6 September 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Apertura-2010/7321-tres-fechas-sin-lanzini.html|title=Tres fechas sin Lanzini|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=7 September 2010|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100910104703/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Apertura-2010/7321-tres-fechas-sin-lanzini.html|archive-date=10 September 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his comeback to the first team on the 12 match of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.infobae.com/futbol/545803-100902-0-River-tropezo-nuevo-y-espera-Boca-un-clima-muy-complicado|title=River tropezó de nuevo y espera a Boca en un clima muy complicado|publisher=Infobae.com|date=8 November 2010}}</ref>
=== Fluminense (2011–12 season) ===
19 July 2011 an agreement was reached between [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] and [[Fluminense Football Club|Fluminense]], with the latter taking the player on loan for a fee of US$400,000, with a transfer option of [[Euro|€]]15,000,000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Mercado-de-Pases-/Mercado-de-Pases-2011/10557-manuel-lanzini-a-prestamo-al-fluminense.html|title=Lanzini fue cedido a préstamo al Fluminense|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=19 July 2011|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140817092709/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Mercado-de-Pases-/Mercado-de-Pases-2011/10557-manuel-lanzini-a-prestamo-al-fluminense.html|archive-date=17 August 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He made his debut in the 3–0 victory against [[Figueirense Futebol Clube|Figueirense]] for the 16th date of the [[Brasileirao 2011]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.estadao.com.br/noticias/esportes,no-rio-fluminense-vence-figueirense-por-3-a-0-e-alivia-crise-no-clube,759910,0.htm|title=No Rio, Fluminense vence Figueirense por 3 a 0 e alivia crise no clube|publisher=Esportes|date=17 August 2011}}</ref> He would then score his first official goal in the team's victory 2–1 against [[São Paulo Futebol Clube|São Paulo]] for the 20th date of that tournament.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Ex-River/11011-manuel-lanzini-gol-fluminense-san-pablo-brasileirao.html|archive-url=https://archive.today/20131013220841/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Ex-River/11011-manuel-lanzini-gol-fluminense-san-pablo-brasileirao.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=13 October 2013|title=Lanzini marcó su primer gol con la camiseta del Fluminense|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=1 September 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/futbol-internacional/Lanzini-Fluminense_0_546545659.html|title=La primera vez de Manu|publisher=Olé|date=1 September 2011}}</ref> His performances and character made the president of the club label him "The new [[Neymar]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/futbol/Lanzi-Ney_0_538746449.html|title=El Neymar argentino|publisher=Olé|date=19 August 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016235852/http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/futbol/Lanzi-Ney_0_538746449.html|archivedate=16 October 2013}}</ref> His most important goal for the club was against [[Clube de Regatas do Flamengo|Flamengo]] in the [[Río de Janeiro]] [[Fla-Flu]] derby.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Ex-River/11412-lanzini-clasico-carioca.html|title=Lanzini convirtió en el clásico contra Flamengo|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=11 October 2011|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120117181107/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Ex-River/11412-lanzini-clasico-carioca.html|archive-date=17 January 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Despite his good performances, Fluminense was unable to retain the player and after the loan he had to come back to [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bolavip.com/39390/el-fluminense-quiere-retener-a-lanzini/|title=El Fluminense quiere retener a Lanzini|publisher=Bolavip.com|date=8 October 2013}}</ref>
=== Comeback to River Plate and consolidation ===
==== 2012–13 season ====
He came back to [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] 30 June 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/futbol/veras-volver_0_728327474.html|title=Me verás volver|publisher=Olé|date=30 June 2012}}</ref> He jumped to the pitch as a starter on the team's first appearance in the tournament, scoring the team's only goal in the 1–2 loss against [[Club Atlético Belgrano|Belgrano de Córdoba]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Inicial-2012/14038-lanzini-fue-el-mejor-en-su-vuelta.html|title=Lanzini fue el mejor en su vuelta|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=6 August 2012|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131002105823/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Inicial-2012/14038-lanzini-fue-el-mejor-en-su-vuelta.html|archive-date=2 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> For his comeback, he asked to use the club's iconic number 10 shirt to the coach [[Matías Almeyda]], who allowed the player to do so. Nevertheless, during Almeyda's leadership Lanzini was not able to assure himself a place in the pitch, sometimes watching the matches from the bench or not forming part of the main team.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/futbol/lanzini_ni_al_banco_de_suplentes_0_766723700.html|title=Lo Lanzini del banco|publisher=Olé|date=11 August 2012}}</ref>
Almeyda was finally fired and the club's most successful coach to that date, ex [[Inter Milan]] player [[Ramón Díaz]] was appointed as team manager. With him, Lanzini's chance of regaining a place as a starter increased. Coach made a strong bet on Lanzini, putting him as a starter in the team's 2–0 victory against [[Club Atlético San Martín (San Juan)|San Martín (SJ)]] and Manu corresponded scoring one of the two goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/futbol/Lanzini-alegria_0_825517795.html|title=Lanzini a la alegría|publisher=Olé|date=11 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Inicial-2012/15279-lanzini-volvio-y-fue-figura.html|title=Lanzini: regreso, gol y figura|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=9 December 2012|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121212005501/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Inicial-2012/15279-lanzini-volvio-y-fue-figura.html|archive-date=12 December 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He was then considered a regular starter for the team. During the 12th date of the [[2012–13 Argentine Primera División season|Torneo Final 2013 tournament]], he was able to score his first goal in the [[Superclásico]], one of the most heated football rivalries in the world, in the 1–1 draw against [[Club Atlético Boca Juniors|Boca Juniors]]; this goal, as of 2018, stands out as the fastest goal in the derby's history (43 seconds).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Final-2013/17009-video-goles-boca-vs-river-torneo-final-2013-superclasico.html|title=El gol más rápido en la historia del Superclásico|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=5 May 2013|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130707161537/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Final-2013/17009-video-goles-boca-vs-river-torneo-final-2013-superclasico.html|archive-date=7 July 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> River would end up in 2nd place in the Torneo Final of the [[2012–13 Argentine Primera División season|season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Final-2013/17466-manuel-lanzini-river-desde-primer-momento-busco-triunfo-independ.html|title=Lanzini: "Lo fuimos a buscar desde el primer momento"|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=9 July 2013|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130612145134/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Final-2013/17466-manuel-lanzini-river-desde-primer-momento-busco-triunfo-independ.html|archive-date=12 June 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==== 2013–14 season ====
During the preseason facing the Torneo Final from the 2013 [[2013–14 Argentine Primera División season|season]], the club received an offer from the [[Baniyas SC|Baniyas]] from [[United Arab Emirates]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tycsports.com/notas/81999-lanzini-emiratos|title=¿Lanzini a Emiratos?|publisher=TyC Sports|date=18 July 2013|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029193225/http://www.tycsports.com/notas/81999-lanzini-emiratos|archive-date=29 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsportsla.com/noticias/111028-ofrecen-casi-7-millones-por-manuel-lanzini-desde-el-futbol-arabe?country=ar|title=Ofrecen 6.5 millones por Manuel Lanzini|publisher=Fox Sports|date=18 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201307/26071-una-nueva-oferta-para-que-lanzini-juegue-en-emiratos-arabes.html|title=Llegó otra oferta para que Lanzini juegue en Emiratos Árabes|publisher=Télam|date=24 July 2013}}</ref> but the player turned down the offer because, citing his own father, he considered to prioritize his professional sporting career over economic opportunities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Mercado-de-Pases-/Mercado-de-pases-2013/18069-lanzini-hector-padre-explica-motivos-rechazo-oferta-dubai.html|title=Padre de Lanzini: "Manuel me dijo que quiere ser feliz en River"|publisher=La Página Millonaria|date=24 July 2013|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029185324/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/Mercado-de-Pases-/Mercado-de-pases-2013/18069-lanzini-hector-padre-explica-motivos-rechazo-oferta-dubai.html|archive-date=29 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He remained one of the team highlights in both [[2013–14 Argentine Primera División season|Torneo Inicial 2013]] and international cup [[Copa Sudamericana 2013]] during that year, but the overall form of the team was inconsistent and thus River Plate did not win any trophies in that year.
Things would be different for the club in 2014. That year proved to be one of the most memorable year's in club's history, winning the [[2013–14 Argentine Primera División season|Torneo Final 2014]] and the [[Copa Sudamericana 2014]] kicking out Boca Juniors from that international competition. Lanzini remained half of the year as part of the team, so he was part of the Torneo Inicial 2014 trophy; during that time he continued to be one of the most important players in the pitch. He had the honor to once again score a goal in the team's victory in the 2014 [[Superclásico]] against Boca Juniors, the so-called "Bombonerazo" which began a series of crushing victories of River Plate over Boca Juniors. This match stood out in particular because it was the one that definitively launched the career of his teammate [[Ramiro Funes Mori]], a defender who scored a header in the last minutes of the match; he would end up also playing in the [[Premier League]], as Lanzini, for [[Everton FC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/futbol-primera/Boca-River_0_1111089189.html|title=Bombonerazo|publisher=Olé|date=30 March 2014}}</ref> River Plate would end up being [[2013–14 Argentine Primera División season|Torneo Final 2014]] champion, with a very solid performance from Manu, who scored 2 goals in 18 appearances.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/paso-gloria_0_1140486269.html|title=Campeón soy yo|publisher=Olé|date=18 May 2014}}</ref>
Prior to the beginning of local [[2014 Argentine Primera División|2014 Torneo de Transición Championship]] and international [[Copa Sudamericana 2014]], 6 August 2014 he transferred to the [[Al-Jazira Club]] of the [[UAE Pro-League]], for US$6.000.000, with a salary amounting to US$12.000.000 in 3 years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/futbol/titulo_0_1189681056.html|title=Ultimo Lanzini|publisher=Olé|date=8 August 2014}}</ref>
===Al Jazira=== In 2014 Lanzini became the youngest foreign player, at 21, to play in the [[UAE Arabian Gulf League]] when he signed a four-year deal for [[Al Jazira Club]]. He had been courted by clubs in England, Spain, Italy and Turkey, and was signed as a replacement for [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]]-bound [[Abdelaziz Barrada]].<ref name=uaesign>{{cite web | url=http://www.thenational.ae/sport/arabian-gulf-league/al-jazira-reach-for-youthful-injection-with-21-year-old-lanzini | title=Al Jazira reach for youthful injection with 21-year-old Lanzini | work=The National|location=Abu Dhabi | date=31 August 2014 | accessdate=7 July 2015}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== [[File:Manuel Lanzini with West Ham United, August 2015.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Lanzini warming-up for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in August 2015]]
====2015–16 season==== On 22 July 2015, Lanzini signed for [[Premier League]] side [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on a season-long loan, with an option to make the move permanent.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33625483 | title=Manuel Lanzini: West Ham sign Argentine midfielder | publisher=[[BBC Sport]]| accessdate=22 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2015/July/22-July/Hammers-snatch-%E2%80%98The-Jewel%E2%80%99 |title=Hammers snatch ‘The Jewel’ |publisher=[[West Ham United]] |accessdate=22 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150724221809/http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2015/July/22-July/Hammers-snatch-%E2%80%98The-Jewel%E2%80%99 |archivedate=24 July 2015 |df= }}</ref> He made his debut on 6 August in the [[UEFA Europa League]] third qualifying round away to [[Astra Giurgiu]], starting the match and scoring in the third minute, however the Hammers lost 2–1 (4–3 on aggregate) and were eliminated.<ref>{{cite news|title=Astra Giurgiu 2–1 West Ham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33738588|accessdate=6 August 2015|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=6 August 2015}}</ref> His league debut came on 15 August as a 76th-minute substitute for [[Cheikhou Kouyaté]] in a 1–2 home defeat to [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bevan|first1=Chris|title=West Ham 1–2 Leicester|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33832171|accessdate=16 August 2015|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=16 August 2015}}</ref> On 29 August, he scored his first league goal after just three minutes away to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], and assisted a [[Mark Noble]] goal as the Hammers won 3–0 for their first victory at [[Anfield]] since 1963.<ref>{{cite news|title=Liverpool hammered by West Ham as Coutinho sent off|url=http://www.espnfc.com/barclays-premier-league/match/422634/liverpool-west-ham-united/report|accessdate=29 August 2015|publisher=ESPN|date=29 August 2015}}</ref> In March 2016, West Ham confirmed that they had taken up the option to sign Lanzini on a permanent deal, with effect from 1 July 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/March/24-March/Hammers-complete-Lanzini-deal|title=Hammers complete Lanzini deal — West Ham United|accessdate=24 March 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== Lanzini played 39 games in all competitions for West Ham, scoring eight goals.<ref name=sway/> On 15 October 2016 he scored the only goal in a 1–0 win away to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] to give West Ham their first away win on the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37594218|title=Crystal Palace 0–1 West Ham United|date=15 October 2016|accessdate=26 August 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref name=sway/> His goal in a 1–0 win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 5 May 2017 halted Tottenham's challenge to win the Premier League title. Tottenham, at the time, were on a nine-match winning run and were challenging [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for the league title.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/05/west-ham-tottenham-premier-league-match-report|title=West Ham derail Tottenham’s title bid with Manuel Lanzini’s goal|first=Paul Doyle at the London|last=Stadium|date=5 May 2017|accessdate=26 August 2017|work=The Guardian}}</ref> On 9 May he was voted runner-up to [[Michail Antonio]] as [[West Ham United F.C.#Hammer of the Year|Hammer of the Year]] and the Players’ Player of the Year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/may/09-may/antonio-crowned-betway-hammer-year|title=Antonio crowned Betway Hammer of the Year |publisher=West Ham United F.C.|accessdate=26 August 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Lanzini made his first appearance of the season on 26 August 2017, in a 3–0 defeat away at [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40984016|date=26 August 2017|title=Newcastle United 3–0 West Ham United – BBC Sport|accessdate=26 August 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> In the same game, Lanzini was caught with an elbow by [[Aleksandar Mitrović (footballer)|Aleksandar Mitrović]], who was later banned for three games as a result of the incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11678/11013044/newcastles-aleksandar-mitrovic-handed-ban-after-accepting-fa-charge-of-violent-conduct|title=Newcastle's Aleksandar Mitrovic handed ban after accepting FA charge of violent conduct|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> Lanzini scored his first goal of the season in a 1–4 defeat at home to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 4 November 2017,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41785785|date=4 November 2017|title=West Ham United 1–4 Liverpool – BBC Sport|accessdate=4 November 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> before adding a further two goals to his tally on 13 January 2018 in a 4–1 away win at [[Huddersfield Town F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42587967|date=13 January 2018|title=Huddersfield Town 1–4 West Ham United – BBC Sport|accessdate=13 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 13 May, he scored twice in a 3–1 win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], on the final day of the season.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44020200|title=West Ham United 3-1 Everton|date=2018-05-13|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-GB}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== After being sidelined due to injury since May 2018, Lanzini made his first appearance of the season on 22 February 2019, coming on as a 76th minute substitute for [[Felipe Anderson]] in a 3–1 home win against [[Fulham F.C.]].<ref>https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/46386957/page/3</ref><ref>https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47248479</ref>
==International career== In May 2016, Lanzini was named in [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]]'s provisional 35-man squad for the [[2016 Summer Olympics|2016 Olympics]] in Rio de Janeiro.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onigeria.com/news/world/97374.html|title=Manuel Lanzini and Ramiro Funes Mori included in Argentina's provisional Olympics squad|work=onigeria|accessdate=25 May 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160630093531/http://www.onigeria.com/news/world/97374.html|archive-date=30 June 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He withdrew from the squad in July 2016 following a knee injury sustained while training in Miami, Florida, returning to London for treatment with West Ham United.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/argentina/story/2918096/manuel-lanzini-pulls-out-of-argentina-olympic-team-with-knee-injury | title=Manuel Lanzini pulls out of Argentina Olympic team with knee injury | publisher=ESPN | date=26 July 2016 | accessdate=27 July 2016}}</ref> In May 2017 Lanzini was named in new Argentina manager [[Jorge Sampaoli]]’s first squad for the upcoming friendlies against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] and [[Singapore national football team|Singapore]], with Lanzini making his full international debut on 9 June against Brazil at the [[Melbourne Cricket Ground|MCG]] in [[Melbourne]], [[Australia]], replacing [[Ever Banega]] in the 81st minute of ''La Albiceleste'''s 1–0 win. On 23 March 2018 he played a friendly match against Italy at Etihad Stadium in Manchester and scored his first international goal, as Argentina secured a 2–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.skysports.com/football/brazil-vs-argentina/370218 | title=Brazil 0–1 Argentina: Jorge Sampaoli's first game in charge ends in morale-boosting win | publisher=Sky Sports | date=9 June 2017 | accessdate=9 June 2017 }}</ref>
On 21 May 2018 he was named in Argentina’s final 23-man [[Argentina national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/icardi-cut-from-argentinas-23-man-world-cup-squad/lo0f6fig55ih1jh7w9v4enau6|title=Icardi cut from Argentina's 23-man World Cup squad|publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> and started in the 4–0 friendly win against [[Haiti national football team|Haiti]] on 29 May in [[Buenos Aires]], playing an hour before being substituted for [[Maximiliano Meza (footballer, born 1992)|Maximiliano Meza]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44299374|title=Argentina 4-0 Haiti|publisher=BBC}}</ref> On 8 June 2018, Lanzini was ruled out of the World Cup after suffering a ruptured anterior knee ligament injury during the training session.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/lanzini-to-miss-world-cup-after-knee-ligament-injury/21dvczyjodjz158u35hot4qgs|title=Lanzini to miss World Cup after knee ligament injury|publisher=Goal.com|accessdate=8 June 2018}}</ref>
===International goals=== {{updated|23 March 2018}} (Argentina score listed first, score column indicates score after each Lanzini goal)<ref name=sway/>

==Personal life== Lanzini was born in the [[Greater Buenos Aires]], in [[Ituzaingó, Buenos Aires|Ituzaingó]], and raised in [[San Antonio de Padua]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Apertura-2010/7025-perfil-de-manuel-lanzini-que-tuvo-su-debut-oficial-ante-tigre.html|title=Lanzini, la nueva joya de River|publisher=River Plate|date=9 August 2010|access-date=24 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029183747/http://www.riverplate.com/Noticias/futbol-profesional/Torneos-Locales/Torneo-Apertura-2010/7025-perfil-de-manuel-lanzini-que-tuvo-su-debut-oficial-ante-tigre.html|archive-date=29 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He also holds an Italian passport.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/west-ham-transfer-news-slaven-bilic-set-to-sign-manuel-lanzini-on-loan-10404052.html|title=West Ham transfer news: Slaven Bilic set to sign Manuel Lanzini on loan|work=London Evening Standard|accessdate=24 October 2016}}</ref> His father, Héctor, played for [[Sporting Cristal]] and [[Deportivo Morón]], while his brother [[Tomás Lanzini|Tomás]] has played for [[Ñublense]] and [[Club Atlético Brown|Brown de Adrogué]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/Familia-futbol_0_418158270.html|title=Familia fútbol|publisher=Olé|date=22 August 2010}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web | title = Héctor Lanzini: o segredo por trás da rápida adaptação da nova joia tricolor | author = Edgard Maciel Sa | work = globoesporte.com | date = 3 September 2011 | accessdate = 8 April 2018 | url = http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/times/fluminense/noticia/2011/09/hector-lanzini-o-segredo-por-tras-da-rapida-adaptacao-da-nova-joia-tricolor.html | language = es}}</ref> He is outspoken about his support of River Plate, celebrating club victories on social media, and has a tattoo of himself with the River Plate shirt on.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.ole.com.ar/river-plate/tatuaje-lanzini-hijo-river_0_1756024579.html|title=Manu lleva a River en la piel|publisher=Olé|date=9 March 2017}}</ref>

'''Robert Snodgrass''' (born 7 September 1987) is a Scottish professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Winger (soccer)|winger]] for [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland national team]]. He can also play as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].
Snodgrass started his senior career with [[Livingston F.C.|Livingston]]. He also had a loan spell at [[Stirling Albion F.C.|Stirling Albion]] before moving to England in 2008, joining [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]]. He helped Leeds win promotion to the [[Football League Championship|Championship]] in 2010. In February 2012, Snodgrass was appointed [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of Leeds, but he rejected a new contract offer and moved to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in July. He left Norwich after they were relegated in 2014 and moved to [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]]. On his league debut for Hull, Snodgrass suffered a serious knee injury that sidelined him for over a year. Hull were relegated in his absence, but Snodgrass helped them gain promotion via the playoffs in 2016. Snodgrass moved to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in January 2017.
After playing for Scotland at various youth levels including under-21s, Snodgrass received a call up to the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland national team]] side in 2009,<ref name = "2009 callup">{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1217397/Celtic-star-Danny-Fox-Leeds-winger-Robert-Snodgrass-called-Scotland-George-Burleys-boys-head-Japan.html | work=Mail Online| title=Celtic star Danny Fox and Leeds winger Robert Snodgrass called up for Scotland as George Burley's boys head to Japan | date=1 October 2009}}</ref> and won his first cap in February 2011.<ref name=ScoNIFeb2011>{{cite news|url=http://sport.scotsman.com/scotlandsfootballteam/How-Scotland-rated-against-Northern.6715094.jp?articlepage=2 |title=How Scotland rated against Northern Ireland |publisher=Johnston Publishing|work=Scotsman.com |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=12 March 2011}}</ref>
==Early life== Born in [[Glasgow]], Snodgrass grew up in the city's [[Gallowgate, Glasgow|Gallowgate]] area;<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31495582 |title=Scotland's Robert Snodgrass on the 'hardest task' of his life |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |first=Richard |last=Wilson |date=16 February 2015 |accessdate=28 January 2017}}</ref> he played boys club football for a team affiliated with [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] alongside future international teammate [[James McArthur]] who is a month younger and lived a few blocks away.<ref name=roots>{{cite web |url=https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/robert-snodgrass-grassroots-football-glasgow-7592004 |title=Robert Snodgrass: Grassroots football in Glasgow was tough... but it is brilliant |work=Daily Record|date=20 March 2016|accessdate=11 July 2018}}</ref> [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] offered him an apprenticeship, along with [[Clyde F.C.|Clyde]] and [[Livingston F.C.|Livingston]]. He felt that he had little chance of breaking through at [[Celtic Park|Parkhead]], so chose Livingston, joining their setup at the same time as another East End boy who would go on to play for Scotland, [[Graham Dorrans]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.livingston-mad.co.uk/feat/edz6/robert_snodgrass_interview_210608/index.shtml |title=Robert Snodgrass Interview|publisher=Digital Sports Group|work=Livi Mad |date=10 March 2005|accessdate=12 March 2011}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Livingston=== Snodgrass started his career at Livingston, where he scored 15 goals in 79 league games. He caught attention by turning down a trial with Spanish giants [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]].<ref name=BarcelonaTag>{{cite news|first=Michael|last=Baillie|date=25 June 2007|url=http://sport.scotsman.com/under20worldcup/Snodgrass-aims-to-put-Barcelona.3298548.jp|title=Snodgrass aims to put Barcelona tag behind him|work=Scotsman.com|publisher=Johnston Publishing|accessdate=10 February 2011}}</ref> Before he turned professional, he was offered a move to [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], though he chose to stay with Livingston.<ref>{{cite news|first=Alex|last=Livie|date=|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11676_2311276,00.html|title=Livi starlet snubbed Rovers|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=25 July 2008}}</ref> After recovering from a broken metatarsal, he moved to [[Stirling Albion F.C.|Stirling Albion]] on [[loan (association football)|loan]] for the remainder of the [[2006–07 in Scottish football|2006–07 season]] on 30 January 2007 to step up his recovery from injury.<ref name=BarcelonaTag/>
Snodgrass established himself as a regular first-team member during the [[2005–06 in Scottish football|2005–06 season]]. This was a campaign of mixed fortunes, as he gained regular first-team football, yet his side were relegated to [[Scottish First Division|Division 1]]. During Livingston's first season in the second tier, he scored ten goals for Livingston in the Scottish First Division during the 2007–08 season; he was offered a new contract at Livingston, but turned it down. After failing to impress during a trial spell with [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/leedsunited/LEEDS-UNITED-Robert39s-at-home.4698809.jp |title=LEEDS UNITED: Robert's at home in Leeds|work=Yorkshire Evening Post |date=15 November 2008|accessdate=12 March 2011}}</ref> he joined [[Football League One|League One]] team [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] in July 2008.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/l/leeds_united/7524992.stm|title=Snodgrass completes Leeds switch|date=25 July 2008|accessdate=29 January 2019}}</ref> He left the Lions scoring 15 goals in 79 games.
===Leeds United=== ====2008–09 season==== After joining Leeds, Snodgrass came into the side for the first game of the season to make his debut against [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]], gaining an assist after setting up [[Enoch Showunmi]]'s headed goal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Scunthorpe 1 – 2 Leeds: United Victorious|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/matchreport/20080809/scunthorpe-1-leeds-2_2247678_43673| publisher=Leeds United|date=9 August 2008|accessdate=28 January 2017 |archivedate=27 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101227095126/http://www.leedsunited.com/matchreport/20080809/scunthorpe-1-leeds-2_2247678_43673}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Leeds in the 5–2 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] victory over [[Chester City F.C.|Chester City]].{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}} After initially struggling to hold a regular place in the starting line-up, Snodgrass established himself after a string of impressive performances throughout November and December, which saw the young winger score four goals in seven games during a poor run of form for the Yorkshire club, culminating in the sacking of manager [[Gary McAllister]].{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}}
Leeds reached the playoffs but ultimately were knocked out of the competition after losing 2–1 on aggregate to [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/league-one/5325188/Leeds-United-1-Millwall-1-Agg-1-2-Match-report.html|work=The Telegraph|title=Leeds United 1 Millwall 1: Match report|date=14 May 2009}}</ref> He was the top assist maker in the division with 16, despite only playing regular first team football from December onwards.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}} In his first season at Leeds, he scored 11 goals and got 19 assists.<ref name="leedsunited.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101102/snoddy-on-form-elland-road-and-last-term_2247585_2205213 |title=Snoddy on Form, Elland Road, And Last Term |publisher=Leeds United FC |date=2 November 2010 |accessdate= 29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101105111109/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101102/snoddy-on-form-elland-road-and-last-term_2247585_2205213 |archivedate=5 November 2010}}</ref>
====2009–10 season==== On the eve of the season, Snodgrass signed a new four-year contract with the club.<ref>{{cite news| title = Snodgrass signs new deal at Leeds| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/l/leeds_united/8189946.stm| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 7 August 2009| accessdate = 1 June 2012}}</ref> Snodgrass made a slow start to the season, but chipped in with two assists, one against [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] in the League Cup, and the other against [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]].{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}} He bagged his first goals of the season with two against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] in the League Cup second round, sending Leeds through to the third round.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}}
Snodgrass scored a late winner against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in a 1–0 win for Leeds for his first league goal of the season.<ref name="leedsunited.com"/>
In May 2010, he was selected in the [[Football League One|League One]] [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the 2009–10 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.givemefootball.com/league-one/pfa-divisional-team-of-the-year-league-one |title=PFA Divisional Team of the Year: League One |publisher=Sports New Media |work=Give Me Football |date=26 April 2010 |accessdate=12 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100913082546/http://www.givemefootball.com/league-one/pfa-divisional-team-of-the-year-league-one |archivedate=13 September 2010 }}</ref> Snodgrass played an instrumental part as Leeds were promoted to [[Football League Championship|The Championship]] after finishing in second place in League One and thus earning automatic promotion. In his second season Snodgrass scored 10 goals in total and gained 14 assists.<ref name="leedsunited.com"/>
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Robert Snodgrass Arsenal vs Leeds FA Cup 3rd round 2011.jpg|thumb|upright|Snodgrass playing for [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] in 2011]]
On 27 July 2010, Snodgrass was believed to have suffered a serious knee injury during the pre-season game away to Norwegian team [[SK Brann|Brann]] after falling victim to a horrendous challenge by [[David Nielsen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/Leeds-United-Well-act-fast.6448352.jp |title=Leeds United: We'll act fast over Snodgrass |publisher=Johnston Publishing|work=Yorkshire Evening Post |date= 29 July 2010|accessdate=12 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/8295479.United_suffer_Snodgrass_injury_blow |title=United suffer Snodgrass injury blow |publisher=Newsquest|work=Telegraph & Argus|date=28 July 2010 |accessdate=12 March 2011}}</ref> The knee injury ruled him out of the rest of the pre-season campaign, but after two scans on the injured knee, the injury was not as serious as first feared, but kept Snodgrass out for several weeks. Manager [[Simon Grayson]] claimed that no exact timescale had been put on Snodgrass' recovery from injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/l/leeds_united/8879797.stm|work=BBC Sport|title=Leeds United forward Robert Snodgrass 'back in weeks'|date=3 August 2010}}</ref> Snodgrass returned to training at the start of September 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100909/duo-close-to-return-to-action_2247585_2148737 |title=Duo Close To Turn To Action|publisher=Leeds United|date=9 September 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archivedate=11 September 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100911055256/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100909/duo-close-to-return-to-action_2247585_2148737}}</ref> To help gain match fitness after his injury, Snodgrass played 90 minutes in a closed-doors friendly against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100914/good-news-as-united-beat-boro_2247585_2153881 |title=Good News As United Beat Boro|publisher=Leeds United|date=14 September 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archivedate=16 September 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100916001216/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100914/good-news-as-united-beat-boro_2247585_2153881}}</ref> Snodgrass returned to Leeds' squad after injury when he was named on the bench the game against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]], he came on as a second-half substitute replacing [[Ross McCormack]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100917/united-held-at-doncaster_2247585_2157209 |title=United Held at Doncaster |publisher=Leeds United |date=17 September 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archivedate=20 September 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100920134024/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100917/united-held-at-doncaster_2247585_2157209}}</ref>
Snodgrass came on as a second-half substitute against [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] and managed to assist Leeds' late winner for Bradley Johnson, however his game ended on a sour note when he was sent off for two yellow cards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100925/johnson-seals-united-win_2247585_2164449 |title=Johnson Seals United Win |publisher=Leeds United |date=25 September 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archivedate=27 September 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100927213437/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20100925/johnson-seals-united-win_2247585_2164449}}</ref> Snodgrass returned from suspension for Leeds against Ipswich Town, replacing Luciano Becchio in the starting lineup and scored his first goal of the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101001/snoddy-returns-to-squad_2247585_2170585 |title=Snoddy Returns To Squad |publisher=Leeds United |date=1 October 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archivedate=3 October 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101003034447/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101001/snoddy-returns-to-squad_2247585_2170585}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101002/ipswich-live_2247585_2171357 |title=10-MAN UNITED GO DOWN AT IPSWICH |publisher=Leeds United |date=2 October 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110101151206/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101002/10-man-united-go-down-at-ipswich_2247585_2171357 |archivedate=1 January 2011}}</ref> He scored his second goal of the season with a curled effort against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101106/coventry-live_2247585_2209355 |title=United Victorious at Coventry |publisher=Leeds United |date=6 November 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101109190632/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101106/united-victorious-at-coventry_2247585_2209355 |archivedate=9 November 2010}}</ref> His performance against Coventry was welcomed as a return to form by Snodgrass.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11688_6494867,00.html |title=Snoddy – We're no pushovers|publisher=Sky Sports |date=8 November 2010|accessdate=12 March 2011}}</ref> His third goal of the season came against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] with a long-range effort.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101226/leicester-live_2247585_2250758 |title=Boxing Day Draw For United |publisher=Leeds United |date=26 December 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101227142848/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20101226/boxing-day-draw-for-united_2247585_2250758 |archivedate=27 December 2010}}</ref>
On 1 January 2011, Snodgrass was injured in the 1–1 draw with Middlesbrough, where he was kicked once in the back as well as being stamped on the calf muscle.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110104/snoddy-a-doubt-as-boss-ponders-change_2247585_2257593 |title=Snoddy A Doubt As Boss Ponders Change |publisher=Leeds United|date=4 January 2011 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |archivedate=8 January 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110108185015/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110104/snoddy-a-doubt-as-boss-ponders-change_2247585_2257593}}</ref> He scored against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] with another long range goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110104/cardiff-live_2247585_2257690 |title=Unbeaten Run Ends at Cardiff |publisher=Leeds United |date=4 January 2011|accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110107072022/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110104/unbeaten-run-ends-at-cardiff_2247585_2257690 |archivedate=7 January 2011}}</ref> On 8 January 2011, Snodgrass scored with a second half penalty in a 1–1 [[2010–11 FA Cup|FA Cup]] draw with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110108/late-leveller-denies-united-arsenal-scalp_2247585_2260931 |title=Late Leveller Denies United Arsenal Scalp |publisher=Leeds United |date=8 January 2011 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110110140630/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110108/late-leveller-denies-united-arsenal-scalp_2247585_2260931 |archivedate=10 January 2011}}</ref> He scored his sixth goal of the season on 1 February, against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110201/united-comeback-secures-point_2247585_2282055 |title=United Comeback Secures Point|publisher=Leeds United |date= 1 February 2011|accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110204175043/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110201/united-comeback-secures-point_2247585_2282055 |archivedate=4 February 2011}}</ref> Snodgrass scored against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on 12 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110212/bristol-city-live_2247585_2290570 |title=United Victorious at Ashton Gate |publisher=Leeds United |date=12 February 2011 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110215123807/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110212/united-victorious-at-ashton-gate_2247585_2290570 |archivedate=15 February 2011}}</ref> Snodgrass missed Leeds' last few games of the season after suffering a back injury.<ref>[http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/football/footballleeds/9034747.Scots_call_up_McCormack_but_injured_Snodgrass_misses_out/?ref=rss Scots call up McCormack but injured Snodgrass misses out] Telegraph & Argus, 18 May 2011</ref>
====2011–12 season==== In June 2011, it was reported that Leeds had put an £8 million valuation on Snodgrass and that they were looking into offering him a new contract.<ref>[http://www.metro.co.uk/sport/football/867099-norwich-baulk-at-8million-price-tag-for-leeds-robert-snodgrass Norwich baulk at £8million price tag for Leeds' Robert Snodgrass] Metro.co.uk, 22 June 2011</ref> Snodgrass missed the [[2011–12 Football League Cup|League Cup]] match in August 2011 against [[Bradford City F.C.|Bradford City]] as he had been called up to the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland squad]].<ref name="leedsunited3">{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110803/snods-call-rules-him-out-of-cup-clash_2247585_2408626 |title=SNOD'S CALL RULES HIM OUT OF CUP CLASH |date=3 August 2011 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |work= |publisher=Leeds United FC |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111008125404/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110803/snods-call-rules-him-out-of-cup-clash_2247585_2408626 |archivedate=8 October 2011}}</ref> He started for Leeds on the opening day of the season as they lost 3–1 against Southampton.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110806/united-crash-at-southampton_2247585_2411474 |title=UNITED CRASH AT SOUTHAMPTON |accessdate=29 January 2017 |work= |publisher=Leeds United FC |date=6 August 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120209042157/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110806/united-crash-at-southampton_2247585_2411474 |archivedate=9 February 2012}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the season on 16 August, when he scored a freekick against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110816/hull-live_2247585_2422312 |title=SPARKLING LEEDS HIT HULL FOR FOUR |accessdate=29 January 2017 |work= |publisher=Leeds United FC |date=16 August 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120930113105/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110816/sparkling-leeds-hit-hull-for-four_2247585_2422312 |archivedate=30 September 2012}}</ref> Snodgrass was ruled out of action when he had an emergency operation to have his [[Vermiform appendix|appendix]] removed on 31 December 2011.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20111231/snoddy-sidelined-after-surgery_2247585_2561021| title=SNODDY SIDELINED AFTER SURGERY| publisher=Leeds United FC| date=31 December 2011 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120107221921/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20111231/snoddy-sidelined-after-surgery_2247585_2561021 |archivedate=7 January 2012}}</ref> He returned to action for Leeds just two weeks later, scoring in a 1–1 draw against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 14 January 2012.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120114/united-held-by-dogged-palace_2247585_2576921| title =UNITED HELD BY DOGGED PALACE| publisher=Leeds United FC| date=14 January 2012 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120116214710/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120114/united-held-by-dogged-palace_2247585_2576921 |archivedate=16 January 2012}}</ref> On 21 January, he scored a goal in a 3–1 win over Ipswich.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120121/its-three-for-leeds-at-home_2247585_2584051| title =IT'S THREE FOR LEEDS AT HOME!| publisher=Leeds United FC| date=21 January 2012 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120124022100/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120121/its-three-for-leeds-at-home_2247585_2584051 |archivedate=24 January 2012}}</ref>
Snodgrass was appointed [[club captain]] by new Leeds manager [[Neil Warnock]], ahead of his first game in charge against Portsmouth on 25 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120227/its-captain-snodgrass-now_2247585_2625483 |title=IT'S CAPTAIN SNODGRASS NOW!|publisher=Leeds United FC |date=27 February 2012 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120229050929/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120227/its-captain-snodgrass-now_2247585_2625483 |archivedate=29 February 2012}}</ref> Warnock confirmed he had offered Snodgrass a new contract which would make him Leeds' highest-paid player.<ref>{{cite news|title=Snodgrass offered Leeds deal|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12691/7667451/Snodgrass-offered-Leeds-deal|publisher=Sky Sports|date=12 April 2012|accessdate=12 April 2012}}</ref> Snodgrass finished the season with 13 goals and the second highest amount of assists in The Championship, with 14.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.statbunker.com/football/btb/index.php?PL=competition&CompID=370&statType=assist&x=20&y=5|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130203170119/http://www.statbunker.com/football/btb/index.php?PL=competition&CompID=370&statType=assist&x=20&y=5|dead-url=yes|archivedate=3 February 2013|title=Npower Championship 11/12 / Most Assists|publisher=Stat Bunker|date= 3 May 2012 |accessdate= 3 May 2012}}</ref> Snodgrass won both Leeds' Fans Player of the Year and Players' Player of the Year awards during the club's end of season awards ceremony on 28 April.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120430/skipper-snoddys-double-success_2247585_2754619|title=Captain picks up Player of the Year awards|publisher=Leeds United FC|date= 30 April 2012 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120501233135/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120430/skipper-snoddys-double-success_2247585_2754619 |archivedate=1 May 2012}}</ref>
===Norwich City=== Snodgrass signed for [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on a three-year contract in July 2012 for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18986870|title=Robert Snodgrass joins Norwich City from Leeds United|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|date=26 July 2012|accessdate=26 July 2012}}</ref> He made his debut in the opening game of the season on 18 August 2012, a 5–0 defeat away to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]. Two matches later, on 1 September 2012, Snodgrass scored his first goal for the club when he scored the equaliser which saw Norwich draw 1–1 with Tottenham Hotspur.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19377918|title=Robert Snodgrass scored a dramatic late equaliser as Norwich consigned 10-man Tottenham to their worst start to a Premier League season for four years.|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|date=1 September 2012|accessdate=1 September 2012}}</ref> He scored his second goal on 28 November, scoring a free-kick in a 1–1 draw against Southampton.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20422478 |title=Southampton 1–1 Norwich |accessdate=29 January 2017 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=28 November 2012 |first=Jeremy |last=Butler }}{{Dead link|date=December 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
Snodgrass would go on to establish himself as a regular in the first team squad. After a successful campaign in which the club finished 11th in the table, he would be voted by Norwich fans as second place in the [[Norwich City F.C. Player of the Season|Player of the Season]] that season. He narrowly missed out on the trophy, which was won by [[Sébastien Bassong]] instead.
Snodgrass scored his first goal of the 2013–14 season with a "free-kick from around 20 yards that looped over the wall and into the bottom-left corner of the net" in a 3–1 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 9 November.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/matchday/matches/2013-2014/epl.html/norwich-vs-west-ham |title=Norwich 3–1 West Ham |publisher=Premier League |date=9 November 2013 |accessdate=1 September 2014}}</ref> He scored again on 23 February 2014 against Tottenham after a cutting through ball from Bradley Johnson, holding off the defender and placing it past goalkeeper [[Hugo Lloris]] from just inside the box. That goal turned out to be the only goal, as Norwich won 1–0.
===Hull City=== [[File:Robert Snodgrass 21-07-2014 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Snodgrass playing for [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in 2014]]
On 30 June 2014, Hull City signed Snodgrass for an undisclosed fee, believed to exceed £6 million, on a three-year contract.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28040408 |title=Robert Snodgrass: Hull City sign Scotland midfielder from Norwich |work=BBC Sport |date=30 June 2014|accessdate=30 June 2014}}</ref> Snodgrass dislocated a kneecap during a 1–0 win at [[Queen's Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] in August 2014.<ref name = "kneecap"/> The injury, which required surgery to heal, was initially expected to keep Snodgrass out of action for several months.<ref name = "kneecap">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28824194 |title=Robert Snodgrass: Hull boss Steve Bruce confirms six-month lay-off |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=20 August 2014 |accessdate=20 August 2014}}</ref> A month later, it was reported that he would be out of action for the entirety of the [[2014–15 Hull City A.F.C. season|2014–15 season]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11714/9461836/hull-citys-robert-snodgrass-rues-season-ending-knee-injury |title=Premier League: Hull City's Robert Snodgrass rues season-ending knee injury |first=Pete |last=O'Rourke |work=Sky Sports |publisher=BSkyB |date=15 September 2014 |accessdate=10 November 2015}}</ref> Snodgrass made his first appearance in a game since the injury in November 2015, playing in an under-21 Premier League Cup match.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hulldailymail.co.uk/robert-snodgrass-player-watch-hull-city-relieved/story-28143456-detail/story.html |title=Robert Snodgrass player-watch: Hull City relieved with promising showing on return |first=James |last=Smailes |work=Hull Daily Mail |publisher= |date=9 November 2015 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208083646/http://www.hulldailymail.co.uk/Robert-Snodgrass-player-watch-Hull-City-relieved/story-28143456-detail/story.html |archivedate=8 December 2015 }}</ref> His first return to first-team action was in the [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]] away to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 1 December 2015 when he came on as a replacement for [[Sone Aluko]] in the 73rd-minute.<ref>{{cite news| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34907256| title = Man City 4–1 Hull| date = 1 December 2015| work = BBC Sport| publisher = BBC| accessdate = 1 December 2015}}</ref> On 9 January 2016, in the third-round of the [[FA Cup]] match against Brighton & Hove Albion, he scored a penalty to take the team through the next round.<ref>{{cite news| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35211426| title = Hull 1–0 Brighton| date = 9 January 2016| work = BBC Sport| publisher = BBC| accessdate = 9 January 2016}}</ref> On 10 December 2016 Snodgrass won a penalty in a crucial home tie against Crystal Palace. Replays showed that he dived and he later apologized.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38277655 |title=Robert Snodgrass: Hull winger apologises for winning first-half penalty |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=10 December 2016 |accessdate=10 December 2016}}</ref>
In January 2017, Hull accepted offers of about £10 million for Snodgrass from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]] and [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38755703 |title=Robert Snodgrass: West Ham bid more than Burnley for Hull midfielder |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=26 January 2017 |accessdate=26 January 2017}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== On 27 January 2017, Snodgrass joined [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on a three-and-a-half-year deal for a fee of £10.2 million.<ref>{{cite web |title=Robert Snodgrass: West Ham sign Hull midfielder for £10.2m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38775507 |publisher=BBC |work=BBC Sport |date=27 January 2017 |accessdate=27 January 2017}}</ref> He made his West Ham debut on 1 February 2017, coming on as a 64th-minute substitute for [[Pedro Obiang]], in West Ham's 0–4 home defeat by [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38740421|title=West Ham United 0–4 Manchester City|date=1 February 2017|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|accessdate=2 February 2017}}</ref> His first start for the club came away at Saint Mary's Stadium against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], which [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]] won 1–3.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38779644|title=Southampton 1–3 West Ham United|date=4 February 2017|newspaper=BBC Sport|accessdate=4 February 2017}}</ref> In August 2017, having played 15 games for West Ham without scoring, Snodgrass was told that he was free to leave the club either permanently or on loan.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40968378|title=Robert Snodgrass: West Ham winger is told he can leave the club|date=17 August 2017|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref>
Snodgrass spent most of the 2017–18 season on loan at [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], after which he returned to West Ham. He scored his first two goals for West Ham in their 8–0 win against [[Macclesfield Town F.C.|Macclesfield Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]] on 26 September 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45569334|title=West Ham 8–0 Macclesfield: Hammers thrash Macclesfield to reach fourth round|date=26 September 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=27 September 2018}}</ref> In March 2019, Snodgrass was charged by the [[Football Association]] with allegedly abusing anti-doping officials who were visiting West Ham's training ground on 6 February 2019 to conduct out-of-competition testing.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47448177|title=West Ham midfielder Robert Snodgrass charged by Football Association|date=4 March 2019|publisher=|accessdate=5 March 2019|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
====Aston Villa loan==== On 25 August 2017, Snodgrass joined [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] for the remainder of the 2017–18 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/august/25-august/snodgrass-joins-aston-villa-season-long-loan|title=Snodgrass joins Aston Villa on season-long loan |date = 25 August 2017|accessdate=25 August 2017}}</ref> Snodgrass impressed with his early performances for Aston Villa winning praise from manager, [[Steve Bruce]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.90min.com/posts/5596519-aston-villa-boss-steve-bruce-hails-impact-of-robert-snodgrass-after-victory-over-burton|title=Aston Villa Boss Steve Bruce Hails Impact of Robert Snodgrass After Victory Over Burton|date=27 September 2017|publisher=|accessdate=28 September 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 4–0 win over [[Burton Albion]] on 26 September.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41315200|title=Burton Albion 0–4 Aston Villa|publisher=BBC|date=26 September 2017 |accessdate=27 September 2017}}</ref>
During his loan spell he scored seven goals and got 14 assists, to help Aston Villa secure a play-off place and defeat [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] in the two semi finals to reach [[2018 EFL Championship play-off Final|the final]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44035613 |title=Aston Villa 0–0 Middlesbrough |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2018 |accessdate=16 May 2018}}</ref> playing in the final, as Villa lost 1–0 to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in the final missing out on promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44178427 |title=Aston Villa 0–1 Fulham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2018 |accessdate=28 May 2018}}</ref> His 14 assists also saw him finish joint top (with [[Barry Douglas]]) of the assists charts in the [[EFL Championship]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/assists/eng-championship-2017-2018/|title=Championship 2017/2018 » Assists|publisher=World Football|date=25 July 2018|accessdate=25 July 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Snodgrass vs Brazil (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Snodgrass playing for [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] in 2011]]
Snodgrass is a former [[Scotland national under-19 football team|Scotland under-19]], [[Scotland national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[Scotland national under-21 football team|under-21]] international. With the under-19 team, he was part of the squad that reached the final of the [[2006 European Under-19 Football Championship|2006 European Championships]] in Poland, although Snodgrass was suspended for the final itself.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/5221720.stm |title=Scotland U19 1–2 Spain U19 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=29 July 2006 |accessdate=29 January 2017}}</ref> Snodgrass also played for [[Scotland national under-20 football team|Scotland under-20]] in the [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in [[Canada]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/6270034.stm |title=Scotland U20 0–2 Nigeria U20 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |first=Clive |last=Lindsay |date=5 July 2007|accessdate=29 January 2017}}</ref> It was his form in this tournament that led to Barcelona showing interest in Snodgrass.<ref name="McColl"/>
Leeds' involvement in the play-offs against Millwall in 2009 meant that Snodgrass was unavailable to play in a [[Scotland B national football team|Scotland B]] international.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leeds star Robert Snodgrass determined to force way back into Scotland reckoning|work=Daily Record|date=28 October 2010|accessdate=10 February 2011|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/football/scotland/2010/10/28/leeds-star-robert-snodgrass-determined-to-force-way-back-into-scotland-reckoning-86908-22663926/}}</ref>
Snodgrass was called up to the senior [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] squad by [[George Burley]] for the first time for their [[Exhibition game|friendly]] against [[Japan national football team|Japan]] in October 2009.<ref name = "2009 callup"/> He was forced to withdraw from the squad due to a knee injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/leedsunited/Leeds-United-Does-Scotland-call.6618351.jp|title=Leeds United: Does Scotland call up beckon for Snodgrass?|work=Yorkshire Evening Post|date=9 November 2010|quote=A knee injury came between Snodgrass and his international debut 13 months ago and the landscape north of the border has shifted since then. George Burley – the coach who planned to play Snodgrass in a friendly in Japan – lost his job late last year; his successor, Craig Levein, is yet to bring the winger on board. |accessdate=10 February 2011}}</ref> Snodgrass made his full international debut on 9 February 2011, coming on as a substitute against [[Northern Ireland national football team|Northern Ireland]] in a [[2011 Nations Cup]] match.<ref name=ScoNIFeb2011/> Snodgrass was called up to the Scotland squad to face [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] on 21 March 2011,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110321/two-more-set-for-international-duty_2247585_2320791 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110323115220/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110321/two-more-set-for-international-duty_2247585_2320791 |dead-url=yes |archivedate=23 March 2011 |title=TWO MORE SET FOR INTERNATIONAL DUTY |publisher=Leeds United |date=21 March 2011 |accessdate=23 March 2011 }}</ref> coming on as a second-half substitute. Scotland lost the game 2–0.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/scotland/9431234.stm | work=BBC Sport | title=Scotland 0–2 Brazil | date=27 March 2011|accessdate=25 April 2011}}</ref> Snodgrass was ruled out of Scotland's Nations Cup matches against [[Wales national football team|Wales]] and the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] with a back injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110517/striker-ross-gets-international-call_2247585_2361498 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110521144359/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20110517/striker-ross-gets-international-call_2247585_2361498 |dead-url=yes |archivedate=21 May 2011 |title=STRIKER ROSS GETS INTERNATIONAL CALL |publisher=Leeds United |date=17 May 2011 |accessdate=18 May 2011 }}</ref>
On 2 August 2011, Snodgrass was called up to the squad for a friendly against [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]].<ref name="leedsunited3"/> He made his first start for Scotland against Denmark and also scored his first international goal in this game.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/scotland/9561341.stm | work=BBC Sport | first=Martin | last=Conaghan | title=Scotland v Denmark as it happened | date=10 August 2011| accessdate=10 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/scotland/14481694.stm | work=BBC Sport | title=Snodgrass pleased with debut goal | date=10 August 2011 | accessdate=10 August 2011}}</ref> On 7 June 2013, during [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|2014 FIFA World Cup qualifying]], he scored the only goal in a 1–0 win against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]], inflicting their first competitive defeat at home since they lost 4–1 to [[England national football team|England]] in 2008.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22787925 |title=Croatia 0–1 Scotland|work= BBC Sport|date= 7 June 2013|accessdate= 8 June 2013}}</ref>
The kneecap injury that Snodgrass suffered in August 2014 caused him to miss the whole of the [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]] campaign. He was recalled to the national squad for a friendly match against the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] in March 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35866870 |first=Richard |last=Wilson |title=Scotland v Czech Republic: I'm back at my previous level – Snodgrass |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=21 March 2016 |accessdate=29 May 2016}}</ref> In the first match of [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]], Snodgrass scored a hat-trick in a 5–1 win against [[Malta national football team|Malta]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37207612 |title=Malta 1–5 Scotland |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |first=Alasdair |last=Lamont |date=4 September 2016 |accessdate=5 September 2016}}</ref>
==Personal life== Snodgrass has a daughter, Sienna, with his girlfriend Denise.<ref name="McColl">{{cite news| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/scotland/article1779973.ece |work=Times Online| title=Stirling provide the spark as Snodgrass gets back on track | first=Graham | last=McColl | date=12 May 2007|accessdate=28 May 2010}}{{subscription}}</ref>
On 24 January 2011, an arrest warrant was issued for Snodgrass after he failed to turn up to court regarding an alleged driving offence.<ref name = "arrest">{{cite news|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/BREAKING-Arrest-warrant-out-for.6700820.jp|title=Arrest warrant out for Leeds United winger|last=Robinson|first=Paul|work=Yorkshire Evening Post|date=24 January 2011|accessdate=10 February 2011}}</ref> A spokesman for Leeds United said that the non-appearance was due to a misunderstanding and that Snodgrass was working with the judicial authorities to resolve the matter.<ref name = "arrest"/>
On 3 March 2017, another arrest warrant was issued for him after he failed to attend his trial for allegedly driving in Glasgow with a baby being held in the arms of a passenger. His defence lawyer said that Snodgrass' absence was due to a misunderstanding.<ref>{{cite news|title=Warrant issued for Scotland footballer Snodgrass over baby in car|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-scotland-glasgow-west-39156677|accessdate=4 March 2017|publisher=BBC News|date=3 March 2017}}</ref>

==Honours== '''Stirling Albion''' *[[Scottish Football League First Division]] play-offs: [[2006–07 Scottish First Division#First Division play-offs|2007]]<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_div_1/6636659.stm |title=Stirling Albion 2–2 Airdrie |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 May 2007 |accessdate=23 December 2018}}<br />{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_div_1/6645265.stm |title=Airdrie Utd 2–3 Stirling Albion |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 May 2007 |accessdate=23 December 2018}}</ref>
'''Leeds United''' *[[Football League One]] runner-up: [[2009–10 Football League One|2009–10]]<ref>{{cite book |editor1-first=Glenda |editor1-last=Rollin |editor2-first=Jack |editor2-last=Rollin |title=Sky Sports Football Yearbook 2010–2011 |year=2010 |publisher=Headline Publishing Group |location=London |isbn=978-0-7553-6107-6 |pages=37, 220–221}}</ref>
'''Hull City''' *[[Football League Championship play-offs]]: [[2016 Football League play-offs#Championship|2016]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36348885 |title=Hull City 1–0 Sheffield Wednesday |first=Adam |last=Williams |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 May 2016 |accessdate=5 June 2016}}</ref>
'''Individual''' *[[Professional Footballers' Association|PFA]] Player of the Month ([[Football League One|League One]]): August/September 2009<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.givemefootball.com/pfa-fans-awards/leeds-scottish-winger-takes-league-one-fans-award |title=PFA Fans' Award: Leeds United midfielder Robert Snodgrass is the August/September Player of the Month |publisher=Sports new Media |work=GiveMeFootball.com |date=2 October 2009 |accessdate=12 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110613154504/http://www.givemefootball.com/pfa-fans-awards/leeds-scottish-winger-takes-league-one-fans-award |archivedate=13 June 2011}}</ref> *[[PFA Team of the Year]] ([[EFL League One|League One]]): [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#League One|2009–10]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1268852/Wayne-Rooney-Manchester-United-dominate-PFA-Team-Year.html |title=Wayne Rooney leads the charge as Manchester United dominate PFA Team of the Year |publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]'' |date=27 April 2010 |accessdate=27 January 2017}}</ref> *[[List of Leeds United F.C. players#Player of the Year|Leeds United Supporters' Player of the Year]]: 2011–12<ref name="Oz White">{{cite web |url=http://www.ozwhitelufc.net.au/players_profiles/S/SnodgrassR.php |title=Player Profiles – Robert Snodgrass |publisher=Oz White LUFC |accessdate=27 January 2017}}</ref> *[[List of Leeds United F.C. players#Player of the Year|Leeds United Players' Player of the Year]]: 2011–12<ref name="Oz White"/> *[[Norwich City F.C. Player of the Season|Norwich City Supporters' Player of the Year]]: 2013–14<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.canaries.co.uk/news/article/20140511-robert-snodgrass-norwich-city-player-of-the-season-1545672.aspx |title=ROBERT SNODGRASS: PLAYER OF THE SEASON |publisher=[[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City FC]] |date=11 May 2014 |accessdate=27 January 2017}}</ref> *[[Scottish Football Writers' Association|SFWA]] International Footballer of the Year: 2014<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/10806478/Norwich-City-midfielder-Robert-Snodgrass-insists-side-can-stay-up-ahead-of-Chelsea-test-at-Stamford-Bridge.html |title=Norwich City midfielder Robert Snodgrass insists side can stay up ahead of Chelsea test at Stamford Bridge |publisher=''[[Daily Telegraph]]'' |date=3 May 2014 |accessdate=27 January 2017}}</ref>
