{{Medal|Team|{{fb|COL}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Copa América Centenario]]}} {{Medal|B|[[Copa América Centenario|2016 United States]]|}} }} '''Carlos Alberto Sánchez Moreno''' (born 6 February 1986) is a Colombian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] for English Club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. He is nicknamed ''La Roca'' (''The Rock''), due to his strength on the pitch.<ref name=hart>{{cite news|last1=Hart|first1=Simon|title=Carlos Sanchez interview: Midfielder ready to be a rock for Aston Villa revival|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/carlos-sanchez-interview-midfielder-ready-to-be-a-rock-for-aston-villa-revival-10030341.html|accessdate=21 April 2015|work=The Independent|date=6 February 2015}}</ref>
He began his career at [[River Plate Montevideo]] before moving to [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]] in 2007, where he made 178 [[Ligue 1]] appearances and scored ten goals across six seasons. He later played in [[La Liga]] for [[Elche CF|Elche]] and [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]], the [[Premier League]] for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] and [[Serie A]] for [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]].
A full international since 2007, Sánchez has earned over 80 caps for Colombia. He was part of the squads that reached the quarter-finals of the [[2011 Copa América]], [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and the [[2015 Copa América]], and finished third in the 2016 [[Copa América Centenario]].
==Club career== ===Colombia=== Born in [[Quibdó]], [[Department of Chocó|Chocó]], Sánchez moved to a football school in [[Medellín]] and then onto Uruguayan club [[Danubio F.C.|Danubio]], where he signed his first professional contract in 2003 and was a teammate of [[Edinson Cavani]].<ref name=hart/> However, he was released two years later, making no first-team appearances.
In the summer of 2005, Sánchez joined fellow league team [[Club Atlético River Plate (Montevideo)|River Plate Montevideo]]. He featured in 40 matches during his two-year spell, scoring once.
===Valenciennes=== In July 2007, Sánchez was bought by a group of investors and was assigned to [[Rangers de Talca]], subsequently moving abroad for the first time in his career, by agreeing to a five-year deal with [[Ligue 1]] side [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]]. He made his debut on 4 August, starting in a 3–1 home win against [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]].
Sánchez featured regularly for the side in [[2007–08 Ligue 1|his debut campaign]], and was an ever-present figure during the following seasons. In March 2010, he damaged his [[anterior cruciate ligament]], being sidelined nearly a year.<ref>[http://www.va-fc.com/fr/saison/breves/article/4254/Blessure-de-Carlos-Sanchez.html?pge=202 Blessure de Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Sánchez's injury)]; Valenciennes' official website, 24 March 2010 {{fr icon}}</ref>
After making 148 appearances for the club, scoring 8 goals in the league, Sánchez left the club in the summer of 2012 when his contract expired. After long negotiations with [[Bolton Wanderers]]<ref>[https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/bolton-scrap-carlos-sanchez-interest-1234215 Trotters aren't plonkers: Bolton abandon Sanchez chase as his price doubles]; [[Daily Mirror]], 7 August 2012</ref> and [[West Ham United]],<ref>[https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/west-ham-transfers-carlos-sanchez-1200870 Carlos whisper: West Ham plot cheeky swoop for Colombia's Sanchez]; Daily Mirror, 1 August 2012</ref> he failed to reach an agreement with any club, and subsequently rejoined his former club Valenciennes on 25 August 2012.<ref>[http://www.mercato365.com/infos-clubs/valenciennes/valenciennes-c-sanchez-en-pret-884835.shtml Valenciennes : C.Sanchez en prêt (Valenciennes: C. Sánchez on loan)]; Mercato 365, 25 August 2012 {{fr icon}}</ref>
===Elche=== On 16 August 2013, Sánchez signed a three-year deal with Spanish side [[Elche CF|Elche]], [[2013–14 Segunda División|freshly promoted]] to [[La Liga]],<ref>[http://www.elchecf.es/primer-equipo/-/asset_publisher/TK7hGIx6FcUn/content/carlos-sanchez-di-mi-palabra-al-elche-y-aqui-estoy- Carlos Sánchez: "Di mi palabra al Elche y aquí estoy" (Carlos Sánchez: "I gave my word to Elche and here I am")] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729074925/http://www.elchecf.es/primer-equipo/-/asset_publisher/TK7hGIx6FcUn/content/carlos-sanchez-di-mi-palabra-al-elche-y-aqui-estoy- |date=29 July 2014 }}; Elche's official website, 16 August 2013 {{es icon}}</ref> for a [[Euro|€]]3.7 million fee.<ref>[http://www.lasprovincias.es/v/20130805/deportes/elche-cf/elche-ficha-colombiano-carlos-20130805.html El Elche ficha al colombiano Carlos Sánchez (Elche signs Colombian Carlos Sánchez)]; Las Provincias, 5 August 2013 {{es icon}}</ref> He made his debut on 24 August, starting in a 1–1 home draw against [[Real Sociedad]].<ref>[http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2013_14/primera/jornada_2/elc_rso/ Zurutuza despierta a la Real (Zurutuza awakes Real)]; [[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]], 24 August 2013 {{es icon}}</ref>
===Aston Villa=== On 15 August 2014, [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] announced the signing of Sánchez on a four-year contract for an undisclosed fee reported to be around £4.7 million.<ref name=hart/><ref>{{cite news|title=Carlos Sanchez: Aston Villa sign Colombia World Cup star|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28812168|accessdate=21 April 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=15 August 2014}}</ref> His first Villa appearance came eight days later when he replaced [[Charles N'Zogbia]] as a substitute in the 62nd minute of a goalless draw with [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] at [[Villa Park]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Keegan|first1=Mike|title=Aston Villa 1–0 Newcastle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28816297|accessdate=21 April 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=23 August 2014}}</ref> He made his first start for the club in their 0–3 home defeat against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 20 September, after illness had ruled out some of his teammates.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sanghera|first1=Mandeep|title=Aston Villa 0–3 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29187273|accessdate=21 April 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=20 September 2014}}</ref> On 11 April 2015, he was sent off for two yellow cards as the team won 1–0 away to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]], causing him to miss their victory over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the [[FA Cup]] semi-final eight days later.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Begley|first1=Emlyn|title=Tottenham 0–1 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32179967|accessdate=21 April 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=11 April 2015}}</ref> Sánchez scored his first goal for Villa on 25 April, an 85th-minute deflected volleyed equaliser away to title holders [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], but [[Fernandinho (footballer)|Fernandinho]] later netted a winner for City.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Emons|first1=Michael|title=Man City 3–2 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32362999|accessdate=26 April 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=25 April 2015}}</ref> He made a 19-minute substitute appearance in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] on 30 May at [[Wembley Stadium]] in place of [[Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1990)|Ashley Westwood]], in an eventual 0–4 loss to Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32856754|accessdate=30 May 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=30 May 2015}}</ref>
===Fiorentina=== On 10 August 2016, after Villa's relegation, Sánchez was loaned to [[Serie A]] club [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] for a [[2016–17 Serie A|season]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Carlos Sanchez: Aston Villa midfielder joins Fiorentina on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37035007 |accessdate=20 June 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut ten days later as a 65th-minute substitute for [[Milan Badelj]] in a 2–1 loss away to reigning champions [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] on the first day of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Juventus 2–1 Fiorentina |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36947770 |accessdate=20 June 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 August 2016}}</ref> Eight days later, he made his first start in a 1–0 home win over [[Chievo Verona|Chievo]], in which he scored the goal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Fiorentina 1-0 Chievo Verona |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=461283 |accessdate=20 June 2018 |agency=PA Sport |publisher=ESPN FC |date=28 August 2016}}</ref> The move was made permanent at the end of the campaign.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gladwell |first1=Ben |title=Fiorentina sign midfielder Jordan Veretout from Aston Villa |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/soccer-transfers/story/3164632/fiorentina-sign-jordan-veretout-from-aston-villa |accessdate=20 June 2018 |publisher=ESPN FC |date=25 July 2017}}</ref>
On 31 January 2018, Sánchez returned to La Liga on loan to [[RCD Espanyol]] for the remainder of the [[2017–18 La Liga|season]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rcdespanyol.com/en/news/carlos-sanchez-new-espanyol-player/_n:6607/|title=Carlos Sánchez new Espanyol player|language=es|date=31 January 2018}}</ref> He made his debut four days later in a 1–1 home draw with [[FC Barcelona]] in the ''[[Derbi barceloní]]'', playing the final four minutes in place of [[Léo Baptistão]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Carlos Sánchez debutó en el juego entre Espanyol y Barcelona|trans-title=Carlos Sánchez debuted in the game between Espanyol and Barcelona |url=http://www.elpais.com.co/deportes/futbol-internacional/carlos-sanchez-debuto-en-el-juego-entre-espanyol-y-barcelona.html |accessdate=20 June 2018 |work=El País |agency=EFE |date=4 February 2018 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== On 9 August 2018, Sánchez signed a two-year deal with [[English Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>[https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/august/09-august/hammers-sign-colombian-international-carlos-sanchez]</ref>
==International career== Sánchez made his international debut against [[Panama national football team|Panama]] on 9 May 2007. He was then included in the 34-man provisional squad for the [[Copa América 2007]], but later dropped for the final list. He was in the first team for all of [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]]'s matches for [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification]] including the 2–1 victory over [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] on 20 November 2007 in [[Bogotá]]. At the [[2011 Copa América]], he started three of Colombia's four matches as they reached the quarter-finals, coming into the team at the expense of [[Gustavo Bolívar (footballer)|Gustavo Bolívar]] after the opening game. He played in all five of Colombia's matches in the FIFA World Cup finals in Brazil in 2014, playing a defensive role which allowed [[James Rodríguez]] and [[Juan Cuadrado]] to be attacking midfielders.<ref name=hart/>
Sánchez was included in Colombia's squad for the [[2015 Copa América]], where he was credited with "dominating" [[Neymar]] during his man of the match performance in the 1–0 group stage defeat of [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in [[Santiago]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/copa-america/83/blog/post/2496317/colombias-win-down-to-carlos-sanchez-dominating-neymar|title=Colombia's win down to Carlos Sanchez dominating Neymar|date=18 June 2015|work=ESPN}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aston-villa-player-watch-carlos-9478156|title=Aston Villa player watch: Carlos Sanchez dominates Neymar in man of match showing against Brazil|date=18 June 2015|work=Birmingham Mail}}</ref>
He was the first player sent off in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], for handball in the third minute against Japan, giving away a penalty from which [[Shinji Kagawa]] opened the scoring in a 2–1 win for the Japanese; only [[José Batista]] of [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] in [[1986 FIFA World Cup|1986]] was sent off quicker.<ref>{{cite news |title=10-man Colombia Beaten by Japan in Historic World Cup Win for Asia |url=https://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/10-man-Colombia-Beaten-by-Japan-in-Historic-Win-for-Asia-20180619-0010.html |accessdate=20 June 2018 |publisher=Telesur |date=19 June 2018}}</ref> Sánchez received death threats for his red card, which were likened by [[BBC Sport]] to the assassination of Colombia player [[Andrés Escobar]] for his own goal at the [[1994 FIFA World Cup]]. Manager [[José Pékerman]] dedicated the team's 3–0 win over [[Poland national football team|Poland]] to the suspended Sánchez.<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2018: Colombia dedicate win to Carlos Sanchez after death threats against midfielder |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44601358 |accessdate=25 June 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 June 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Sánchez is married to Noelia Polvoria, whom he met in Montevideo.<ref name=hart/>

1998–2000 |youthclubs1 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | youthyears2 = 2000–2004 |youthclubs2 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | years1 = 2004– |clubs1 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |caps1 = 401 |goals1 = 48<!--STATS ACCOUNT FOR LEAGUE ONLY--> | years2 = 2006 |clubs2 = → [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] (loan) |caps2 = 5 |goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2006 |clubs3 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) |caps3 = 13 |goals3 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2002 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]]|nationalcaps1 = 7 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2003–2004|nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]]|nationalcaps2 = 12|nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2004 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]]|nationalcaps3 = 1 |nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2005 |nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]]|nationalcaps4 = 7 |nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2007–2009|nationalteam5 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]|nationalcaps5 = 20|nationalgoals5 = 3 | club-update = 17:25, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 29 June 2009 (UTC) }} '''Mark James Noble''' (born 8 May 1987) is an English [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[central midfielder]] and is captain of [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. He has played almost all his youth and first team football for West Ham apart from two short loan spells, at [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]. He has played for [[England national football team|England]] at [[England national under-16 football team|U16]], [[England national under-17 football team|U17]], [[England national under-18 football team|U18]], [[England national under-19 football team|U19]] and [[England national under-21 football team|U21]] levels. He captained the U21 side, scoring three goals in 20 appearances. Noble is the longest serving player in West Ham's current squad, having been in the first team since 2004. He is West Ham's first-choice taker for penalty kicks and has won the club's Hammer of the Year trophy twice.
In 2014, he was ranked in the top five penalty takers in the top European leagues and was in the top 10 in the world based on the percentage of penalties successfully converted since 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/england-should-pray-penalties-world-3209514 |title=Why England should PRAY for penalties at the World Cup — and why we should take Mark Noble — Mirror Online |author=Richard Beech |work=mirror |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> Noble has played more [[Premier League]] games for West Ham than any other player.
==Club career==
===Early career=== Born in [[Canning Town]], East London, Noble played for Barking Colts and moved to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s academy at age 11. His father, however, who would drive him to training, could not always arrange the time to get Noble to training sessions due to the distance from their home in [[Beckton]]. Local side [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] showed an interest and Noble signed as a youth player.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/west-ham-hero-noble-why-i-left-arsenal-3998604#.Uw45a8LxuM8 |title=West Ham hero Noble: Why I left Arsenal |publisher=Tribal Football |date=26 December 2013 |accessdate=27 February 2014}}</ref> He became the youngest player ever to appear in their reserve team, aged 15.<ref name=whufc>{{cite web |title=Mark Noble Profile |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/mark-noble-west-ham_2228487_29719 |publisher=www.whufc.com |accessdate=11 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120817113941/http://www.whufc.com/articles/mark-noble-west-ham_2228487_29719 |archivedate=17 August 2012}}</ref> He became a trainee in July 2003<ref name="sbase2">{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players_details.sd?playerid=37804 |title=Soccerbase: Mark Noble |publisher= |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> and made his debut in the senior team at the age of just 17 in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] in August 2004 in a 2–0 win against [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]].<ref name="sbase2"/> He made his league debut in the [[Football League Championship|Championship]] in January 2005, in a 4–2 defeat away at [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref name="sbase2"/> On 30 May 2005, Noble played in the [[2005 Football League Championship play-off Final]] which saw West Ham beat [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] 1–0 to secure a return to the [[Premier League]]. He had entered the game as an 82nd-minute substitute for [[Shaun Newton]].<ref name="2005pof">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_div_1/4573799.stm |title=West Ham 1–0 Preston |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=27 February 2014}}</ref>{{cquote|We think very highly of Mark. If he keeps on working hard and continues to develop as he has, there is no reason why he can't become a top player for this club.<ref name=Pathe>{{cite web |title=BRAVO WEST HAM (aka WEST HAM BEAT MUNICH AND WIN EUROPEAN CUP) video newsreel film |url=http://backup.britishpathe.com/record.php?id=40881 |publisher=Britishpathe.com |accessdate=9 February 2012}}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> |||[[Alan Pardew]], 2005}} [[File:2005 Championship play-off bus.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Open top bus for winners of [[2005 Football League Championship play-off Final]]. Noble with trophy and flag]] Noble won the Young Hammer of the Year<ref>{{cite news |title=Mark's Big Finish |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/marks-big-finish-20050505_2236884_1138332 |publisher=whufc.com |date=5 May 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120921085607/http://www.whufc.com/articles/marks-big-finish-20050505_2236884_1138332 |archivedate=21 September 2012}}</ref> and the runner-up to the [[West Ham United F.C.#Hammer Of The Year|Hammer of the Year]] awards despite making his debut only four months previously.<ref name=whufc />
Upon West Ham's return to the Premier League, he featured in only five League games in the [[2005–06 West Ham United F.C. season|2005–06 season]], including those against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 20 November 2005 and against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 27 November, but after a game against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on 10 December, he found regular playing time harder to come by and was sent out on loan. He did not play for West Ham at all in 2006.<ref name="sbase2"/><ref name="whustats">{{cite web |url=http://www.westhamstats.info/westham.php?west=2&ham=802&united=Mark_Noble |title=Welcome to the Wonderful World of West Ham United Statistics — Mark Noble |publisher=www.westhamstats.info |accessdate=27 February 2014}}</ref>
====Loan periods==== Noble was subsequently loaned to [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]]<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/h/hull_city/4674790.stm |title=Noble joins Hull for three months |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 February 2006 |accessdate=27 February 2014}}</ref> where he made five appearances.<ref name=sbase2 /> His Hull debut came on 18 February 2006 in a 1–0 away defeat by [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_div_1/4703636.stm |title=Cardiff 1–0 Hull |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 February 2006 |accessdate=27 February 2014}}</ref> Noble's loan ended early after he suffered an injury to his lower back.<ref name=indie>[http://sport.independent.co.uk/football/comment/article2491790.ece ''"Mark Noble: Claret and blue, through and through"''] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930171242/http://sport.independent.co.uk/football/comment/article2491790.ece |date=30 September 2007 }}, ''The Independent on Sunday'', 17 June 2007. Retrieved 17 June 2007.</ref>
Noble signed a three-month loan with [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] in August 2006<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/i/ipswich_town/4786277.stm |title=''"Noble and Walton sign for Ipswich"'' |publisher= |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> in the hope of gaining necessary first-team experience. He played 13 games in the Championship and scored his first professional goal on 12 September in a 2–1 home win over [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/5330028.stm |title=Ipswich 2–1 Coventry |publisher=BBC |date=12 September 2006 |accessdate=4 February 2010}}</ref>
===Return to West Ham=== Noble scored his first goal for West Ham against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]], the side's first of three in a 3–0 home win in January 2007 in the third round of the [[FA Cup]], from an assist by [[Carlos Tevez]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/fa_cup/6214031.stm |title=West Ham 3–0 Brighton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 January 2007 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |author=Lyon, Sam}}</ref> On 4 March, he scored his first Premiership goal and the opening goal of the game, against Tottenham at [[Boleyn Ground|Upton Park]] in a game West Ham eventually lost 4–3 in the final seconds.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/6392467.stm |title=West Ham 3–4 Tottenham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 March 2007 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |author=Fletcher, Paul}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=West Ham United v Tottenham Hotspur, 04 March 2007 |url=http://www.11v11.com/matches/west-ham-united-v-tottenham-hotspur-04-march-2007-277158/ |publisher=www.11v11.com |accessdate=22 January 2013}}</ref> He played 11 games in all competitions, scoring three goals in the [[2006–07 West Ham United F.C. season|2006–07 season]].<ref name=whustats/>
====2007–08 season==== Noble established his place in [[Alan Curbishley]]'s side during the [[2007–08 West Ham United F.C. season|2007–08 season]], starting nearly all games when fit. He scored his first penalty for the club on 18 August 2007 in a 1–0 away win against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] after [[Colin Doyle (footballer)|Colin Doyle]] had fouled [[Craig Bellamy]].<ref name=whustats/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/6941856.stm |title=Birmingham 0–1 West Ham United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2007 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |author=Sanghera, Mandeep}}</ref> He was out for several weeks in November 2007 after he had played through an injury for the last several months without letting the medical staff know.<ref>{{cite news |title="Naive" Noble out for two weeks |url=http://www.guardian-series.co.uk/archive/2007/11/09/West+Ham+%28westham%29/1822042._Naive__Noble_out_for_two_weeks/ |publisher=[[Waltham Forest Guardian]] |date=9 November 2007}}</ref> In January 2008, Noble scored the only goal in a 1–0 victory over Liverpool from the penalty spot, after Liverpool defender [[Jamie Carragher]] had brought down [[Freddie Ljungberg]] in the last few seconds of second-half added time. His performance in the match was described as "exceptional".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/7210594.stm |title=West Ham United 1–0 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 January 2008 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |author=Chowdhury, Saj}}</ref>
====2008–09 season==== The [[2008–09 West Ham United F.C. season|2008–09 season]] did not start well for Noble, as he was sent off for two bookable offences in a 3–0 loss away at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], the first away game of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Report: Manchester City vs West Ham United |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=246349&cc=5901&league=ENG.1 |publisher=[[ESPN|espn.com]] |date=24 August 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110604124920/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=246349 |archivedate=4 June 2011}}</ref> After serving his suspension he came back to score an equaliser against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] after West Ham went a goal down with West Brom coming back to win 3–2. This was one of five goals he scored in the season with three coming from the penalty spot.<ref name=whustats/> After Alan Curbishley left in September, he remained in the first team under new manager [[Gianfranco Zola]]. He celebrated his 100th appearance for the Hammers by scoring against Blackburn at [[Ewood Park]] on 21 March 2009 to secure a 1–1 draw.<ref>[http://www.whufc.com/page/News/0,,12562~1598273,00.html Ton-up Noble earns draw] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090322232131/http://www.whufc.com/page/News/0%2C%2C12562~1598273%2C00.html |date=22 March 2009 }} www.whufc.com</ref> In April, he signed a contract extension tying him to the club until 2013.<ref>{{cite news |title=Duo hammer out new deals |url=http://www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~1616190,00.html |publisher=PremierLeague.com |date=7 April 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090411060622/http://www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0%2C%2C12306~1616190%2C00.html |archivedate=11 April 2009 |df=}}</ref>
====2009–10 season==== Noble began the [[2009–10 West Ham United F.C. season|2009–10 season]] well, scoring West Ham's first goal of the new season, in a 2–0 win over Premier League newcomers Wolves.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/aug/15/premier-league-wolves-west-ham-united |title=Premier League: Wolves 0–2 West Ham United |author=Mikey Stafford |work=the Guardian |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> Under Gianfranco Zola, Noble established himself in central midfield in a diamond that included [[Scott Parker (footballer)|Scott Parker]] as his partner and [[Jack Collison]] and [[Valon Behrami]] on the wings.<ref>[http://www.ilfordrecorder.co.uk/content/west_ham_united_football_club/story.aspx?brand=REConline&category=hammers&tBrand=RECONLINE&tCategory=HAMMERSNEW&itemid=WeED28%20Oct%202009%2016%3A31%3A15%3A183 Jack's a part of the precious diamond]{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He would only score one other goal during the season – a penalty after [[Habib Beye]] had fouled [[Zavon Hines]] – in a 2–1 home win against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 4 November 2009.<ref name=whustats/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/8334228.stm |title=West Ham 2–1 Aston Villa |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 November 2009 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |author=Roopanarine, Les}}</ref>
====2010–11 season==== With West Ham now managed by [[Avram Grant]], Noble continued to be a regular member of the first team. He played 26 of a possible 38 games in the Premier League missing a month of the season after an [[appendectomy]] as West Ham were relegated after finishing in 20th and bottom place.<ref name=whustats/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1A1-c832675194b64f0c8329bba43a451023.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924043658/http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1A1-c832675194b64f0c8329bba43a451023.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 September 2015 |title=West Ham midfielder Noble out after appendectomy |agency=Associated Press |date=2 November 2010 |accessdate=28 February 2014}}</ref> He scored four league goals, all were penalties including two in one game. On 2 April 2011 against Manchester United his two penalties had put West Ham 2–0 up only for [[Wayne Rooney]] to score a hat-trick which, with another goal by [[Javier Hernández]], won the game 4–2 for Manchester United.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9439820.stm |title=West Ham 2–4 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 April 2011 |accessdate=28 February 2014 |author=Sanghera, Mandeep}}</ref>
====2011–12 season==== [[File:NolanTomkinsNoble - Wembley 2012.jpg|thumb|230px|right|Noble (front) after the [[2012 Football League Championship play-off Final]]]]
During the [[2011–12 West Ham United F.C. season|2011–12 season]] with West Ham now back in the Championship, Noble scored eight goals, seven of which were penalties,<ref name=whustats/> his only goal from open play coming in a 4–0 away win against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20120406/barnsley-0-4-west-ham-united-ft_2236884_2725820 |title=Barnsley 0–4 West Ham United |publisher=www.whufc.com |accessdate=27 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160115192624/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20120406/barnsley-0-4-west-ham-united-ft_2236884_2725820 |archivedate=15 January 2016 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Having twice previously been runner-up, Noble was named [[West Ham United F.C.#Hammer of the Year|Hammer of the Year]] for the [[2011–12 West Ham United F.C. season|2011–12 season]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Noble voted Hammer of the Year |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20120430/noble-voted-hammer-of-the-year_2236884_2754663 |publisher=whufc.com |accessdate=1 May 2012 |date=30 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120502025659/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20120430/noble-voted-hammer-of-the-year_2236884_2754663 |archivedate=2 May 2012 |df=}}</ref> In May 2012 Noble played in the [[2012 Football League Championship play-off Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]] against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] which West Ham won 2–1 to return to the Premier League after a one-year absence.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/18044378 |title=Blackpool 1–2 West Ham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 May 2012 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |author=Fletcher, Paul}}</ref> By the end of the season, he had played 49 games in all competitions, missing just one of their Championship games.<ref name=whustats/>
====2012–13 season==== [[File:Mark Noble free kick.jpg|thumb|left|210px|Mark Noble takes a free kick during the 2012–13 season]]
In September 2012, Noble signed a new three-year contract with an option for a further two years.<ref>{{cite news |title=MARK NOBLE SIGNS NEW WEST HAM DEAL |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/football/view/273837/Mark-Noble-signs-new-West-Ham-deal/ |accessdate=25 September 2012 |newspaper=www.dailstar.co.uk |date=25 September 2012}}</ref> In February 2013, he was out injured after having been diagnosed with a compression of the [[thoracic outlet]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20131118/hammers-publish-important-research_2236884_3536759 |title=Hammers publish important research |publisher=www.whufc.com |date=18 November 2013 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131208001248/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20131118/hammers-publish-important-research_2236884_3536759 |archivedate=8 December 2013 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He did not return until 17 April 2013 in a 2–2 home draw against Manchester United.<ref name=whustats/> The missing games saw Noble's tally for the season at 31 games in all competitions with four goals scored. Three goals were penalties with his one-goal from open play coming in a 4–1 home win against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 20 October 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/19939627 |title=West Ham 4–1 Southampton |date=20 October 2012 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |author=Hassan, Nabil}}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== Noble scored three goals in the [[2013–14 West Ham United F.C. season|2013–14 season]], the only one from open play being the second goal in a 2–0 away win over Cardiff City in January, despite the team being down to ten men after a [[James Tomkins (footballer)|James Tomkins]] sending off.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20140111/cardiff-city-0-west-ham-2_2234233_70940 |title=11 January 2014, Cardiff City 0 – 2 West Ham — Match Report — Match — West Ham United |publisher= |accessdate=12 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140912135218/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20140111/cardiff-city-0-west-ham-2_2234233_70940 |archivedate=12 September 2014 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 6 May 2014, Noble received his second [[West Ham United F.C.#Hammer of the Year|Hammer of the Year]], beating runner up [[Adrián (footballer)|Adrián]] and third-placed James Tomkins. On the same awards night, Noble also won the Players' Player of the Year accolade.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20140506/201314-player-awards-live_2236884_3809162|archive-url=https://archive.today/20140506221620/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20140506/201314-player-awards-live_2236884_3809162|dead-url=yes|archive-date=6 May 2014 |title=2013/14 Player Awards, |date=5 May 2014}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== Noble missed a penalty in a 0–1 home defeat by Tottenham on 16 August 2014, the opening game of the [[2014–15 Premier League|season]], but scored his first goal of the season in the next home game, on 30 August, a 1–3 home defeat by Southampton.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28906779 |title=West Ham 1–3 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=13 April 2015}}</ref> On 29 November 2014, Noble became West Ham's record appearance maker in the Premier League with his appearance against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] being his 205th Premier League game, overtaking [[Steve Potts (footballer)|Steve Potts]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://eplindex.com/61936/noble-sets-premier-league-record-west-ham.html |title=Noble sets Premier League Record for West Ham |publisher=EPL Index.com |date=30 November 2014 |accessdate=30 November 2014 |author=Burke, Liam}}</ref> Noble signed a contract extension which would keep him at West Ham until 2020, with an option for a further year, on 26 February 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31637830 |title=Mark Noble signs West Ham contract extension to 2020 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 February 2015}}</ref>
====2015–16 season and testimonial==== Noble's first goal of the season came from the penalty spot in a 3–4 home defeat by Premier League newcomers, [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] on 22 August 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33944756 |title=West Ham 3–4 Bournemouth |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 December 2015}}</ref> The following week, he scored the second goal in a 3–0 away win against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]; this was West Ham's first win at [[Anfield]] since 1963.<ref name="away at anfield">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34025305 |title=Liverpool 0–3 West Ham United |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 December 2015}}</ref> Noble made his 350th senior appearance for West Ham on 6 February 2016, in a 1–0 defeat away at Southampton.<ref name="350a">{{cite news |url=http://www.newhamrecorder.co.uk/sport/football/west-ham/west_ham_skipper_fumes_at_missed_opportunity_at_southampton_1_4409851 |title=West Ham skipper fumes at missed opportunity at Southampton |work=Newham Recorder |date=8 February 2016 |accessdate=1 March 2016}}</ref> The following week, he scored his third goal of the season, netting West Ham's equalizer in the 77th minute of their 2–2 draw away at [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]]. On 22 December 2015, it had been announced that Noble was to be granted a [[Testimonial match|testimonial]] by West Ham following his long service to the club. The game was played on 28 March 2016 between a West Ham XI and a West Ham United all-stars team made up of former players, with all proceeds going to charity.<ref name="SkyTestimonial">{{citenews|title=West Ham captain Mark Noble scores in testimonial match|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11685/10221130/west-ham-captain-mark-noble-scores-in-testimonial-match|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=29 March 2016|first=Nick|last=Lustig}}</ref><ref>{{citenews|title=West Ham’s Mark Noble: I didn’t want a testimonial and Upton Park to be half-empty|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/mar/27/west-ham-united-mark-noble-testimonial-upton-park|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=27 March 2016|first=Jacob|last=Steinberg}}</ref> The game was won 6–5 by the West Ham XI in front of 36,000 spectators and featured a goal by [[Paolo Di Canio]] and two by [[Dean Ashton]], including a [[bicycle kick]] described as "stunning".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/March/28-March/Noble-It-couldn-t-have-gone-any-better |title=Noble — It couldn't have gone any better — West Ham United |publisher= |accessdate=29 March 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160331051333/http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/March/28-March/Noble-It-couldn-t-have-gone-any-better |archivedate=31 March 2016 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
On 10 May 2016, Noble became the final man to lead a West Ham United team out at [[Boleyn Ground|Upton Park]], as the Hammers went on to win their final game at their former home 3–2 against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/10277257/mark-noble-says-west-ham-win-at-boleyn-farewell-was-written-in-the-stars |title=Mark Noble says West Ham win at Boleyn farewell was 'written in the stars' |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=11 May 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== In March 2017 sections of [[West Ham United F.C. supporters|West Ham supporters]] called for him to be dropped from the team. Noble described the season as "the most difficult of his career".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11685/10801334/west-ham-captain-mark-noble-hits-back-at-critics-calling-for-him-to-be-dropped |title=West Ham captain Mark Noble hits back at critics calling for him to be dropped |publisher= |accessdate=18 May 2017}}</ref> On 8 April 2017, having played against [[Swansea City F.C.|Swansea City]], Noble marked his 400th appearance for West Ham becoming the 19th player to pass this number.<ref>{{citenews|title=Stat's A Fact - Noble: The 400 Club|url=http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/april/09-april/stats-fact-noble-400-club|publisher=[[West Ham United F.C.|whufc.com]]|date=9 April 2017}}</ref> He played 35 games in all competitions for West Ham in the [[2016–17 in English football|2016–17 season]] scoring five goals, two in the [[Europa League]] and three in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.westhamstats.info/westham.php?west=2&ham=802&united=Mark_Noble |title=Mark Noble |website=www.westhamstats.info |accessdate=18 May 2017}}</ref> His season finished early with two games remaining for West Ham as he required an abdominal operation.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11685/10873551/mark-noble-to-miss-last-two-west-ham-fixtures-as-he-requires-abdominal-surgery |title=Mark Noble to miss last two West Ham fixtures as he requires abdominal surgery |publisher= |accessdate=18 May 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Noble marked his 300th Premier League appearance with a goal from the penalty spot against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 16 December 2017.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Stoke 0–3 West Ham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 December 2017 |accessdate=16 December 2017 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42290587}}</ref> In March 2018, there were protests against [[David Sullivan (businessman)|David Sullivan]] and the West Ham United board at the [[London Stadium]] during a 3-0 home defeat to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]]. There were four pitch invasions with one fan approaching Noble on the pitch.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43358711 |title=Fans approach players during West Ham's defeat by Burnley at London Stadium |date=10 March 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 March 2018}}</ref> In scenes described as "horrific", Noble grappled with the supporter, throwing him to the ground.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/west-ham-shame-as-fans-invadepitch-czpvmmgxn |title=West Ham shame as fans invade pitch |first=Paul |last=Rowan |date=11 March 2018 |accessdate=18 March 2018 |newspaper=The Times}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.joe.co.uk/sport/mark-noble-throws-west-ham-supporter-to-the-ground-during-pitch-invasion-167264 |title=Mark Noble throws West Ham supporter to the ground during pitch invasion - JOE.co.uk |publisher= |accessdate=18 March 2018}}</ref> On 5 May 2018, he scored the second goal in a 2–0 away win at [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], a result which ensured West Ham's survival in the Premier League. Noble described the goal, a [[Volley (football)|volley]] from the edge of the [[penalty area]], as "the best of his career".<ref>[https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/west-ham-captain-mark-noble-hails-leicester-goal-as-the-best-of-his-career-a3832141.html]</ref>
==International career== Noble captained the [[England national under-18 football team|England U18 team]].<ref name=whufc /> He was a member of the [[England national under-19 football team|England U19 team]] that beat [[Serbia national under-19 football team|Serbia and Montenegro U19s]] 3–1 in the [[2005 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2005 European Championship]] [[2005 UEFA European Under-19 Championship#Semi-finals|semi-finals]], although they subsequently lost the [[2005 UEFA European Under-19 Championship#Final|final]] to [[France national under-19 football team|France]].<ref name=times>{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/article1942679.ece |title=''"Noble cause"'' |publisher= |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref>
Noble made his debut for the [[England national under-21 football team|England U-21]] team on 11 June 2007, coming on as substitute in the 82nd minute for [[Tom Huddlestone]] in England's 0–0 draw with the [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic]] during the [[2007 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]], held in the Netherlands.<ref>[https://archive.today/20071029052657/http://www.thefa.com/Euro2007/EnglandNews/Postings/2007/06/EngU21s_vCzechRepublic.htm ''"England held in Arnhem"''], TheFA.com match report, 11 June 2007. Retrieved 11 June 2007.</ref> He established himself in the starting XI for the remaining matches<ref>{{cite news |title=Graft not craft the art for Noble |url=http://www.uefa.com/competitions/under21/news/kind=1/newsid=838501.html |publisher=[[UEFA|uefa.com]] |date=16 June 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090619101757/http://www.uefa.com/competitions/under21/news/kind%3D1/newsid%3D838501.html |archivedate=19 June 2009 |df=}}</ref> and scored twice in a dramatic semi-final penalty shootout against the [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands]] where England lost 13–12.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/6766603.stm |title=BBC SPORT — Football — Internationals — Holland U21 1–1 Eng U21 (aet) |publisher= |accessdate=24 March 2016}}</ref> On 11 September 2007, Noble scored his first international goal for the under-21 team against [[Bulgaria national under-21 football team|Bulgaria]] in a 2–0 victory,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/6988587.stm |title=''Bulgaria U21 0–2 England U21 '' |publisher= |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> followed by two more against the [[Republic of Ireland national under-21 football team|Republic of Ireland]] on 16 October.<ref>[http://www.sportinglife.com/football/news/story_get.cgi?STORY_NAME=soccer/07/10/16/manual_215010.html&TEAMHD=soccer ''Republic of Ireland U21 0–3 England U21 '']{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, sportinglife.com, 16 October 2007. Retrieved 16 October 2007. {{cbignore|bot=medic}}{{dead link|date=March 2016}}</ref>
Noble captained the U21s at the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2009 European Championships]] as regular captain [[Steven Taylor (footballer)|Steven Taylor]] had to withdraw due to injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pearce considers Noble for captain's role |url=http://www.guardian-series.co.uk/football/4428475.Pearce_considers_Noble_for_captain_s_role/ |publisher=[[Waltham Forest Guardian]] |date=9 June 2009}}</ref> The Young Lions ended the tournament as runners-up, losing 4–0 to [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]], with Noble playing his last match for the U21s.
Noble is also eligible to play for the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] national side through his [[County Cork|Cork]]-born grandparents.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lep.co.uk/twitter/Lonergan-could-play-for-Republic.5346266.jp |title=Lonergan could play for Republic |work=lep.co.uk |accessdate=9 June 2009}}</ref> In August 2014, despite stating on numerous occasions about his ambition of playing for [[England national football team|England]] at senior level,<ref>{{cite news |title=Mark Noble: I will never give up on my England dream |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/mark-noble-i-will-never-give-up-on-my-england-dream-9668659.html |work=Evening Standard |date=14 August 2014}}</ref> it was reported by the ''Irish Independent'' that he could be willing to make himself available for the Irish national team.<ref>{{cite news |title=West Ham's Mark Noble ready to declare for Ireland — reports |url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/international-soccer/west-hams-mark-noble-ready-to-declare-for-ireland-reports-30546515.html |work=Irish Independent |date=29 August 2014}}</ref>
==Personal life== In May 2016, Noble was granted freedom of the [[Borough of Newham]] for his services to the borough.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.newhamrecorder.co.uk/news/freedom_of_the_borough_honours_presented_to_remarkable_people_1_4543650 |title=Freedom of the Borough honours presented to ‘remarkable people’ |author=Kat Hopps |work=Newham Recorder |accessdate=21 May 2016}}</ref>
Noble has been married to childhood sweetheart Carly since 2012.<ref>{{citenews|title=Noble loving it all|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2012/july/06-july/noble-loving-it-all|publisher=[[West Ham United F.C.|whufc.com]]|date=6 July 2012}}</ref> The couple have a son and a daughter.<ref name="SkyTestimonial"/>

Guadalajara|Guadalajara]] | years1 = 2006–2010 | clubs1 = [[C.D. Guadalajara|Guadalajara]] | caps1 = 64 | goals1 = 26 | years2 = 2010–2015 | clubs2 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | caps2 = 103 | goals2 = 37 | years3 = 2014–2015 | clubs3 = → [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]] (loan) | caps3 = 23 | goals3 = 7 | years4 = 2015–2017 | clubs4 = [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] | caps4 = 54 | goals4 = 28 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps5 = 51 | goals5 = 15 | nationalyears1 = 2007 | nationalteam1 = [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2009– | nationalteam2 = [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] | nationalcaps2 = 105 | nationalgoals2 = 50 | club-update = 17:16, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 16:01, 2 July 2018 (UTC) | medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry|{{fb|MEX}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[CONCACAF Gold Cup]]}} {{medalW|[[2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup|2011 United States]]|}} }} '''Javier Hernández Balcázar''' ({{IPA-es|xaˈβjeɾ eɾˈnandez βalˈkasaɾ|-|JavierHernandezBalcazarPronunciation.ogg}};{{efn|In isolation, ''Hernández'' is pronounced {{IPA-es|eɾˈnandes|}}.}} born 1 June 1988) is a Mexican professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Striker (association football)|striker]] for {{English football updater|WestHamU}} club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[Mexico national football team|Mexico national team]]. Hernández is commonly known by his nickname, '''Chicharito''' ({{IPA-es|tʃitʃaˈɾito|}}; [[Mexican Spanish]]: ''little [[pea]]''), which he wears on his shirt.
Hernández began his career in 2006, playing for Mexican club [[C.D. Guadalajara|Guadalajara]]. In July 2010, he became the first Mexican player to join [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], scoring 20 goals and winning the Premier League in his [[2010–11 Premier League|debut season]]. After falling out of favour under managers [[David Moyes]] and [[Louis van Gaal]], he spent the 2014–15 season on loan at [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]. In August 2015, Hernández signed for [[Bundesliga]] club [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]]. After two seasons in Germany, Hernández returned to the Premier League and joined West Ham United. His minutes-per-goal ratio is among the most prolific in the history of the [[Premier League]].<ref name="goal ratio">{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/gallery/111326 |title=Best goal ratios of Premier League players |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=28 September 2016}}</ref>
A Mexican international, Hernández is the country's [[Mexico national football team#Top goalscorers|all-time leading goalscorer]]. He made his debut for the national team in September 2009 in a friendly match against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]]. He has represented Mexico at the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], the [[2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup]], the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]], the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], the [[Copa América Centenario]], the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]. He was the 2011 Gold Cup's top scorer with seven goals and was named the most valuable player of the tournament.
==Early life== Hernández was born in [[Guadalajara]], Jalisco and first played in a recreation league when he was seven years old. Hernández lived in [[Morelia]], [[Michoacán]] for over four years while his father, footballer [[Javier Hernández (footballer, born 1961)|Javier "''Chícharo''" Hernández]], played for [[Monarcas Morelia]].<ref name="Morelia">{{cite web |url=http://www.zocalo.com.mx/seccion/articulo/la-zanahoria-de-el-chicharito |title=La Zanahoria de el Chicharito |website=''Zocalo.com.mx'' |publisher=Zócalo |language=Spanish |date=15 January 2012 |accessdate=12 November 2015}}</ref> While living in Morelia, Hernández attended elementary school at the ''Instituto Piaget'' where he studied from third to sixth grade and played for the school's football team.<ref name="Morelia"/>
At the age of nine, Hernández joined [[C.D. Guadalajara]] and signed his first professional contract when he was 15.<ref name=nyt>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/04/02/sports/soccer/02soccer.html |title=For World Cup, Javier Hernández Could Be Mexico's Next Big Thing |first=Billy |last=Witz |date=1 April 2010 |newspaper=The New York Times |accessdate=30 June 2010}}</ref> He was set to play in the [[2005 FIFA U-17 World Championship]], but an injury sidelined him from the team that ultimately won the championship.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/146419/javier-hernandez?cc=5739 |title=Javier Hernández |website=ESPN Soccernet |accessdate=1 July 2010}}</ref> Whilst playing football professionally, Hernández was also taking business administration classes at [[Universidad del Valle de Atemajac]].<ref name="nyt" /> Hernández has held both [[Hugo Sánchez]] and [[Rafael Márquez]] as his football idols growing up.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.elsiglodetorreon.com.mx/noticia/722206.chicharito-elogia-a-johan-cruyff-y-rafael-marquez.html |title='Chicharito' elogia a Johan Cruyff y Rafael Márquez |publisher=El Sigoro De Torreón |date=25 March 2012 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.latintimes.com/copa-america-centenario-17-things-know-about-mexicos-javier-chicharito-hernandez-387992 |title=Centenario: 17 Things To Know About Mexico's Javier 'Chicharito' Hernández |publisher=Latintimes |date=2 June 2016}}</ref>
==Club career== ===C.D. Guadalajara=== Hernández began playing with Chivas' lower division team, [[Club Deportivo Guadalajara Reserves|Chivas Coras]] in [[Tepic, Nayarit]] in the 2005–06 season. He made his debut for Chivas in the 2006 Apertura in a win over [[Club Necaxa|Necaxa]] at [[Estadio Jalisco]]. With the score at 3–0, Hernández came on as a substitute for [[Omar Bravo]] in the 82nd minute, before scoring the fourth goal of the game five minutes later. It was his only goal in seven appearances in 2006–07. He made a further six appearances in 2007–08 without scoring.<ref>{{cite book |last=Worrall |first=Frank |title=Chicharito – The Biography of Javier Hernandez |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tWIW21vQzesC&pg=PT11 |year=2012 |publisher=John Blake Publishing |isbn=978-1-78219-079-0 |page=11}}</ref>
Hernández made ten appearances in the [[Primera División de México Apertura 2008|2008 Apertura]] without scoring, but he scored four goals in fifteen appearances in the [[Primera División de México Clausura 2009|2009 Clausura]]. In the [[2009–10 Primera División de México season|2009 Apertura]], Hernández finished as the joint-third top scorer, with eleven goals in seventeen appearances.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.femexfut.org.mx/portalv2/default.aspx?s=786&ep=869 |title=Tabla de Goleo Individual |publisher=Femexfut |accessdate=30 June 2010}}</ref> He started the [[2009–10 Primera División de México season|2010 Torneo Bicentenario]] with eight goals in five games.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1174550.html?cid=rssfeed&att= |title=History awaits flawless Chivas |date=26 February 2010 |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=30 June 2010}}</ref> He finished as a joint-leader in the goalscoring chart for the [[2009–10 Primera División de México season|2010 Torneo Bicentenario]], with ten goals in eleven games and after spent 5 matches without playing because of an injury he suffered.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.femexfut.org.mx/portalv2/secciones.aspx?s=1368&ep=908&dd=1 |title=Estadística – Primera División Profesional – Temporada 2009–2010 Torneo Bicentenario |publisher=Femexfut |accessdate=30 June 2010}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== ====Transfer==== [[File:Chicharito.ogv|thumb|Hernández on his Manchester United debut]] [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] were first made aware of Hernández in October 2009; a scout went to Mexico that December and reported positively after watching a few games. Because of Hernández's age, the club originally planned to wait before making a move to sign him, but his potential involvement with the national team at the World Cup rushed the club into making a bid. United's chief scout, Jim Lawlor, was sent to Mexico for three weeks in February and March to watch Hernández and filed another positive report on him, before the club solicitor went over to Mexico to finalise the paperwork.<ref>{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Coppack |title=Boss: We had to move fast |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Apr/Boss-We-had-to-move-fast.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=9 April 2010 |accessdate=1 July 2010}}</ref>
On 8 April 2010, Hernández agreed a deal to sign for Manchester United for an undisclosed fee, subject to a work permit application.<ref>{{cite news |author=Communications Dept. |title=Reds agree Hernandez deal |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Apr/Reds-agree-Hernandez-deal.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=8 April 2010 |accessdate=8 April 2010}}</ref> The previous day, Hernández had been present at Manchester United's [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] quarter-final win over [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Chicharito's 'dream' move |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Apr/Chicharitos-dream-move.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=8 April 2010 |accessdate=13 April 2010}}</ref> The deal was conducted in complete secrecy; Hernández's agent was kept in the dark, as was his grandfather [[Tomás Balcázar]], who thought Hernández was going on a trip to [[Atlanta]] in the United States.<ref>{{cite news |first=Duncan |last=White |title=Javier Hernandez, aka El Chicharito, living the Manchester United dream |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/7578217/Javier-Hernandez-aka-El-Chicharito-living-the-Manchester-United-dream.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=11 April 2010 |accessdate=30 June 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first1=Tom |last1=Marshall |first2=Steve |last2=Bartram |title=United's covert operation |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Jun/Uniteds-covert-operation.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=9 June 2010 |accessdate=30 June 2010}}</ref> As part of the deal, United played a friendly against Chivas to open the Mexican club's [[Estadio Chivas|new stadium]] on 30 July.<ref>{{cite news |first=Tom |last=Marshall |title=Manchester United to play Chivas at new stadium |url=http://guadalajarareporter.com/sports-mainmenu-89/26618-manchester-united-set-guadalajara-date.html |website=Guadalajara Reporter |date=8 April 2010 |accessdate=8 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711132837/http://guadalajarareporter.com/sports-mainmenu-89/26618-manchester-united-set-guadalajara-date.html |archivedate=11 July 2011}}</ref> On 27 May, the work permit was granted, allowing the transfer to be made official on 1 July.<ref name="mu">{{cite news |first=James |last=Tuck |title=Chicharito granted work permit |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/May/Chicharito-granted-permit.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=27 May 2010 |accessdate=27 May 2010}}</ref>
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Javier "Chicharito" Hernandez vs MLS All Stars.jpg|thumb|upright|Hernández playing for Manchester United against the MLS All-Stars at the [[NRG Stadium]], Houston in July 2010]] Hernández made his United debut on 28 July, coming on as a 63rd-minute substitute for [[Nani]] in the [[2010 MLS All-Star Game]] at the [[NRG Stadium]], Houston; he scored his first goal for the club 18 minutes later, lobbing the ball over [[Nick Rimando]] from just outside the area after a long through-ball from [[Darren Fletcher]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=MLS All-Stars 2 United 5 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2010/Jul/MLS-AllStars-2-United-5.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=28 July 2010 |accessdate=28 July 2010}}</ref> Two days later, Hernández scored against Manchester United while playing in a friendly for his old club, Chivas; he started the game in a Chivas jersey and scored after just eight minutes. He switched sides at half-time, but he was unable to prevent a 3–2 defeat for Manchester United.<ref>{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Chivas 3 United 2 |url=http://www.manutd.com/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2010/Jul/Chivas-3-United-2.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=30 July 2010 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110813221512/http://www.manutd.com/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2010/Jul/Chivas-3-United-2.aspx |archive-date=13 August 2011 |dead-url=yes}}</ref> He scored for the third pre-season game in a row as he netted in a 7–1 victory over a [[League of Ireland]] XI at the newly built [[Aviva Stadium]] on 4 August.<ref>{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Coppack |title=Ireland XI 1 United 7 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Aug/Airtricity-League-XI-1-United-7.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=4 August 2010 |accessdate=4 August 2010}}</ref>
Hernández made his competitive debut on 8 August and scored his first goal in the process, netting United's second of a 3–1 victory over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[2010 FA Community Shield]]. He came on at the start of the second half and got on the end of a pass from [[Antonio Valencia]] before the Mexican's shot deflected off his own face and into the net.<ref>{{cite news |first=Paul |last=Fletcher |title=Chelsea 1–3 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8893192.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2010 |accessdate=8 August 2010}}</ref> On 16 August, Hernández made his [[Premier League]] debut as he replaced [[Wayne Rooney]] in the 63rd minute of their 3–0 home victory over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |title=Man Utd 3–0 Newcastle |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8906329.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2010 |accessdate=16 August 2010}}</ref> He scored his first Champions League goal on 29 September, coming off the bench to score the only goal in an away win over [[Valencia CF|Valencia]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Johnson |last=Stevenson |title=Valencia 0–1 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/9037902.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 September 2010 |accessdate=29 September 2010}}</ref> He scored his first league goal for United in a 2–2 home draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 16 October.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera |title=Man Utd 2–2 West Brom |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9085639.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 October 2010 |accessdate=16 October 2010}}</ref> Eight days later he scored his first brace for the club, also his first away league goals, in a 2–1 away win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Stoke 1–2 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9107396.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 October 2010 |accessdate=24 October 2010}}</ref> Two days on from this display, he came off the bench to score a last-minute winner, his first ever [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] goal, in a 3–2 win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolves]] which sent them through to the quarter-finals where they were then knocked out by [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Stevenson |title=Man Utd 3–2 Wolves |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/9059505.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 October 2010 |accessdate=26 October 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Whyatt |title=West Ham 4–0 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/9233755.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 November 2010 |accessdate=30 November 2010}}</ref> On 1 January 2011, he came off the bench to head the winning goal in a 2–1 away win over West Bromwich Albion.<ref>{{cite news |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |title=West Brom 1–2 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9327941.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 January 2011 |accessdate=1 January 2011}}</ref> Hernández became the top scoring Mexican in Premier League history after opening the scoring in a 2–1 home victory over Stoke City on 4 January.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Stevenson |title=Man Utd 2–1 Stoke |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9334445.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 January 2011 |accessdate=4 January 2011}}</ref> [[File:Chicharito_2010.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Hernández playing against West Brom at [[Old Trafford]] during the [[2010–11 Manchester United F.C. season|2010–11 season]]]] On 25 January, Hernández scored the equalising goal of a 3–2 comeback away win over [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Blackpool 2–3 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9371173.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 January 2011 |accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> Four days later he scored his first [[FA Cup]] goal as he netted the winner in a 2–1 away victory over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Ian |last=Hughes |title=Southampton 1–2 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/9379065.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=28 January 2011}}</ref> Hernández netted twice in a 4–0 away win over Wigan on 26 February.<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Whyatt |title=Wigan 0–4 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9404501.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 February 2011 |accessdate=26 February 2011}}</ref> Eight days later, he netted a late consolation goal in a 3–1 [[Liverpool F.C. and Manchester United F.C. rivalry|derby]] defeat away to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Liverpool 1–3 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9410613.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 March 2011 |accessdate=6 March 2011}}</ref> Hernández netted twice in a 2–1 home win over [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] on 15 March, sending United through to the quarter-finals of the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Man Utd 2–1 Marseille |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/9424108.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 March 2011 |accessdate=15 March 2011}}</ref> On 2 April, he scored the final goal against West Ham United as they came from two goals down to claim a 4–2 away win.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera |title=West Ham 2–4 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9439820.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 April 2011 |accessdate=2 April 2011}}</ref> On 8 April, Hernández was revealed as a contender for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award alongside teammate [[Nani]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Gareth Bale & Samir Nasri lead PFA nominations |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13012491.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 April 2011 |accessdate=8 April 2011}}</ref> Four days later, he opened the scoring in the 2–1 quarter-final win over Chelsea in the Champions League, with the game ending 3–1 on aggregate, sending United through to the semi-finals.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Man Utd 2–1 Chelsea |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/9454028.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 April 2011 |accessdate=12 April 2011}}</ref> He continued his goal scoring form on 23 April scoring the winning goal with a header in the 1–0 home win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Stevenson |title=Man Utd 1–0 Everton |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9462505.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 April 2011 |accessdate=23 April 2011}}</ref>
On 8 May, Hernández scored the opening goal in a 2–1 home win over Chelsea after just 36 seconds to leave United one point away from winning the title.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Man Utd 2–1 Chelsea |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9475025.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 May 2011 |accessdate=8 May 2011}}</ref> The goal against Chelsea made him the first player since [[Ruud van Nistelrooy]] in the [[2001–02 Manchester United F.C. season|2001–02 season]] to score 20 goals for the club in his debut season.<ref>{{cite news |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |title=Manchester United on brink of record 19th title after win over Chelsea |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/may/09/sir-alex-ferguson-manchester-united-liverpool-titles |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=9 May 2011 |accessdate=9 May 2011}}</ref> Hernández capped his debut season with Manchester United by winning the [[Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year]] award on 18 May which was voted for by the fans.<ref>{{cite news |first=James |last=Tuck |title=Fans honour Hernández |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2011/May/Hernandez-wins-Player-of-the-Year-award.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=18 May 2011 |accessdate=18 May 2011}}</ref> On 28 May, Hernández played all 90 minutes in the 3–1 defeat to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in the [[2011 UEFA Champions League Final|Champions League Final]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/13576522.stm |title=Barcelona 3 Manchester United 1 |date=28 May 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=30 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110529112634/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/13576522.stm |archivedate=29 May 2011 |deadurl=no}}</ref> On 5 July 2011, the [[IFFHS|International Federation of Football History and Statistics]] named Hernández as the "World Goalgetter 2011", with 13 goals, ahead of other players such as [[Cristiano Ronaldo]], [[Giuseppe Rossi]], and [[Lionel Messi]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Javier is world's best |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2011/Jul/hernandez-worlds-best-scorer.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=6 July 2011 |accessdate=7 July 2011}}</ref>
====2011–12 season==== After participating in the [[2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup]] with Mexico, Hernández returned to Manchester United to begin pre-season training in New York ahead of the [[2011 MLS All-Star Game]]. On 26 July 2011, he was taken to the hospital after suffering a minor concussion after he was hit on the head with a ball during a training session; he was cleared the next day, but did not take part in the game.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United's Javier Hernández taken to hospital with concussion |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/jul/27/manchester-united-javier-hernandez-concussion |newspaper=The Guardian |date=27 July 2011 |accessdate=23 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Javier Hernandez hospitalized with concussion |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2011/soccer/07/27/Javier.Hernandez.concussion.ap/index.html |website=Sports Illustrated |date=28 July 2011 |accessdate=23 August 2011}}</ref>
On 28 July 2011, it was reported that Rafael Ortega, the doctor at Chivas, informed Manchester United that Hernández was suffering from a pre-existing [[neurological]] condition. Ortega also explained that Hernández had suffered from "acute [[migraines]] and "headaches" as a teenager.<ref>{{cite news |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |title=Javier Hernández's former club claim he has a neurological condition |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/jul/28/javier-hernandez-head-concussion |newspaper=The Guardian |date=28 July 2011 |accessdate=23 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Hernandez 'may have neurological issue' |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/938204/doctor-suggests-javier-hernandez-may-have-neurological-condition?cc=5739 |website=ESPN Soccernet |date=29 July 2011 |accessdate=23 August 2011}}</ref> He did not participate in any of United's pre-season matches, nor the [[2011 FA Community Shield]]. He also missed United's opening game of the season against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].{{citation needed|date=December 2018}}
Hernández made his first appearance in the [[2011–12 Manchester United F.C. season|2011–12 season]] on 22 August in a 3–0 win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], coming off the bench for [[Danny Welbeck]] in the 79th minute.<ref>{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Coppack |title=Man United 3 Tottenham 0 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2011/Aug/united-v-spurs-report.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=22 August 2011 |accessdate=23 August 2011}}</ref> He returned to the starting lineup on 10 September against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]], scoring twice in a 5–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news |first=Steve |last=Bartram |title=Bolton 0 Man United 5 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2011/Sep/bolton-v-united-report.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=10 September 2011 |accessdate=10 September 2011}}</ref> On 15 October 2011, Hernández came off the substitutes bench to net a crucial equaliser against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Anfield]] in a 1–1 draw. In the 81st minute Hernández gambled on Danny Welbeck's flick on from a corner to steal in and head the equaliser.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool 1–1 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15225853.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 October 2011 |accessdate=16 October 2011}}</ref>
Hernández signed a new five-year contract on 24 October to tie him to Manchester United until 2016.<ref>{{cite news |title=Javier Hernandez signs new five-year contract |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15432395.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=29 October 2011}}</ref> Hernández scored his fourth league goal of the season and the winner against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]], in a 1–0 victory on 29 October.<ref>{{cite news |title=Everton 0–1 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15413579.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 October 2011 |accessdate=29 October 2011}}</ref> He then scored his fifth league goal of the season and the winner in United's next away game at [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Swansea 0–1 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15705201.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 November 2011 |accessdate=19 November 2011}}</ref> Hernández scored again in the following game at home to [[Newcastle United]], when [[Wayne Rooney]]'s shot was blocked by a defender and ricocheted back off Hernández and into the net.<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Report: United 1 Newcastle 1 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2011/Nov/manchester-united-v-newcastle-match-report.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=26 November 2011 |accessdate=14 February 2015}}</ref> He was then carried off the pitch early in United's next league game away at [[Aston Villa]], appearing to go over on his ankle without a challenge from an opponent. After the match, manager Sir Alex Ferguson said Hernández had suffered ankle ligament damage and would be out for up to four weeks.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United's Javier Hernandez suffers ankle ligament injury |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/16019444 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 December 2011 |accessdate=3 December 2011}}</ref> On 18 December, Hernández made a surprise early return against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]]. He came on as a 63rd-minute substitute for Danny Welbeck in United's 2–0 victory at [[Loftus Road]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=QPR 0–2 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/16129427 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 December 2011 |accessdate=18 December 2011}}</ref>
On 31 January 2012, Hernández scored his first goal since November, and his seventh goal of the season in a 2–0 league win at Old Trafford against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], scoring the first of two penalties.<ref>Fisher, Alex.[http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/60437/manchester-united-vs-stoke/report: "Man Utd 2–0 Stoke: Chicharito scores"]. ''Goal.com''. Retrieved 31 January 2012.</ref> Hernández continued his scoring form on 5 February at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], scoring the third goal of a three-goal comeback draw, heading in a cross from [[Ryan Giggs]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://eurosport.yahoo.com/05022012/2/united-fight-3-0-draw-chelsea.html |title=Yahoo UK & Ireland – Sports News – Live Scores – Results}}{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On 16 February, Hernández scored his first goal in the [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]], in a 2–0 away win against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] in the round of 32.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20120219053025/http://bostonherald.com/sports/soccer/general/view/20120217man_united_win_2-0_at_ajax_city_2-1_in_porto_atletico_impress/ "Man United win 2–0 at Ajax"]. ''Boston Herald''. Retrieved 17 February 2012.</ref> He scored again in the second leg at Old Trafford on 23 February, but this time in a 2–1 home defeat. However, United still won the tie 3–2 on aggregate.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17071413: "BBC Sport – Manchester United 1–2 Ajax (agg: 3–2)"]. BBC (British Broadcasting Corporation). Retrieved 23 February 2012.</ref> On 18 March, Hernández scored twice in a 5–0 win over Wolverhampton Wanderers.<ref>[http://m.guardian.co.uk/football/2012/mar/18/wolverhampton-wanderers-manchester-united-mbm?cat=football&type=article: "Wolverhampton Wanderers vs. Manchester United – as it happened"]. ''The Guardian''. Retrieved 18 March 2012.</ref>
====2012–13 season==== [[File:Javier Hernández in 2012.jpg|thumb|upright|Hernández during a training session with Manchester United in 2012]] Hernández began his [[2012–13 Manchester United F.C. season|third season]] with United on 2 September 2012, coming on as a 72nd-minute substitute for [[Danny Welbeck]] in a 3–2 win against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Southampton vs Man Utd |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/146419/javier-hernandez?cc=4716 |website=ESPN Soccernet |date=3 September 2012 |accessdate=3 September 2012}}</ref> On 15 September, he was named in the starting eleven for the match against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], playing all 90 minutes. Despite having a penalty saved in the fifth minute by Wigan goalkeeper [[Ali Al-Habsi]], Hernández scored his first goal of the [[2012–13 Premier League|season]], as well as assisting in teammate [[Nick Powell]]'s goal in a 4–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd vs Wigan Athletic match report |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/javier-hernandez-scores-fourth-goal-175800429--sow.html |website=ESPN Soccernet |date=16 September 2012 |accessdate=17 September 2012}}</ref> On 23 October, Hernández netted a brace in a 3–2 comeback win against [[S.C. Braga|Braga]] in a [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage match after United had gone down 2–0 in the first half.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Man Utd 3–2 Braga |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/19958216 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 October 2012 |accessdate=23 October 2012}}</ref> Five days later, he scored the winner against nine-man Chelsea in a controversial 3–2 win after he was deemed to have been in an offside position when scoring the goal.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Chelsea 2–3 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20020062 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 October 2012 |accessdate=28 December 2015}}</ref>
On 10 November 2012, Hernández came on as a second-half substitute and scored two goals as United came from 2–0 down to beat [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] 2–3 at [[Villa Park]].
