Crotone|Crotone]] (loan) | clubs3 = [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] | clubs4 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps1 = 150 | caps2 = 22 | caps3 = 41 | caps4 = 99 | goals1 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | goals4 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam1 = [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italy U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 10 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2011– | nationalteam2 = [[Italy national football team|Italy]] | nationalcaps2 = 13 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry|{{ITA}}}} {{MedalSport|[[Association football]]}} {{MedalCompetition |[[UEFA European Football Championship|UEFA Euro]]}} {{MedalSilver|[[UEFA Euro 2012|Poland & Ukraine 2012]]|}} | club-update = 17:13, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 5 September 2016 (UTC) }} '''Obinze Angelo Ogbonna''' (born 23 May 1988), known as '''Angelo Ogbonna''', is an Italian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre back]] for English {{English football updater|WestHamU}} [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[Italy national football team|Italian national team]].
He signed for [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] in 2002, having previously been a member of [[A.S.D. Nuova Cassino 1924|Nuova Cassino]]'s youth set-up. Ogbonna made his debut in [[Serie A]] at the age of 18 under [[Alberto Zaccheroni]]. After a loan spell at [[F.C. Crotone|Crotone]] in [[Serie C1]], he returned to Torino, with whom he played for a further five seasons. In July 2013, he transferred to city rivals, [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], winning the [[List of Italian football champions|''Scudetto'']] in [[2013–14 Serie A|2013–14]] and [[2014–15 Serie A|2014–15]], as well as the [[2013 Supercoppa Italiana]] and the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia]].
He was a member of the Italian side which finished runners-up at [[UEFA Euro 2012]], and also represented his nation at [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Torino=== Ogbonna began his early career in the youth set-up of [[A.S.D. Nuova Cassino 1924|Cassino]], where he played as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]]. In 2002, he was noticed by [[Torino F.C.|Torino]], which, on the recommendation of [[Antonio Comi]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.torinogranata.it/?action=read&idnotizia=23207|title=Comi "consiglia" la Roma ad Ogbonna|publisher=torinogranata.it|author= Marina Beccuti|date=30 August 2011|accessdate=13 October 2011}}</ref> bought him for €3,000 and assigned him to their youth team.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://archivio.lastampa.it/LaStampaArchivio/main/History/tmpl_viewObj.jsp?objid=10690860 |title=Ogbonna, questione di testa |publisher=La Stampa |author=Pietro Ivaldi |date=5 February 2011 |accessdate=5 February 2011 |page=43 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131110003838/http://archivio.lastampa.it/LaStampaArchivio/main/History/tmpl_viewObj.jsp?objid=10690860 |archivedate=10 November 2013 }}</ref> In the 2006–07 season he was regularly called up to the first team and on 11 February 2007 he made his debut in [[Serie A]] at age 18, against [[Reggina Calcio|Reggina]] (1–2), as a starter under coach [[Alberto Zaccheroni]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://archivio.lastampa.it/LaStampaArchivio/main/History/tmpl_viewObj.jsp?objid=7508358 |title=Il Toro ai raggi X |publisher=La Stampa |author=Roberto Condio |date=12 February 2006 |accessdate=30 December 2010 |page=53 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131110001946/http://archivio.lastampa.it/LaStampaArchivio/main/History/tmpl_viewObj.jsp?objid=7508358 |archivedate=10 November 2013 }}</ref> At the end of season he totalled 4 league appearances.
The following August he moved on loan to [[F.C. Crotone|Crotone]] in [[Serie C1]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.torinofc.it/content/view/1707/61/ |title=Cioffi all'Ascoli, Ogbonna al Crotone |publisher=torinofc.it |date=31 August 2007 |accessdate=24 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070906034959/http://www.torinofc.it/content/view/1707/61/ |archivedate=6 September 2007 }}</ref> making 22 league appearances in the league and narrowly earning promotion to [[Serie B]], lost in the semi-final play-offs.
In the [[2008–09 Serie A]] season he returned to Torino, collecting 19 league appearances and four in [[2008–09 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]]. Torino, however, were relegated to [[Serie B]] at the end of the season. Starting from 2009, after the relegation of the club to Serie B, he earned his place as a starter for the ''Granata''. On 17 April 2010, Ogbonna scored his first goal for Torino in the match against [[A.C. Cesena|Cesena]], finishing 1–1.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.torinofc.it/content/view/6268/61/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=8 July 2015 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120913044038/http://www.torinofc.it/content/view/6268/61/ |archive-date=13 September 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> On 15 August 2010, in the second round of [[2010–11 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]] against [[Cosenza Calcio 1914 (2008)|Cosenza]] (won 3–1 in extra time), he wore the [[Captain (association football)|captain]]'s armband for the first time. In three Serie B seasons with Torino, Ogbonna made 105 appearances, helping the club return to Serie A after finishing second to [[Delfino Pescara 1936|Pescara]] during the [[2011-12 Serie B|2011–12 season]].
On 2 February 2012, he renewed his contract with Torino until 30 June 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.torinofc.it/content/view/9523/61/|title=OGBONNA RINNOVA FINO AL 2016|date=2 February 2012|accessdate=9 February 2012|work=Torino FC|language=Italian|archive-url=https://archive.is/20121209104728/http://www.torinofc.it/content/view/9523/61/|archive-date=9 December 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Juventus=== [[File:Real Madrid vs Juventus, 24 October 2013 Champions League 14 (cropped).JPG|thumb|right|Ogbonna ''(wearing No.5)'' alongside his [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] teammates in a 2013 [[UEFA Champions League]] match at [[Real Madrid]].]]
On 11 July 2013, Ogbonna underwent a medical at [[Turin]]'s Fornaca, Isokinetic and the Istituto di Medicina dello Sport ahead of his proposed cross-town move to [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/ogbonna_medical|title=Ogbonna completes Juventus medical|work=Juventus.com|accessdate=7 July 2015}}</ref> After passing the medical, he officially signed for Juventus for a transfer fee of €13 million, with an additional €2 million to be paid in future bonuses.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/ogbonna_juventus_transfer|title=Ogbonna signs for Juventus|work=Juventus.com|accessdate=7 July 2015}}</ref> He became the first player to become [[captain (association football)|captain]] of the ''Granata'' and transfer to rivals Juventus,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ricerca.repubblica.it/repubblica/archivio/repubblica/2013/07/10/ogbonna-capitano-granata-che-volle-farsi-juventino.html|title=Ogbonna, capitano granata che volle farsi juventino|work=Archivio — la Repubblica.it|accessdate=7 July 2015}}</ref> sparking much dislike with his old supporters of Torino.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sport.panorama.it/calcio/juventus-torino-ogbonna|title="Gobbonna"? No, grazie|work=Panorama|accessdate=7 July 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131221163035/http://sport.panorama.it/calcio/juventus-torino-ogbonna|archive-date=21 December 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He made his Champions League debut in on 17 September 2013, against [[F.C. Copenhagen]].<ref name=soccerway>{{cite web | url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/angelo-obinze-ogbonna/9770/ | title=A. Ogbonna | publisher=Soccerway | accessdate=8 July 2015}}</ref> In his first season, despite being behind [[Andrea Barzagli]], [[Leonardo Bonucci]] and [[Giorgio Chiellini]] in the pecking order at centre back, Ogbonna managed 25 appearances in all competitions, mostly starting in matches in the latter half of the season as the team was heavily rotated for league, Coppa Italia and Champions League matches. Ogbonna played 16 league games for Juventus in the [[2013–14 Serie A|2013–14 season]], as they won Serie A title.<ref name=soccerway/> He was also a member of the side which won the [[2013 Supercoppa Italiana]]<ref name=soccerway/> In the [[2014–15 Serie A|2014–15]] season, Juventus defended the Serie A title once again, with Ogbonna making 25 league appearances, and the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia]].<ref name=soccerway/> On 6 June 2015, he was an unused substitute as Juventus lost the [[2015 UEFA Champions League Final|Champions League Final]] 3–1 to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in Berlin.<ref name=soccerway/>
===West Ham United=== [[File:Leicester City v West Ham United April 2016 - Vardy & Ogbonna.jpeg|thumb|right|Ogbonna ''(right)'' playing for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], 2016]]
On 10 July 2015, Ogbonna joined [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], on a four-year contract, for €11 million to be spread over the next three financial years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/news/news/2015/thanks-angelo-ogbonna.php|title=Thanks, Angelo — Juventus.com|work=Juventus.com|accessdate=24 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33486122 | title=Angelo Ogbonna: West Ham sign Juventus defender | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=10 July 2015}}</ref> He made his debut 20 days later in the Europa League [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round|third qualifying round]], starting against [[FC Astra Giurgiu|Astra Giurgiu]]; in the 82nd minute he netted an [[own goal]] equaliser as West Ham drew 2–2 at the [[Boleyn Ground]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667110|title=West Ham 2–2 Astra Giurgiu|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 July 2015|accessdate=30 July 2015}}</ref> On 9 February 2016, Ogbonna scored his first goal for the club, netting an injury-time match-winning header in the 121st minute of a 2–1 home win over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], in the fourth round [[2015–16 FA Cup|FA Cup]] replay.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/feb/09/west-ham-liverpool-fa-cup-fourth-round-replay-match-report|title=Angelo Ogbonna heads West Ham past Liverpool in FA Cup replay|publisher=The Guardian|author1=James Riach|date=9 February 2016|accessdate=10 February 2016}}</ref>
Having played 18 of a possible 22 Premier League games for West Ham in the [[2016–17 West Ham United F.C. season|2016–17 season]], he was ruled out for the remainder of the season as he required an operation. West Ham manager, [[Slaven Bilić]], said that Ogbonna had played every game of the season despite carrying the injury.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38707342|title=Angelo Ogbonna: West Ham defender to miss rest of season|date=21 January 2017|publisher=|accessdate=25 January 2017|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref> He returned for the final game of the 2016–17 season, a 2–1 away win against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/premier-league/burnley-vs-west-ham-united_game_56316.html|title=Burnley 1–2 West Ham United – Premier League – Football|website=www.sportsmole.co.uk|accessdate=30 June 2017}}</ref> In June 2017, Ogbonna signed a new contract with West Ham committing him to the club until 2022.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/june/30-june/angelo-ogbonna-signs-new-contract|title=Angelo Ogbonna signs new contract – West Ham United|website=www.whufc.com|accessdate=30 June 2017}}</ref>
==International career== On 12 August 2009, he made his debut with the [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italian under-21 team]] in a friendly game against [[Russia national under-21 football team|Russia]].<ref name="figc.it">{{cite web|title=Nazionale in cifre: Ogbonna Obinze, Angelo|url=http://www.figc.it/nazionali/DettaglioConvocato?codiceConvocato=3451&squadra=1|publisher=FIGC|accessdate=24 May 2015|language=Italian}}</ref>
Ogbonna made his [[Italy national football team|senior]] debut on 11 November 2011 in a 2–0 [[exhibition game|friendly]] victory against [[Poland national football team|Poland]], where he came on as a substitute for [[Domenico Criscito]] in the 77th minute.<ref name="figc.it"/>
Ogbonna was included by manager [[Cesare Prandelli]] in the Italian 23-man final squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]], but did not play during the competition.<ref name="figc.it"/>
In May 2016, Ogbonna was included in the provisional 30-man Italy squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://allnigeriasoccer.com/read_news.php?nid=19150|title=West Ham Defender Ogbonna Included In Italy Provisional Roster For Euro 2016:: All Nigeria Soccer — The Complete Nigerian Football Portal|publisher=AllNigeriaSoccer.com|accessdate=24 May 2016}}</ref> On 31 May 2016, he was named in [[Antonio Conte]]'s final 23-man squad for the tournament.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/85206/official-italy-squad-euro-2016|title=OFFICIAL: Italy squad for Euro 2016|publisher=Football Italia|date=31 May 2016|accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref> Ogbonna made his only appearance of the tournament on 22 June, in Italy's final group match, which ended in a 1–0 defeat to [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Ireland]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Adams |title=Brady sends euphoric Ireland into the last 16 |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000448/match=2017958/postmatch/report/index.html |website=UEFA.com |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |date=22 June 2016 |accessdate=22 June 2016 }}</ref>
==Style of play== A strong and powerful central defender, Ogbonna is primarily known for his outstanding physical attributes;<ref name="Torino: Fenomeno Ogbonna, gioiello per l'estate">{{cite web|url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/serie-b/torino-fenomeno-ogbonna-gioiello-per-l-estate-252450|title=Torino: Fenomeno Ogbonna, gioiello per l'estate|trans-title=Torino: Ogbonna Phenomenon, jewel for the summer|publisher=tuttomercatoweb.com|language=Italian|accessdate=13 September 2014}}</ref><ref name="home">{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/juves-prem-linked-stopper-who-needs-new-home-summer|title=Juve's Prem-linked stopper who needs a new home this summer|publisher=FourFourTwo.com|author1=Adam Digby|date=29 May 2015|accessdate=26 January 2017}}</ref> he is also a competent tackler, and possesses a good positional sense, as well as an ability to read the game.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/club/juventus/111/blog/post/2479100/how-will-juve-replace-chiellinis-leadership|title=Giorgio Chiellini's leadership will be missed in UCL final absence|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=MINA RZOUKI|date=4 June 2015|accessdate=14 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/36433/ogbonna-bull-bianconero|title=Ogbonna – From Bull to Bianconero|publisher=Football Italia|author1=Dave Taylor|date=14 July 2013|accessdate=14 February 2017}}</ref> He is also capable of playing as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left-back]] on occasion, due to his pace, technique, ball skills, vision, and distribution with his left foot.<ref name="Torino: Fenomeno Ogbonna, gioiello per l'estate"/><ref name="home"/>
==Personal life== Ogbonna was born to Nigerian parents who emigrated to Italy from Nigeria in 1983, settling in the city of [[Cassino]] in the central part of the country, but managed to obtain Italian citizenship only after his 18th birthday.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.italiarazzismo.it/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=392:all-black-italians&catid=53:allultimo-stadio&Itemid=58 |title=All Black Italians |publisher=Italia-Razzismo |accessdate=26 November 2011 |date=20 October 2009}}</ref>
On 22 December 2008, Ogbonna survived a car accident near [[Turin]] after he lost control of his [[Smart (marque)|Smart car]] and drove off a bridge into a [[Stream#Intermittent and ephemeral streams|torrent]] at around 5:00 AM.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Primo_Piano/2008/12/22/ogbonna.shtml |publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport |accessdate=2008-12-22|date=2008-12-22 |title=Che paura per Ogbonna! Giù da un ponte con l'auto |language=Italian| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081223022052/http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Primo_Piano/2008/12/22/ogbonna.shtml| archivedate= 23 December 2008 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Ryan Fredericks | image = Ryan Fredericks 2017.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Fredericks playing for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in 2017 | fullname = Ryan Marlowe Fredericks{{cite web |url=https://www.bdfutbol.com/en/j/j95740.html |title=Fredericks: Ryan Marlowe Fredericks: Player |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=5 May 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|10|10|df=y}}{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/144751/ryan-fredericks |title=Ryan Fredericks |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=5 May 2018}} | birth_place = [[Hammersmith]], England | height = {{convert|1.81|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.fulhamfc.com/player-profiles/ryan-fredericks |title=Ryan Fredericks |publisher=Fulham F.C. |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180506091752/https://www.fulhamfc.com/player-profiles/ryan-fredericks |archivedate=6 May 2018 |deadurl=yes}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | clubnumber = 24 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2010 | youthclubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and Academy|Tottenham Hotspur]] | years1 = 2010–2015 | clubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] (loan) | caps2 = 4 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2014 | clubs3 = → [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] (loan) | caps3 = 14 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2014–2015 | clubs4 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) | caps4 = 17 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015 | clubs5 = [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] | caps5 = 4 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2015–2018 | clubs6 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | caps6 = 106 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2018– | clubs7 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps7 = 9 | goals7 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2011 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 2 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Ryan Marlowe Fredericks''' (born 10 October 1992) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full-back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. He has previously played for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]], [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]], [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] and [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]. ==Career== ===Tottenham Hotspur=== Born in [[Hammersmith]], London,{{Hugman|23100|accessdate=5 May 2018}} Fredericks joined the Tottenham [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and Academy|academy]] in July 2009.{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=53280 |title=Ryan Fredericks profile |publisher=SoccerBase |accessdate=7 June 2018}} Although he was injured early in his career, he progressed through the academy to sign a professional contract with the club in July 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/u18s-draw-at-coventry-090111/ |title=U18S DRAW AT COVENTRY |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=9 January 2011 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618190338/http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/u18s-draw-at-coventry-090111/ |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}}{{cite web |url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/tottenham-secure-exciting-trio-pro-deals-1010821 |title=Tottenham secure exciting trio to pro deals |publisher=Tribal Football Website |date=30 July 2010 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618185331/http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/tottenham-secure-exciting-trio-pro-deals-1010821 |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} In July 2011, Fredericks was awarded a new contract at the club.{{cite web |url=http://www.clubcall.com/tottenham-hotspur/young-trio-sign-lane-deals-1236737.html |title=Young trio sign Lane deals |publisher=Club Call |date=8 July 2011 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111106212749/http://www.clubcall.com/tottenham-hotspur/young-trio-sign-lane-deals-1236737.html |archivedate=6 November 2011 |deadurl=no}} Fredericks first appeared in Tottenham's first team as an unused substitute in February 2010, in an FA Cup fourth round replay win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].{{cite news |title=Defoe ends Leeds adventure |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/leeds-vs-tottenham/report/174248 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=3 February 2010 |accessdate=18 June 2016}}{{not in source|reason=The article doesn't state that this was Fredericks' first time on the bench|date=July 2018}} A year later, Fredericks started his first game for Tottenham on 25 August 2011, against [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]], where he played on the right of midfield. He made his debut alongside [[Tom Carroll (English footballer)|Tom Carroll]] and [[Harry Kane]].{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/14569541.stm |title=Tottenham v Hearts |date=25 August 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport}} Fredericks then made his first Tottenham Hotspur appearance in two years, making a start, in the last group stage game of Europa League, where he won a penalty to allow [[Roberto Soldado]] converted the penalty successfully to score a hat-trick, in a 4–1 win over [[FC Anzhi Makhachkala|Anzhi Makhachkala]] on 12 December 2013.{{cite news |title=Tottenham Hotspur 4–1 Anzhi Makhachkala |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25303130 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 December 2013 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} In January 2014, Fredericks signed a contract with Tottenham Hotspur that would keep him at the club until 2016.{{cite news |title=Tottenham's Fredericks signs new deal & extends Millwall loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25979342 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} ====Loan spells==== On 10 August 2012, he signed on loan for [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19211896 "Brentford sign Tottenham's Ryan Fredericks on loan"] BBC Sport. 10 August 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. He made his debut the following day in a 1–0 defeat against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19123932 "Walsall 1–0 Brentford"] BBC Sport. 11 August 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. He made his league debut on 18 August, in a 0–0 draw against [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19221495 "Bury 0–0 Brentford"] BBC Sport. 18 August 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. He made his home debut on 22 September, in a 1–0 win against [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19615006 "Brentford 1–0 Oldham"] BBC Sport. 22 September 2012. Retrieved 30 September 2012. Tottenham exercised the right to recall Fredericks to the Tottenham squad on 25 October 2012.{{cite web |title=Tottenham recall youngster from loan spell |url=http://www.westlondonsport.com/brentford/spurs-recall-youngster-from-loan-spell |work=West London Sport |date=25 October 2012 |accessdate=26 October 2012}} Reflecting about his time at Brentford, Fredericks said the move benefited, as the player he is today.{{cite news |title=Ryan Fredericks: Brentford loan spell helped me realise how far I was from being a first team player |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ryan-fredericks-brentford-loan-spell-13980357 |publisher=Get West London |date=1 December 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} On 17 January 2014, he switched to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] for a three-month loan.{{cite news |title=Transfer window: Millwall sign Ryan Fredericks from Spurs |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25779252 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} He made his début the following day, a home match against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]], where he scored the only goal of the game with a lob from the right back position.{{cite news |title=Millwall 1–0 Ipswich Town |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25692448 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} After two appearances, Fredericks' loan spell at Millwall was extended until the end of the season.{{cite web |url=http://www.millwallfc.co.uk/news/article/fredericks-extension-1329462.aspx |title=Fredericks extension |publisher=Millwall F.C. |date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618194100/http://www.millwallfc.co.uk/news/article/fredericks-extension-1329462.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} Fredericks became a first team regular at Millwall in the right-back position, making 14 appearances. On 28 August 2014, Fredericks joined [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] for a season-long loan.{{cite web |title=Tottenham Youngster Fredericks Joins Boro on Season Long Loan |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/280814-fredericks-joins-boro-1880453.aspx? |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |accessdate=28 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618194758/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/280814-fredericks-joins-boro-1880453.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no |df=dmy-all}} However, he remained on the sidelines until he was called up to the first team by manager [[Aitor Karanka]] following [[Damià Abella]]'s injury.{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/180914-damia-injury-1926626.aspx |title=Damia Injury Blow Confirmed – Ryan Fredericks Set To Step In |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=18 September 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141220091441/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/180914-damia-injury-1926626.aspx |archivedate=20 December 2014 |deadurl=no}} His league debut came on 20 September 2014, where he played 90 minutes against former club Brentford and saw Middlesbrough win 4–0.{{cite news |title=Middlesbrough 4–0 Brentford |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29186838 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} He suffered a thigh injury during a match against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]],{{cite news |title=Middlesbrough 1 – 1 Blackburn Rovers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30155730 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 November 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} and was sidelined for a month.{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-fredericks-dimi-konstantopoulos-riverside-stadium-2121069.aspx |title=Fredericks Out for a Month – Dimi And Dani Doubts For Millwall |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=3 December 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141203202015/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-fredericks-dimi-konstantopoulos-riverside-stadium-2121069.aspx |archivedate=3 December 2014 |deadurl=no}} He made his first appearance after returning from injury in a 1–0 win over Brentford on 31 January 2015.{{cite news |title=Brentford 0–1 Middlesbrough |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30962912 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} After appearing six times in nine appearance between February and March, Fredericks suffered a hamstring injury, which he sustained during a match against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on 7 March 2015.{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-ryan-fredericks-dani-ayala-aitor-karanka-championship-2329916.aspx |title=Ryan Fredericks Out of Ipswich Clash – But Dani Ayala Could Return For Boro |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=12 May 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618202954/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/boro-ryan-fredericks-dani-ayala-aitor-karanka-championship-2329916.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} After returning to training in early-April,{{cite web |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/middlesbrough-boro-ryan-fredericks-watford-2371980.aspx |title=Ryan Fredericks Fit For Boro's Visit From Wigan – Easter Injury Update |publisher=Middlesbrough F.C. |date=2 April 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618203130/http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/middlesbrough-boro-ryan-fredericks-watford-2371980.aspx |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} Fredericks remained on the sidelines until 25 April 2015, playing the first hour of a 4–3 loss to Fulham.{{cite news |title=Fulham 4–3 Middlesbrough |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32362246 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 April 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Despite being sidelined, Fredericks went on to make 17 appearances for Middlesbrough before returning to his parent club.{{cite news |title=Five players who could be released by Boro this summer |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/five-players-who-could-released-9339900 |work=Gazette Live |date=27 May 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} ===Bristol City=== On 6 August 2015, Fredericks joined [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on a permanent transfer, signing a three-year contract, and was given the number twelve shirt ahead of the new season.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33801853 |title=Ryan Fredericks: Bristol City sign Tottenham Hotspur defender |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2015}}{{cite news |title=BRISTOL CITY: Robins announce squad numbers with summer signing Jonathan Kodjia opting for 22 shirt |url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/bristol-city-robins-announce-squad-numbers/story-27563896-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bristol Post |date=7 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}}{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Fredericks stated the club's "open and attacking" football was his motivation for joining.{{cite news |title=BRISTOL CITY: New-boy Ryan Fredericks pledges attacking approach |url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/bristol-city-new-boy-ryan-fredericks-pledges/story-27558487-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bristol Post |date=7 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Fredericks made his Bristol City debut, in the opening game of the season, where he played as a right-midfield before switching to left-midfield, in a 2–0 loss away at [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].{{cite news |title=FULL-TIME: Sheffield Wednesday 2, Bristol City 0 |url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/time-sheffield-wednesday-v-bristol-city/story-27569658-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bristol Post |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} However, after just twenty-six days at the club and making only five appearance in all competitions for the club, it was reported that Fredericks was on the verge of leaving Bristol City, citing personal reasons and that he would be returning to London to an unnamed side,{{cite news |title=Ryan Fredericks to leave Bristol City 26 days after signing |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11065/9970837/ryan-fredericks-to-leave-bristol-city-26-days-after-signing |publisher=Sky Sports |date=29 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} which was later to be revealed as Fulham.{{cite news |title=Fulham close in on signing of Bristol City's Ryan Fredericks |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11065/9972499/fulham-close-in-on-signing-of-bristol-city8217s-ryan-fredericks |publisher=Sky Sports |date=30 August 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} ===Fulham=== [[File:Fulham Fredericks and O'Hara.JPG|thumb|left|250px|Ryan Fredericks (7) playing for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].]] He joined Championship club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a three-year contract on 31 August 2015, with the fee undisclosed.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34107716 |title=Ryan Fredericks: Fulham sign Bristol City wing-back |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 August 2015 |accessdate=31 August 2015}} Fredericks made his Fulham debut, coming on as a substitute for [[Ben Pringle]] in the 62nd minute, in a 2–1 win against Blackburn Rovers on 13 September 2015.{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–1 Blackburn Rovers: Hosts win Championship thriller at Craven Cottage |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-blackburn/339597 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=13 September 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} He started out, playing in the right–back position for the next two matches before playing in the right–midfield position (whenever he came on as a substitute).{{cite news |title=Fulham v Bristol City: Who's back and who's missing for Whites – answers here |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-v-bristol-city-whos-10354643 |publisher=Get West London |date=29 October 2015 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham pay the penalty against Leeds United as Steve Evans earns a point on his return to management |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/fulham-pay-penalty-against-leeds-10308749 |publisher=Get West London |date=21 October 2015 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} For the rest of the season, Fredericks continued to play in either the right–back position and right–midfield position.{{cite news |title=Fulham boss insists there is a future for Wales international and ex-Swansea Jazz Richards – but it’s not where you think |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-insists-future-wales-10971823 |publisher=Get West London |date=29 February 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/february/16/fredericks-keep-it-going |title=Fredericks: Keep It Going |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=16 February 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728133010/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/february/16/fredericks-keep-it-going |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/march/06/fredericks-reaction |title=Fredericks: Pleasing Comeback. |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=6 March 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728133017/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/march/06/fredericks-reaction |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}} Despite suffering injuries during the 2015–16 season{{cite news |title=Fulham missing three defenders for trip to Sheffield Wednesday – plus update on Scott Parker |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-missing-three-defenders-trip-10077529 |publisher=Get West London |date=17 September 2015 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham v Birmingham City: Whites have no right-back for Blues visit – and seven others also miss out |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-v-birmingham-city-whites-10401105 |website=Get West London |date=6 November 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Fredericks went on to make 36 appearances for Fulham in his first season. In the 2016–17 season, Fredericks spent the start of the season with ankle injury and was sidelined between 10–12 weeks following surgery.{{cite news |title=Fulham boss faces selection dilemma ahead of Preston clash |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-faces-selection-dilemma-11735948 |publisher=Get West London |date=11 August 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham defender primed for return |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-defender-primed-for-return-12002579 |publisher=Get West London |date=10 October 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} It wasn’t until on 18 October 2016 when he returned to the first team from injury, starting the match in the right–back position, in a 2–2 draw against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–2 Norwich City: Fulham fight back for draw |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-norwich/358260 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 October 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Since returning from injury, he regained his first team place, in the right–back position.{{cite news |title=Fulham thump hapless Huddersfield in five-star show |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-thump-hapless-huddersfield-five-12096899 |publisher=Get West London |date=29 October 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/december/19/ryan-fredericks-we-dominated |title=Fredericks: We Dominated |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=19 December 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728140507/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/december/19/ryan-fredericks-we-dominated |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Best Fulham right-back: Denis Odoi or Ryan Fredericks? Boss offers his view |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/best-fulham-right-back-denis-12602438 |publisher=Get West London |date=14 February 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} In a match against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on 10 December 2016, Fredericks played a role for Fulham when he set up two goals, resulting a 4–4 draw.{{cite news |title=Wolves 4–4 Fulham: All square in eight-goal thriller |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/wolves-vs-fulham/358349 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=10 December 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Seven days later, on 17 December 2016, he provided another assist in a match against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]], setting up a goal for [[Floyd Ayité]], in a 2–2 draw.{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–2 Derby: Alex Pearce earns Rams point at Craven Cottage |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-derby/358367 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=17 December 2016 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Three weeks later, on 8 January 2017, Fredericks played another role against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in [[2016–17 FA Cup#Third_Round_Proper|the third round of the FA Cup]] when he set up the equaliser, in a 2–1 win; his performance earned him Man of the Match.{{cite news |title=Fulham reaction in Cardiff from Ryan Fredericks, the boss, and Tom Cairney to FA Cup victory |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-reaction-cardiff-ryan-fredericks-12422723 |publisher=Get West London |date=8 January 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham player ratings against Cardiff – marks out of 10 for Whites |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-player-ratings-against-cardiff-12422379 |publisher=Get West London |date=8 January 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} However, in a match against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] on 4 February 2017, he was sent–off for a late tackle on Craig Gardner, in a 1–0 loss.{{cite news |title=Fulham suffer punishing defeat at Birmingham as former Tottenham man sent off |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/fulham-suffer-punishing-defeat-birmingham-12557492 |publisher=Get West London |date=4 February 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} After serving a three match suspension, Fredericks continued to regain his first team place in the right–back position for the rest of the season.{{cite news |title=Fulham's Denis Odoi believes rotation of full-backs is key ahead of Championship run-in |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulhams-denis-odoi-believes-rotation-12802953 |publisher=Get West London |date=27 March 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Norwich City vs Fulham: Pick your XI as our reporter goes with the same eleven that topped Ipswich |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/norwich-city-vs-fulham-pick-12885997 |publisher=Get West London |date=12 April 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Norwich City vs Fulham: Pick your XI as our reporter goes with the same eleven that topped Ipswich |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/norwich-city-vs-fulham-pick-12885997 |publisher=Get West London |date=12 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} He also played in both legs of the [[2017 English Football League play-offs|play-offs]], which saw Reading won 2–1 on aggregate.{{cite news |title=Ryan Fredericks insists Fulham are still confident going into second leg tie against Reading |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ryan-fredericks-insists-fulham-still-13031812 |publisher=Get West London |date=14 May 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Reading 1 – 0 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39853033 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Throughout the season, Fredericks’ performance was praised, due to his passing stats and pace.{{cite news |title=Why did Fulham pair Sone Aluko and Ryan Fredericks find a place in the WhoScored? team of the week? |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-pair-sone-aluko-ryan-12697954 |publisher=Get West London |date=6 March 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} At the end of the 2016–17 season, he went on to make 34 appearances in all competitions. In the 2017–18 season, Fredericks continued to regain his first team place in the right–back position at the start of the season.{{cite news |title=New season but 'same speech' for Fulham boss after 'hurtful' Norwich City draw |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-season-same-speech-fulham-13438602 |publisher=Get West London |date=6 August 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} After going on three league matches without a win, he then played a role when he set up a goal for [[Neeskens Kebano]], in a 2–1 win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on 26 August 2017.{{cite news |title=Ipswich Town 0–2 Fulham: Player ratings as Neeskens Kebano and Rui Fonte give the Cottagers victory |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/ipswich-town-0-2-fulham-13533343 |publisher=Get West London |date=26 August 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} Two weeks later, on 13 September 2017, Fredericks provided his second assists this season, setting up the winning goal, in a 2–1 win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–1 Hull City: Stefan Johansen seals first Craven Cottage win of the season |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-hull-city/374694 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=13 September 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} He was an ever present in the first team since the start of the 2017–18 season until he suffered a foot injury that saw him missed one game.{{cite news |title=Fulham boss Slavisa Jokanovic gives update on Ryan Fredericks after missing Preston game through injury |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-slavisa-jokanovic-gives-13764482 |publisher=Get West London |date=15 October 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham vs Preston North End: Confirmed team news as Ryan Fredericks misses out through injury |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-vs-preston-north-end-13761702 |publisher=Get West London |date=14 October 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} After returning from injury against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 21 October 2017, he continued to regain his first team place.{{cite news |title=Aston Villa 2 – 1 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41618275 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 October 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham v Barnsley – TEAM NEWS from Craven Cottage |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-v-barnsley-team-news-14075876 |publisher=Get West London |date=23 December 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} His performance at Fulham this season attracted from clubs, such as, [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] and [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], but stayed at the club throughout January.{{cite news |title=How much do you think Swansea target Ryan Fredericks is worth at Fulham? |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/how-much-you-think-swansea-14134575 |publisher=Get West London |date=10 December 2017 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} His contributions led Fulham reaching the [[2018 English Football League play-offs|play–offs]] and subsequently ended up reaching the [[Premier League]] after beating [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] 1–0 in the [[2018 EFL Championship play-off Final|final]], where he started and played 83 minutes before being substituted.{{cite news |title=Fulham 2–0 Derby County (2–1 agg.) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44026478 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 May 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Aston Villa 0 – 1 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44178427 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} For his performance, Fredericks was named in the EFL Championship team of the year in April 2018, along with teammate [[Ryan Sessegnon]] and [[Tom Cairney]].{{Cite web |title=EFL awards: Tom Cairney, Ruben Neves & Ryan Sessegnon on Championship shortlist |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43641225 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 April 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018}} He’s also being named for the Championship Team of the Season.{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2018/april/03/efl-awards-2018 |title=EFL Awards 2018 |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=3 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728163155/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2018/april/03/efl-awards-2018 |archivedate=28 July 2018 |deadurl=no}} At the end of the 2017–18 season, Fredericks went on to make 48 appearances in all competitions. With his contract at Fulham expected to expire at the end of the 2017–18 season, Fredericks hinted about staying at Fulham.{{cite news |title=West Ham target Ryan Fredericks offers strongest hint yet that he wants to stay at Fulham |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/west-ham-target-ryan-fredericks-14507963 |publisher=Get West London |date=9 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}}
{{cite news |title=Fulham is the right place for Tom Cairney, Ryan Fredericks and Ryan Sessegnon – Jokanovic |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/tottenham-ryan-sessegnon-fulham-right-14496434 |publisher=Get West London |date=15 April 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018}} ===West Ham United=== Fredericks' free transfer to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] was announced on 5 June 2018, joining on a four-year contract from Fulham.{{Cite web|title=Ryan Fredericks to join West Ham United|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/june/05-june/ryan-fredericks-join-west-ham-united}|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=5 June 2018|accessdate=5 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728162009/https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/june/05-june/ryan-fredericks-join-west-ham-united|archivedate=28 July 2018|deadurl=no}} He made his debut on 12 August in a 4–0 defeat by [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45073328 |title=Salah, Mane & Sturridge on target as Liverpool beat West Ham 4–0 |date=12 August 2018 |publisher= |accessdate=13 August 2018 |via=www.bbc.co.uk}} He scored his first goal for West Ham in their 8–0 defeat of [[Macclesfield Town F.C.|Macclesfield Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]] on 26 September 2018.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45569334 |title=West Ham 8–0 Macclesfield: Hammers thrash Macclesfield to reach fourth round |date=26 September 2018 |publisher= |accessdate=27 September 2018 |via=www.bbc.co.uk}} ==International career== Fredericks made a single appearance for the [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19 team]] in 2011, in a 3–0 defeat against the Netherlands.{{cite news |title=Three facts: Familiarise yourself with Boro's latest signing Ryan Fredericks |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/three-facts-familiarise-yourself-boros-7683936 |work=Gazette Live |date=28 August 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2016}} Fredericks is also eligible to represent [[Guyana national football team|Guyana]].{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/apr/14/millwall-matthew-briggs-guyana |title=Millwall's Matthew Briggs rediscovers his roots with Guyana success |first=Nick |last=Ames |date=14 April 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian}} ==Personal life== Upon joining Fulham, Fredericks revealed that he had been a district champion in the 100m and the triple jump and had been offered athletics scholarships as a youth.{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/december/11/the-need-for-speed |title=The Need For Speed |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=11 December 2015 |accessdate=18 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618212438/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/december/11/the-need-for-speed |archivedate=18 June 2016 |deadurl=no}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 2 March 2019}} {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition {{Infobox football biography |name = Arthur Masuaku |image = Arthur Masuaku with West Ham.jpg |image_size = 200 |caption = Arthur Masuaku with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2016 |fullname = Fuka-Arthur Masuaku Kawela<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136|title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed|publisher=Premier League|date=2 September 2016|accessdate=2 September 2016}}</ref> |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|11|7|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Lille]], France<ref name=FFF/> |height = 1.79 m<ref name=Soccerway/> |position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Left back]] |currentclub = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |clubnumber = 26 |youthyears1 = 2001–2003 |youthclubs1 = Lille OM.S. Fives |youthyears2 = 2003–2008 |youthclubs2 = [[RC Lens]] |youthyears3 = 2008–2013 |youthclubs3 = [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]] |years1 = 2013–2014 |clubs1 = [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]] |caps1 = 27 |goals1 = 1 |years2 = 2014–2016 |clubs2 = [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] |caps2 = 51 |goals2 = 1 |years3 = 2016– |clubs3 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |caps3 = 58 |goals3 = 0 |nationalyears1 = 2011 |nationalteam1 = [[France national under-18 football team|France U18]] |nationalcaps1 = 3 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2011 |nationalteam2 = [[France national under-19 football team|France U19]] |nationalcaps2 = 2 |nationalgoals2 = 0 |nationalyears3 = 2018– |nationalteam3 = [[DR Congo national football team|DR Congo]] |nationalcaps3 = 1 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |club-update = 03:13, 3 March 2019 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = 14 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Fuka-Arthur Masuaku Kawela''' (born 7 November 1993), known as '''Arthur Masuaku''', is a French-born Congolese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English {{English football updater|WestHamU}} club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[DR Congo national football team|DR Congo national team]] as a [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing-back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left back]]. He began his senior career with [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]], and has also played for [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]]. He has represented France at youth level.
==Club career== ===Valenciennes=== Masuaku came through the youth system of [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]]. He made his [[Ligue 1]] debut on the opening game of the [[2013–14 Ligue 1|2013–14 season]] on 10 August 2013 against [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]]. He was substituted after 75 minutes for [[Tongo Doumbia]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/match/292571|title=Valenciennes–Toulouse: 3–0|date=10 August 2014|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref> On 29 January 2014 Masuaku scored his first competitive goal for Valenciennes in a 2–1 away defeat against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Marseille-valenciennes-2-1/436398|title=Marseille–Valenciennes: 2–1|date=29 January 2014|accessdate=25 July 2014}}</ref>
===Olympiacos=== In July 2014, Masuaku signed for [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.olympiacos.org/article/37997/paiktis-toy-olympiakoy-o-mazoyakoy|script-title=el:Παίκτης του Ολυμπιακού ο Μαζουακού|date=22 July 2014|language=Greek|publisher=Olympiacos.org}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.footmercato.net/breves/info-fm-masuaku-s-engage-avec-l-olympiacos_133749?KeepThis=true&TB_iframe=true&height=530&width=900|title=Info FM : Masuaku s'engage avec l'Olympiacos!|trans-title=Info FM: Masuaku signs for Olympiacos|date=7 July 2014|accessdate=11 July 2014|language=French|publisher=Footmercato.net}}</ref> He made his [[Superleague Greece|Superleague]] debut against [[Niki Volos F.C.|Niki Volos]], and in his third league match he provided two assists against [[OFI Crete]] in a 3–0 home win.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport24.gr/football/omades/Olympiakos/olympiakos_-_ofh_3-0.3024171.html|title=Ολυμπιακός–ΟΦΗ 3-0|date=13 September 2014|publisher=Sport24|accessdate=12 January 2015}}</ref> Three days later he made his debut and scored in the [[UEFA Champions League]] competition against [[Atlético Madrid]] in a 3–2 home win.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/sep/16/olympiakos-atletico-madrid-champions-league-match-report |title=Olympiakos gain surprise win over 2014 beaten finalists Atlético Madrid |date=16 September 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140919172344/http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/sep/16/olympiakos-atletico-madrid-champions-league-match-report |archivedate=September 19, 2014}}</ref>
In April and May 2015, interest from [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], [[Inter Milan|Internazionale]] and [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] was reported.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sdna.gr/gr/news-in-english/arthro-news-in-english/35383/massuaku-in-roma-shortlist/|title=Masuaku in Roma shortlist|date=8 May 2015|publisher=www.sdna.gr}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.football-italia.net/65807/inter-enquire-masuaku|title=Inter enquire for Masuaku|date=29 April 2015|publisher=www.football-italia.net}}</ref> His agent, Roger Henrotay, however stated a renewal of Masuaku's contract was on the cards.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sdna.gr/gr/news-in-english/arthro-news-in-english/37267/masuaku-set-for-new-olympiakos-contract/|title=Masuaku set for new Olympiakos contract|date=16 May 2015|publisher=www.sdna.gr}}</ref> In July, a reported €4 million offer for Masuaku including former Olympiacos midfielder [[Giannis Fetfatzidis]] from [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]] was rejected by the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.calciomercato.com/news/genoa-su-masuaku-il-rifiuto-non-spaventa-preziosi-279888|title=Genoa su Masuaku: la trattativa |date=15 July 2015|publisher=www.calciomercato.com}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== On 8 August 2016, Masuaku joined [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on a four-year contract for a £6.2 million fee.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/August/8-August/Hammers-acquire-Arthur |title=Hammers acquire Arthur |date=8 August 2014 |accessdate=8 August 2016 |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809141741/http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/August/8-August/Hammers-acquire-Arthur |archivedate=9 August 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Lustig|first1=Nick|title=West Ham sign Arthur Masuaku from Olympiacos|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11685/10527846/west-ham-sign-arthur-masuaku-from-olympiacos|accessdate=8 August 2016|work=Sky Sports|date=8 August 2016}}</ref> He made his West Ham debut in a 2-1 away defeat to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 15 August 2016. Masuaku admitted that he found his Premier League debut very tough due to the pace and physicality of the league.<ref name="whudebut">{{cite news | url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2016/august/16-august/masuaku-big-week-club | title=Masuaku - This is a big week for the Club | publisher=West Ham United F.C. | date=16 August 2016 | accessdate=28 January 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for West Ham in an [[EFL Cup]] tie against [[Bolton Wanderers]] on 19 September 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41235277 |title=West Ham 3-0 Bolton |publisher=BBC |date=19 September 2017 |accessdate=20 September 2017}}</ref>
In the FA Cup fourth round game against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 27 January 2018 Masuaku was sent off for spitting at Wigan's [[Nick Powell]] following a challenge.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42756107|title=Wigan Athletic 2-0 West Ham United|date=27 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> It was the first sending-off of Masuaku's career. Musuaku apologised for the sending off, saying the incident was "totally unacceptable and out of character".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42853262|title=West Ham: Arthur Masuaku apologises for spitting in FA Cup defeat|date=28 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He received a six match ban for the offence.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42860274|title=Arthur Masuaku: West Ham defender gets six-game ban for spitting|date=29 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 January 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Having represented [[France national football team|France]] at [[France national under-18 football team|under-18]] and [[France national under-19 football team|under-19]] level,<ref name=FFF>{{cite web |url=http://www.fff.fr/equipes-de-france/tous-les-joueurs/fiche-joueur/1916827592-arthur-masuaku |title=Arthur Masuaku |publisher=Fédération Française de Football |accessdate=12 January 2015}}</ref> Masuaku switched his allegiance to [[DR Congo national football team|DR Congo]] in June 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://foot.cd/west-ham-arthur-masuaku-jouer-rdc/|title=West Ham: Arthur Masuaku peut jouer avec la RDC — FOOT.CD|website=foot.cd|accessdate=10 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afrik-foot.com/can-2019-la-liste-de-la-rdc-contre-le-congo|title=CAN 2019 : la liste de la RDC contre le Congo |website=Afrik-foot.com|accessdate=10 August 2017}}</ref> In August 2017, he was called into his first DR Congo squad, for two [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification|2018 World Cup qualification]] games against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/august/10-august/masuaku-receives-first-dr-congo-call|title=Masuaku receives first DR Congo call-up |website=www.whufc.com|accessdate=10 August 2017}}</ref> In March 2018, still yet to make his international debut, Masuaku travelled with the DR Congo squad for a friendly against Tanzania. He was one of four players to drop out before the game, amidst claims of organisational problems and travel disorder, and did not appear.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Masuaku leaves DR Congo squad early amid travel frustration claims | first = James | last = Benge | work = London Evening Standard | date = 26 March 2018 | accessdate = 21 June 2018 | url = https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/west-ham-s-arthur-masuaku-leaves-dr-congo-squad-early-amid-claims-of-travel-frustration-a3799521.html}}</ref> He made his debut on 13 October 2018, starting in a 1–2 home loss against [[Zimbabwe national football team|Zimbabwe]] in a [[2019 Africa Cup of Nations qualification]] game.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/october/13-october/masuaku-makes-dr-congo-bow-zimbabwe-defeat|title=Masuaku makes DR Congo bow in Zimbabwe defeat - West Ham United|website=www.whufc.com|accessdate=14 October 2018}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 2 March 2019}}<ref name=Soccerway>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/arthur-masuaku/202582/ |title=A. Masuaku: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=6 February 2019}}</ref>

team|Galicia]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 17:39, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20 May 2016 }} '''Lucas Pérez Martínez''' ({{IPA-es|ˈlukas ˈpeɾeθ maɾˈtineθ}}, born 10 September 1988) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for English club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].
After spending the first years of his career in the lower leagues, only appearing sporadically for the first team of [[Rayo Vallecano]] in the [[Segunda División]], he first made a name for himself with [[FC Karpaty Lviv|Karpaty Lviv]] in the [[Ukrainian Premier League]]. In 2013, he signed with [[PAOK FC|PAOK]] from Greece, and later returned to [[La Liga]] with [[Deportivo de La Coruña|Deportivo]], where he amassed a total of 93 matches and 32 goals; subsequently, he represented English clubs [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and West Ham United in the [[Premier League]].
==Club career== ===Atlético / Rayo=== Pérez was born in [[A Coruña]], [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]]. After appearing for three clubs as a youth he moved to [[Madrid]] and joined [[Atlético Madrid]]'s [[Atlético Madrid C|C-team]], playing two seasons in [[Tercera División]]. In summer 2009 he signed with [[Rayo Vallecano]], helping [[Rayo Vallecano B|the reserves]] promote from the same level in [[2009–10 Tercera División|his first year]].
In the [[2010–11 Segunda División|2010–11 season]], Pérez contributed with five games and one goal (in a 3–0 home win against [[Real Valladolid]] on 6 November 2010<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/11/06/futbol/2adivision/1289071511.html|title=Armenteros y Lucas tumban al Valladolid y lanzan al Rayo|trans-title=Armenteros and Lucas down Valladolid and propel Rayo|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=6 November 2010|accessdate=13 July 2014}}</ref>) as Rayo returned to [[La Liga]] after eight years. He continued to be mainly registered with the B side, however.
===Karpaty Lviv=== [[File:Lucas Perez at Karpaty.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Pérez after scoring a hat-trick for [[FC Karpaty Lviv|Karpaty]] in 2012]] On 17 January 2011, [[free agent]] Pérez joined [[FC Karpaty Lviv]] on a three-year deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fckarpaty.com.ua/news/oficijno_karpati_pidpisali_ispanskogo_napadnika/2011-01-20-2140|script-title=uk:ОФІЦІЙНО. "Карпати" підписали іспанського нападника|trans-title=Official. Karpaty signed Spanish striker|publisher=FC Karpaty Lviv|language=uk|date=17 January 2011|accessdate=3 February 2011}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the team on 17 July, against [[FC Chornomorets Odesa]] in a 1–1 [[Ukrainian Premier League]] draw.
Pérez netted a [[hat-trick]] on 4 November 2012 in a 4–0 home win over [[FC Kryvbas Kryvyi Rih]], including a long-distance volley from a [[corner kick]] delivery.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2012/11/05/futbol/futbol_internacional/1352113813.html|title='Mendietazo' del ex rayista Lucas en su 'hat-trick' con el Karpaty|trans-title='Goal à la Mendieta' from former Rayo player Lucas in his hat-trick for Karpaty|newspaper=Marca|language=es|date=5 November 2012|accessdate=8 November 2016}}</ref> In January 2013 he joined fellow league club [[FC Dynamo Kyiv]] on loan for the remainder of [[2012–13 Ukrainian Premier League|the campaign]], and later labelled his experience as "a nightmare".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.marca.com/2014/01/16/futbol/futbol_internacional/espanoles_mundo/1389870263.html|title=Lucas Pérez: "En el Dinamo de Kiev pasé los peores cuatro meses de mi vida"|trans-title=Lucas Pérez: "I spent the worst four months of my life at Dinamo Kiev"|newspaper=Marca|language=es|date=16 January 2014|accessdate=5 December 2018}}</ref>
===PAOK / Deportivo=== On 5 July 2013, Pérez signed on a fee of [[Euro|€]]700,000 a three-year contract with [[Superleague Greece]] team [[PAOK FC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/afp/130706/football-paok-sign-spyropoulos-and-lucas-perez-club|title=Football: PAOK sign Spyropoulos and Lucas Perez – club|publisher=[[GlobalPost]]|date=6 July 2013|accessdate=13 July 2014}}</ref> He scored his first competitive goal on 17 August, contributing to a 3–0 home success over [[Skoda Xanthi F.C.|Skoda Xanthi FC]], and on 24 November he equalised in a 3–1 win over [[Aris Thessaloniki F.C.]] in the [[Derby of Northern Greece]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sbs.com.au/yourlanguage/content/paok-beats-aris-3-1-greek-league|title=PAOK beats Aris 3–1 in Greek league|publisher=[[Special Broadcasting Service]]|date=25 November 2013|accessdate=3 March 2016}}</ref> he also helped to a [[2013–14 Greek Football Cup|runner-up run]] in the [[Greek Football Cup|national cup]], losing the decisive match to [[Panathinaikos F.C.|Panathinaikos FC]].
On 18 July 2014, Pérez returned to Spain and joined his [[2013–14 Segunda División|newly promoted]] hometown side [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] in a one-year loan deal, with a buyout clause.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://canaldeportivo.com/servlet/es.iris.servlets.Noticias?accion=4&ver=1&nid=28356&mid=14|title=Lucas Pérez firma su contrato y se entrenará mañana sábado en Abegondo|trans-title=Lucas Pérez signs his contract and will train tomorrow Saturday in Abegondo|publisher=Deportivo La Coruña|language=es|date=18 July 2014|accessdate=19 July 2014}}</ref> He scored in his first official appearance, having started in a 3–0 home win against [[Valencia CF]] on 19 October which also marked his [[La Liga]] debut;<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_8/dep_val/|title=Cavaleiro y Lucas Pérez revolucionan al Dépor|trans-title=Cavaleiro and Lucas Pérez shake Dépor up|newspaper=Marca|last=G. Lifona|first=Daniel|language=es|date=19 October 2014|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref> the following matchday he was replaced in the 15th minute of a 0–0 away draw against [[RCD Espanyol]], due to a knee injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_9/esp_dep/|title=El Espanyol echa de menos a Sergio García|trans-title=Espanyol miss Sergio García|newspaper=Marca|last=Aldunate|first=Ramiro|language=es|date=26 October 2014|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lavozdegalicia.es/noticia/deportivo/2014/10/26/lesiones-ceban-lucas-perez/00031414340353577931786.htm|title=Las lesiones se ceban con Lucas Pérez|trans-title=Injuries all over Lucas Pérez|newspaper=[[La Voz de Galicia]]|language=es|date=26 October 2014|accessdate=6 December 2014}}</ref>
Pérez only returned to action in January of the following year,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sport.es/es/noticias/barca/lucas-vuelve-convocatoria-del-deportivo-casi-tres-meses-despues-3860045|title=Lucas vuelve a convocatoria del Deportivo casi tres meses después|trans-title=Lucas returns to a Deportivo callup after nearly three months|newspaper=[[Sport (Spanish newspaper)|Sport]]|language=es|date=17 January 2015|accessdate=26 January 2015}}</ref> appearing 12 minutes in a 0–4 home loss against [[FC Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_19/dep_bar/|title=Vuelve el insaciable Messi|trans-title=The insatiable Messi returns|newspaper=Marca|last=Rincón|first=Jaime|language=es|date=18 January 2015|accessdate=26 January 2015}}</ref> On 23 May, against the same opponent at the [[Camp Nou]], he helped ''Dépor'' come from behind by scoring in the 67th minute of a 2–2 draw in the last round that [[2014–15 La Liga|prevented relegation]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/la-liga/jornada_38/bar_dep/|title=El Barça indulta al Dépor|trans-title=Barça pardon Dépor|newspaper=Marca|last=Aldunate|first=Ramiro|language=es|date=23 May 2015|accessdate=24 May 2015}}</ref>
On 23 July 2015, in his first competitive match upon his return to PAOK, against [[NK Lokomotiva]] for [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League|the second preliminary round]] of the [[UEFA Europa League]], Pérez scored the opener after [[Róbert Mak]]'s shot was saved, in an eventual 6–0 home success.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.paokfc.gr/en/news/20150723-evgale-eksasfero/|title=Like a revolver gun|publisher=PAOK FC|date=23 July 2015|accessdate=26 July 2015}}</ref> One week later, against [[FC Spartak Trnava]] for the same competition, he netted the game's only goal in the first leg.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.naftemporiki.gr/story/984307/europa-league-o-paok-nikise-1-0-tin-spartak-trnaba-kai-elpizei|title=Europa League: Ο ΠΑΟΚ νίκησε 1–0 την Σπάρτακ Τρνάβα και ελπίζει|trans-title=Europa League: PAOK defeat Spartak Trnava 1–0 and hope|newspaper=[[Naftemporiki]]|language=el|date=30 July 2015|accessdate=30 July 2015}}</ref>
On 12 August 2015, Pérez signed a permanent four-year deal with Deportivo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://canaldeportivo.com/servlet/es.iris.servlets.Noticias?accion=4&ver=1&nid=30804&mid=12|title=Lucas Pérez, nuevo jugador del Dépor para las cuatro próximas temporadas|trans-title=Lucas Pérez, new player of Dépor for the following four seasons|publisher=Deportivo La Coruña|language=es|date=12 August 2015|accessdate=12 August 2015}}</ref> On 12 December, he took his [[2015–16 La Liga|season]] tally to 11 goals in only 15 games, helping to a 2–2 draw at Barcelona.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/spanish-primera-division/match/433828/barcelona-deportivo-la-coruna/report|title=Barcelona held by Deportivo La Coruna as Lucas fires comeback|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|date=12 December 2015|accessdate=13 December 2015}}</ref>
Pérez totalled a career-best 17 goals at the end of the campaign, eventually helping his team escape relegation again.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.laopinioncoruna.es/deportivo/2016/09/07/imposible-pedirle-alguien-17-goles/1104198.html|title="Es imposible pedirle a alguien los 17 goles y ocho asistencias de Lucas"|trans-title="You cannot ask of anyone for Lucas' 17 goals and eight assists"|newspaper=La Opinión A Coruña|last=Cobas|first=Eugenio|language=es|date=7 September 2016|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref>
===Arsenal=== On 27 August 2016, [[Arsène Wenger]] said that Pérez had completed a medical examination in order to join [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] after the paperwork was done.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/news/arsenal-boss-confirms-lucas-perez-shkodran-mustafi-signed-video/|title=Arsenal boss confirms Lucas Perez and Shkodran Mustafi have been signed (Video)|publisher=101 Great Goals|date=27 August 2016|accessdate=28 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160828/lucas-perez-signs-for-the-club|title=Lucas Perez completes move to Arsenal|publisher=Arsenal F.C|date=28 August 2016|accessdate=30 August 2016}}</ref> Three days later the transfer was confirmed by the club, for a reported fee of £17.1 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37223120|title=Arsenal sign Shkodran Mustafi for more than £35m and Lucas Perez for £17.1m|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=30 August 2016|accessdate=30 August 2016}}</ref> He made his competitive debut in the 2–1 [[Premier League]] home win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 10 September, which coincided with both his birthday and that of teammate [[Laurent Koscielny]], whom he [[Assist (football)|assisted]] for his team's equaliser.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/arsenal-hand-full-debuts-lucas-8805247|title=Arsenal hand full debuts to Lucas Perez and Shkodran Mustafi for visit of Southampton|newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]]|last=Malyon|first=Ed|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=10 September 2016}}</ref>
On 20 September 2016, during an [[EFL Cup]] away match against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], Pérez scored his first goals for the Gunners, grabbing a brace in an eventual 4–0 triumph for [[2016–17 EFL Cup|the third round]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37346052|title=Nottingham Forest 0–4 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 September 2016|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> On 6 December, he contributed with three goals in 39 minutes to a 4–1 away win over [[FC Basel]] in the [[UEFA Champions League]]'s [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|group stage]], helping Arsenal win the group.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38212188|title=FC Basel 1–4 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Shemilt|first=Stephan|date=6 December 2016|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref>
On 3 January 2017, Pérez netted for the first time in the domestic league, helping his team come back from 3–0 down to draw 3–3 at [[AFC Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38440999|title=AFC Bournemouth 3–3 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Sanghera|first=Mandeep|date=3 January 2017|accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref> Towards the end of the month, he provided an assist to [[Danny Welbeck]]'s first-ever brace for Arsenal, in a [[2016–17 FA Cup|5–0 away win]] against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the [[FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/01/28/southampton-vs-arsenal-fa-cup-live-score-goal-updates/|title=Southampton 0 Arsenal 5, FA Cup: Gunners dispatch sorry Saints as Theo Walcott scores hat-trick and Danny Welbeck grabs a double|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|last=Wallace|first=Sam|date=28 February 2017|accessdate=17 February 2017}}</ref>
On 31 August 2017, Pérez rejoined Deportivo on a [[2017–18 La Liga|season]]-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/4364582/arsenal-transfer-news-lucas-perez-deportivo-everton-loan/|title=Lucas Perez joins former side Deportivo on season-long loan switch from Arsenal|newspaper=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|last=Stonehouse|first=Gary|date=31 August 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== On 9 August 2018, Pérez signed a three-year contract with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] for a reported fee of £4 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45127540|title=West Ham: Lucas Perez and Carlos Sanchez complete transfer deadline day moves|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 August 2018|accessdate=9 August 2018}}</ref> He made his league debut for his new club nine days later, coming on as a 77th-minute [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Mark Noble]] in a 1–2 home loss to Bournemouth.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45153220|title=West Ham United 1–2 AFC Bournemouth|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Emons|first=Michael|date=18 August 2018|accessdate=19 August 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for them on 26 September, in their 8–0 win against [[Macclesfield Town F.C.|Macclesfield Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45569334|title=West Ham 8–0 Macclesfield: Hammers thrash Macclesfield to reach fourth round|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 September 2018|accessdate=27 September 2018}}</ref>
On 4 December 2018, Pérez scored his first league goals for 700 days: coming on for [[Marko Arnautović]], he scored twice in a 3–1 home win against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]], becoming the first West Ham player to achieve the feat as a substitute since [[Paulo Wanchope]] in 2000.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46353458|title=West Ham United 3–1 Cardiff City|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Sanders|first=Emma|date=4 December 2018|accessdate=5 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Pérez earned his first [[Cap (sport)|cap]] for the [[Galicia national football team|Galicia autonomous team]] on 20 May 2016, appearing in the 2–2 [[Exhibition game|friendly]] with [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.lavozdegalicia.es/noticia/futbolgallego/2016/05/20/seleccion-gallega-empata-venezuela-fiesta-futbol/00031463777318128582374.htm|title=La selección gallega empata con Venezuela en su fiesta del fútbol|trans-title=Galicia national team draw with Venezuela in their football party|newspaper=La Voz de Galicia|last=Bouzas|first=Fabián|language=es|date=20 May 2016|accessdate=23 August 2017}}</ref>
